Cover, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook until all water is evaporated and rice is fully cooked, about 45 to 55 minutes.
Remove from heat and cool completely.
When rice is cool, add 0.11 cup orange slices, 0.06 cup basil leaves, 0.04 cup minced red onion, 0.5 tablespoon chopped pistachios, and 0.17 teaspoon finely grated orange zest; mix to incorporate.

For the dressing, combine 0.06 cup red wine vinegar, 0.04 cup olive oil, 0.17 tablespoon orange juice, 0.25 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 0.17 teaspoon honey, and 0.04 teaspoon salt in a metal bowl and whisk to incorporate.
Pour the dressing over the rice mixture and toss to incorporate.

original_instructions: In a large shallow flameproof casserole, melt the butter over medium heat. Saute the onion for 8 to 10 minutes, until softened and golden. Add the broth, peas, parsley, cilantro, sugar, salt, and pepper. Overlap the sausage slices in a circle around the very outside edge of the dish. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce the heat. Simmer for 5 minutes. Break 1 egg into a small saucer and, holding the saucer close to the pan, slide the egg on top of the peas. Repeat with the remaining eggs, grouping them in the center of the sausage ring but keeping them slightly apart from each other. Sprinkle the eggs with salt and pepper, cover the pan tightly, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes more, until the eggs are covered with an opaque film and the white are set, or continue cooking the eggs to your liking. Sprinkle the cilantro over the top and serve from the skillet with a large spoon.
ingredients: 3 (10 ounce) packages thoroughly defrosted petits pois or, if available, 4 pounds fresh peas, shelled and blanched
1/2 small bunch flat leaf parsley, leaves only, finely chopped
6 ounces linguica sausage, or cooked, dry chorizo, sliced 1/4inch thick
1/2 small bunch cilantro, leaves only, finely chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Melt 0.33 tablespoon of unsalted butter in a large shallow flameproof casserole over medium heat.
Saute 0.17 medium white onion, finely chopped, for 8 to 10 minutes until softened and golden.

Add 0.17 cup of chicken broth, 5 ounces of defrosted petits pois, 0.08 of a small bunch of flat leaf parsley leaves, finely chopped, 0.08 teaspoon of sugar, 0.13 teaspoon of salt, and 0.08 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper.
Overlap 1 ounce of linguica sausage slices in a circle around the very outside edge of the dish.
Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce the heat. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Break 1 egg into a small saucer and slide the egg on top of the peas, grouping it in the center of the sausage ring.
Sprinkle the egg with a pinch of salt and pepper, cover the pan tightly, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes more, until the egg is covered with an opaque film and the white is set.
Sprinkle 0.08 of a small bunch of cilantro leaves over the top and serve from the skillet with a large spoon.

original_instructions:
Wash the peanuts in cool water until the water runs clear. Soak in cool water for 30 minutes to loosen any remaining dirt.
Drain and rinse the peanuts. Add the peanuts to a 12-quart pot along with the salt and 3 gallons of water. Stir well. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours. Check the texture of the peanut at this point for doneness. When done, boiled peanuts should have a similar texture to a cooked dry bean. It should hold its shape, but not crunch when bitten. Add more water throughout the cooking process, if needed. If necessary, continue cooking for 3 to 4 hours longer.
Drain the peanuts and store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
*Cook's note: The cooking time can vary greatly depending on how fresh the peanuts are. The fresher the peanut, the less time it will take to cook.
ingredients: 2 pounds in-shell raw Virginia or Valencia peanuts
step_by_step_instructions: Wash approximately 4 ounces of in-shell raw peanuts in cool water until the water runs clear.
Soak the peanuts in cool water for 30 minutes to loosen any remaining dirt.
Drain and rinse the peanuts.
Add the peanuts to a pot along with about 0.6 ounces of kosher salt and 0.6 gallons (about 2.3 liters) of water.
Stir well.
Cover the pot and cook on high for 4 hours.
Check the texture of the peanuts for doneness. They should have a similar texture to a cooked dry bean, holding their shape but not crunchy.
Add more water throughout the cooking process if needed.
If necessary, continue cooking for an additional 3 to 4 hours until the desired texture is achieved.
Drain the peanuts and store them in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

original_instructions:
Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add extra-virgin olive oil or vegetable oil, 1 turn of the pan, add sausage and brown and crumble the meat, 5 or 6 minutes. Remove the sausage from the pan and drain off some of the fat. Return pan to heat and reduce the temperature to medium low.
Whisk together the eggs, half-and-half or milk, hot sauce, salt and pepper. Scramble the eggs until soft, then add cheese and continue to scramble another minute or so to finish cooking eggs and to begin to melt the cheese bits. Remove pan from heat and combine sausage and eggs. Garnish servings of the eggs with a few pieces of diced fresh tomato. Serve plates of sausage scrambles with pancakes, or for a simple supper, serve with toasted whole grain bread, buttered and drizzled with honey.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil or vegetable oil, 1 turn of the pan
1 pound bulk breakfast sausage, such as maple sausage
A splash half-and-half or whole milk
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
Add approximately 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil to the skillet.
Add about 0.25 pounds of breakfast sausage to the skillet and cook, breaking it into crumbles, for 5 to 6 minutes until browned.
Remove the sausage from the skillet and drain excess fat. Return the skillet to heat, reducing it to medium low.
Whisk 2 large eggs with a splash of half-and-half or milk, a few drops of hot sauce, salt, and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and scramble until the eggs are soft.
Add approximately 1.5 ounces of diced Cheddar cheese and continue to cook for another minute until the eggs are fully cooked and the cheese begins to melt.
Remove the skillet from the heat and mix back in the cooked sausage.
Garnish with a few pieces of diced tomato.
Serve the dish with toasted whole grain bread, optionally buttered and drizzled with honey.

original_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Peel and cut the potatoes into chunks. Bring a large pot of water to a simmer and add the potatoes. Bring to a boil and cook until fork tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Drain the potatoes in a large colander. Place them back into the dry pot and put the pot on the stove. Mash the potatoes over low heat, allowing all the steam to escape before adding in all the other ingredients. Turn off the heat and add the 1 1/2 sticks of butter, the cream cheese, heavy cream, seasoned salt, salt and pepper. Mash to combine. Spread the potatoes in a medium buttered baking dish. Throw a few pats of butter if desired over the top of the potatoes and place in the oven until the butter is melted and the potatoes are warmed through, 20 to 30 minutes.
ingredients: 5 pounds russet or Yukon gold potatoes
12 tablespoons (1 1/2 sticks) butter, softened, plus 4 tablespoons (1/2 stick), optional
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Peel and cut approximately 0.5 pounds of potatoes into chunks.
Bring a large pot of water to a simmer and add the potato chunks.
Bring to a boil and cook the potatoes until fork tender, about 20 to 25 minutes.
Drain the potatoes in a large colander.
Place them back into the dry pot and put the pot on the stove.
Mash the potatoes over low heat, allowing all the steam to escape before adding other ingredients.

Turn off the heat and add about 1.5 tablespoons of butter, 1 ounce of cream cheese, 0.13 cups of heavy cream, 0.13 teaspoons of seasoned salt, 0.06 teaspoons of salt, and 0.13 teaspoons of black pepper.
Mash to combine.
Spread the mashed potatoes in a small buttered baking dish.
Optionally, add a few small pats of butter over the top of the potatoes.
Place in the oven until the butter is melted and the potatoes are warmed through, about 20 to 30 minutes.

original_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Boil the potatoes in salted water for 15 minutes, or until tender. Drain, place on a sheet pan, and bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven and transfer to a large bowl. Add the butter to the bowl and mix with an electric mixer until smooth. Add the cream until it reaches the desired consistency. Stir in the poblanos and season to taste with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 2 roasted poblanos, peeled, seeded, and diced
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Boil 1 Idaho potato in salted water for 15 minutes, or until tender.
Drain the potato, place on a sheet pan, and bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Remove the potato from the oven and transfer to a large bowl.
Add 0.67 tablespoon butter to the bowl and mix with an electric mixer until smooth.
Add 0.11 cup heavy whipping cream until it reaches the desired consistency.
Stir in 0.33 roasted poblano and season to taste with salt and pepper.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Combine all ingredients except crackers, adding enough milk to make dip consistency. Place in a small baking dish and bake for 15 minutes. Serve hot on crackers.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.

Combine 1 ounce of ricotta, 3 ounces of crabmeat, 0.5 tablespoons of instant chopped onions, 0.125 teaspoon of prepared horseradish, 0.125 teaspoon of pepper, and 0.5 to 1 tablespoon of milk to make a dip consistency.
Place the mixture in a small baking dish.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Serve hot on crackers.

original_instructions:
Shake flour, salt and pepper in a plastic bag. Add chicken pieces in batches to coat. Heat butter over medium heat in a skillet and brown each side of the coated chicken. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the chicken and add capers. Remove to a platter and set aside in a warm place.
To the same pan add butter for the sauce and mix with flour to make a roux. Gradually add chicken broth and allow thickening. Strain sauce, if desired, and serve spooned over chicken.
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breasts, sliced thin and pounded into cutlets
1 lemon, halved crosswise and seeds removed
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 2 tablespoons flour, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/16 teaspoon pepper in a plastic bag.
Add 4 ounces chicken breast cutlet to the bag and shake to coat.
Heat 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat in a skillet.
Brown the chicken cutlet on each side for about 3-4 minutes until golden brown.
Squeeze juice from 1/4 of a lemon over the chicken and add 1/2 teaspoon capers.
Remove the chicken to a warm platter and set aside.
In the same pan, add 1 tablespoon butter for the sauce.
Mix in 1 tablespoon flour to make a roux.
Gradually add 1/8 cup hot chicken broth and stir until thickened.
Strain the sauce if desired and spoon over the chicken before serving.

original_instructions: Combine the mushrooms and onions in a bowl and add the lemon zest, lemon juice, salt and pepper, to taste, the fennel and the red pepper flakes. Let stand until softened and slumped, about 20 minutes. Chop the spinach and arrange in large shallow bowl, top with the mushrooms and onion mixture and gently toss to wilt spinach.
ingredients: 6 to 8 very large white mushroom caps, very thinly sliced
1 small red onion, very thinly sliced
1 teaspoon ground fennel or a sprinkle of fennel seeds
3 bundles farm spinach, trimmed and washed
step_by_step_instructions: Combine about 1 large mushroom cap (approximately 50g) and 1/8 of a small red onion (approximately 12.5g) in a bowl.

Add approximately 0.33 teaspoons of lemon zest, juice from half a lemon, 0.5 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil, salt and pepper to taste, about 0.17 teaspoons of ground fennel or a pinch of fennel seeds, and about 0.08 teaspoons of crushed red pepper flakes to the bowl.
Let the mixture stand until softened and slumped, about 20 minutes.
Chop about 1/3 of a bundle of spinach (approximately 30g) and arrange in a large shallow bowl.
Top the spinach with the mushroom and onion mixture and gently toss to wilt the spinach.

original_instructions:
Set smoker at 350 degrees F.
Wash each rack under water. Pat dry. Place racks on a wood-burning smoker. A hickory wood fire is best. Smoke ribs for 30 minutes. Remove ribs from smoker and rub each side with the rib rub. Return the ribs to smoker and smoke at 350 degrees F for about 1 hour 30 minutes. Remove ribs and cool completely. When cool, cut ribs into individual sections. Dip each rib into pre-wash solution then the breading mixture, lightly dredging. Shake off the excess then dip into wash again and then the breading mixture.
Place ribs into a 350-degree F deep fryer and cook for 5 minutes or until golden brown. You will have to do multiple batches. Serve with your favorite barbecue sauce for dipping.
ingredients: Pepper, salt, and Cajun spices, to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Set the smoker to 350 degrees F.
Wash a portion of a rack of ribs (approximately one-sixth of a rack) under water and pat dry.
Place the portion on a wood-burning smoker with a hickory wood fire and smoke for 5 minutes.
Remove the ribs from the smoker and rub each side with rib rub.
Return the ribs to the smoker and smoke at 350 degrees F for about 15 minutes.
Remove the ribs from the smoker and let them cool completely.
Cut the cooled ribs into individual sections.
Prepare the pre-wash solution by mixing a small amount of milk, eggs, and beer.
Prepare the breading mixture by combining all-purpose flour, pepper, salt, and Cajun spices to taste.
Dip each rib section into the pre-wash solution and then lightly dredge in the breading mixture.
Shake off the excess breading, then dip again into the wash and dredge once more in the breading mixture.
Heat peanut oil in a deep fryer to 350 degrees F.
Place the rib sections into the deep fryer and cook for 5 minutes or until golden brown.
Repeat frying in batches if necessary.
Serve the ribs with your favorite barbecue sauce for dipping.

original_instructions:
Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. Place the halves face up on a muffin tin so they won't tip over. Pour the beaten egg into each hole (one egg fills two halves). Sprinkle with grated cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Bake at 375° F for 15 to 20 minutes or until desired egg hardness.
Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. Place the halves face up on a muffin tin so they won't tip over.
Pour the beaten egg into each hole (one egg fills two halves). Sprinkle with grated cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Bake at 375° F for 15 to 20 minutes or until desired egg hardness.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Cut the avocado in half and remove the pit.
Place the halves face up on a muffin tin so they won't tip over.
Pour the beaten egg into each hole (one egg fills two halves).
Sprinkle with grated cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Bake at 375° F for 15 to 20 minutes or until desired egg hardness.

recipe_title: Tuna Tartare on Fried Potato Gaufrettes
original_instructions:
Preheat a deep pot of oil or a deep fryer to 325 degrees F.
In a bowl, combine the tuna, green onions, ginger, wasabi, sesame oil, soy sauce and lime juice, and mix until well blended. Taste and adjust seasoning with lime juice or soy sauce. Set bowl over ice.
Deep-fry the potato gaufrettes until crisp and golden. Drain onto a paper towel lined plate and season with salt.
Place a spoonful of the tuna tartare on one end of each potato gaufrette. Repeat process until you have enough to arrange on a serving platter. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound potato, waffle sliced on a mandolin
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a deep pot of oil or a deep fryer to 325 degrees F.

In a bowl, combine 2 ounces of diced ahi tuna, 1 tablespoon of minced green onions, 0.2 teaspoon of minced fresh ginger, 0.2 teaspoon of wasabi paste, 0.1 teaspoon of sesame oil, 1 tablespoon of soy sauce and a splash of lime juice. Mix until well blended.
Taste the tuna mixture and adjust seasoning with additional lime juice or soy sauce as needed.
Set the bowl with the tuna mixture over ice to keep it cool.
Deep-fry approximately 4 ounces of potato gaufrettes until they are crisp and golden.
Drain the fried potato gaufrettes onto a paper towel lined plate and season with a pinch of salt.
Place a spoonful of the tuna tartare on one end of each potato gaufrette.
Arrange the prepared potato gaufrettes on a serving platter.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add the beans and cook for just 1 to 2 minutes, until the beans turn bright green. Strain them and run under cold water to stop them from cooking.
Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the almonds and toast them until golden brown, about 4 minutes, shaking the pan often to avoid burning the almonds. Remove the toasted almonds from the pan.
Return the skillet to the burner and increase the heat to medium-high. Heat the olive oil in the pan and add a few pinches of salt, the garlic, ginger, and chili flakes. Cook just until the garlic starts to brown. Add the vinegar and let cook down for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove pan from heat and toss in the beans to coat them thoroughly and evenly with the dressing.
Serve on a platter and scatter the top with the toasted almonds.
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a small pot of salted water to a boil.
Add approximately 4 ounces of string beans to the boiling water and cook for just 1 to 2 minutes, until the beans turn bright green.
Strain the beans and run them under cold water to stop them from cooking.
Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add about 2 tablespoons of sliced almonds to the skillet and toast them until golden brown, about 4 minutes, shaking the pan often to avoid burning the almonds.
Remove the toasted almonds from the pan.
Return the skillet to the burner and increase the heat to medium-high.
Heat approximately 2 tablespoons of olive oil in the pan and add a pinch of salt, 1 smashed garlic clove, a small amount of grated ginger, and a pinch of dried red chili flakes.
Cook just until the garlic starts to brown.
Add about 1 tablespoon of red wine vinegar and let cook down for 1 to 2 minutes.
Remove the pan from heat and toss in the beans to coat them thoroughly and evenly with the dressing.
Serve the beans on a platter and scatter the top with the toasted almonds.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Place cauliflower and broccoli into a 9 by 13 inch baking dish, toss with the olive oil, and sprinkle with salt. Cover the dish and bake for 1/2 hour. Remove the cover, stir and cook for 30 to 40 minutes more, until vegetables are tender and nicely browned, stirring occasionally.
ingredients: 1 small head cauliflower (2 pounds), cut into florets
2 large stalks broccoli (1 pound), cut into florets
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Cut the cauliflower and broccoli into florets.
Place approximately 170g of cauliflower florets and 85g of broccoli florets into a baking dish.
Add 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil and 0.06 teaspoon of salt to the dish.
Toss the vegetables to coat them with oil and salt.
Cover the dish with a lid or foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
Remove the cover, stir the vegetables.
Continue to bake uncovered for an additional 15 to 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and browned.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Rub a baking dish with garlic clove and then with butter.
In a medium saucepan, combine potatoes, milk, water, bay leaf and pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, stir, reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Drain the potatoes and layer half of them in the buttered baking dish. Sprinkle on half of the cheese and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Spread out remaining potatoes and top with remaining cheese and seasoning. Pour heavy cream over potatoes. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until golden and bubbly.
ingredients: 4 large russet potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Rub a small portion of a baking dish with 0.25 clove of garlic and then with 0.5 tablespoon butter.
In a medium saucepan, combine 1 potato (about 0.25 of the total), 0.25 cup milk, 0.25 cup water, 0.25 bay leaf, and a pinch of salt.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then stir, reduce heat, and simmer until the potatoes are tender.
Drain the potatoes and layer half of them in the buttered baking dish.
Sprinkle on 0.375 cup grated Swiss cheese and season with salt, pepper, and a small amount of nutmeg.
Spread out the remaining potatoes and top with another 0.375 cup Swiss cheese and seasoning.
Pour 0.167 cup heavy cream over the potatoes.
Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until golden and bubbly.

original_instructions:
Heat 2 teaspoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add eggs and cook 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until cooked through and scrambled. Remove eggs from pan and set aside.
To the same skillet over medium heat, add remaining 2 teaspoons oil. Add scallions, carrots and garlic and saute 2 minutes. Add rice and pork; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add black bean sauce and stir to coat rice. If the black bean sauce is overly thick, add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 5 minutes, until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and season, to taste, with salt and black pepper. Stir in cooked egg just before serving.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 1 teaspoon of peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add 0.5 large eggs and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until cooked through and scrambled.
Remove eggs from pan and set aside.
To the same skillet over medium heat, add remaining 1 teaspoon oil.
Add 1 tablespoon chopped scallions, 2 tablespoons carrots, and 1 clove garlic; saute for 2 minutes.
Add 0.5 cup leftover white rice and 0.25 cup diced cooked pork; cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add 1 tablespoon black bean sauce and stir to coat rice.
If the black bean sauce is overly thick, add 1 tablespoon chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes, until liquid is absorbed.
Fluff with a fork and season, to taste, with salt and black pepper.
Stir in cooked egg just before serving.

original_instructions: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the turkey and cook until the color changes, about 5 minutes. Next add the onions and cook till translucent. Then add the garlic and cook for another 2 minutes. Next add the stock, hot sauce, chipotles, tomato paste, chili powder and cumin. Cook it on very low heat, covered, for about 40 minutes. Add three-quarters of the bacon, saving one-quarter for garnish, and cook for an additional 20 minutes, uncovered. Add salt if needed. Serve topped with the chopped bacon and sliced avocado with tortilla chips.
ingredients: 1 cup hot sauce, such as Frank's Hot Sauce
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.25 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add 0.5 pound of ground turkey and cook until the color changes, about 5 minutes.
Add 0.5 of a large onion, chopped, and cook until translucent.
Add 0.5 clove of garlic, crushed, and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add 0.25 cup of chicken stock, 0.125 cup of hot sauce, 0.06 cup of canned chipotles, 0.03 cup of tomato paste, 0.375 tablespoon of chili powder, and 0.125 teaspoon of ground cumin to the pot.
Cook on very low heat, covered, for about 40 minutes.
Add 0.25 pound of cooked and chopped bacon, saving a small portion for garnish, and cook for an additional 20 minutes, uncovered.
Add salt if needed.
Serve topped with the reserved chopped bacon and 0.25 of a ripe avocado, sliced, along with tortilla chips.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
In 2 (13 by 9-inch) pans place tomato halves cut side up. Sprinkle with oil, salt and pepper, onion, garlic, and herbs. Bake tomatoes for 2 hours. Check the tomatoes after 1 hour and turn down the heat if they seem to be cooking too quickly. Then turn the oven to 400 degrees and bake another 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and process tomatoes through a food mill on medium dye setting over a small saucepan. Discard skins. Add white wine, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
In a 13 by 9-inch pan, place approximately 5 Roma tomato halves cut side up.

Sprinkle with about 1.25 tablespoons olive oil, 0.06 teaspoon kosher salt, 0.12 teaspoon pepper, 0.25 cup finely diced onion, 0.5 teaspoon minced garlic, 0.25 tablespoon finely chopped oregano leaves, and 0.25 tablespoon finely chopped thyme leaves.
Bake tomatoes for 2 hours.
Check the tomatoes after 1 hour and turn down the heat if they seem to be cooking too quickly.
Turn the oven to 400 degrees and bake for another 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and process tomatoes through a food mill on medium dye setting over a small saucepan.
Discard skins.
Add about 0.25 cup white wine, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook for 5 minutes.

original_instructions: Rinse the tomatoes, remove the stems, and cut them into halves or quarters. Leave tiny currant tomatoes whole. Put in a bowl with the shallot, season with a pinch of salt and freshly ground pepper, then toss with the olive oil and marjoram. Taste the salad and add a little balsamic vinegar if needed or desired.
ingredients: 1 pint basket of small tomatoes: cherry, red or golden currant tomatoes, yellow pear
Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
2 teaspoons chopped marjoram or torn basil leaves
Few drops balsamic vinegar, to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Rinse about 7.50 oz (half of the pint basket) of small tomatoes and remove the stems.
Cut the tomatoes into halves or quarters, leaving tiny currant tomatoes whole.
Place the tomatoes in a bowl.
Finely dice half of a shallot and add it to the bowl with the tomatoes.
Season the mixture with a pinch of salt and freshly ground pepper.
Add about 0.50 tbsp of extra-virgin olive oil to the bowl.
Chop or tear about 1 tsp of marjoram or basil leaves and add to the mixture.
Toss the ingredients together to combine.
Taste the salad and add a few drops of balsamic vinegar if needed or desired.

original_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degree F.
2. Cut tips off wings; cut wings in half at joint. Combine cayenne pepper sauce, Spread and ground cayenne pepper in bowl. Stir in wings until coated.
3. Arrange wings in roasting pan or bottom of broiler pan, without the rack. Bake 1 hour or until wings are thoroughly cooked and crisp. Serve with 1/2 cup of your favorite Dressing.
*Use more or less as desired
**Also terrific with Wish-Bone Light or Fat Free! Chunky Blue Cheese Dressing.
ingredients: 1/3 cup I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! Spread, melted
1/2 cup Wish-Bone Chunky Blue Cheese Dressing or your favorite Wish-Bone creamy dressing, such as Buffalo Blue Cheese, Chunky Blue Cheese, or Ranch
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Cut the tips off approximately 3 chicken wings and cut them in half at the joint.
In a bowl, combine 1.5 tablespoons of cayenne pepper sauce, 0.75 tablespoons of melted butter spread, and a pinch of ground cayenne pepper.
Stir the chicken wings into the sauce until they are coated.
Arrange the wings in a roasting pan or the bottom of a broiler pan without the rack.
Bake the wings in the oven for about 1 hour or until they are thoroughly cooked and crisp.
Serve the wings with approximately 1 tablespoon of chunky blue cheese dressing.

recipe_title: MYOTO - Make Your Own Take Out: Thai Chicken Noodle Soup
original_instructions: Heat a large heavy-bottomed soup pot with vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan, over high heat. Once you see the oil ripple, add the sliced onion, chopped garlic and sliced peppers. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper and cook, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes. Add 1 cup shredded carrot and 6 cups chicken stock or broth. Cover with a lid and bring up to a simmer. Once simmering, add the chicken simmer 5 minutes then add noodles and simmer 5 minutes more. Remove the soup from the heat and add the cilantro, basil and the juice of 1 lime.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, 2 turns of the pan
1 medium size yellow onion, peeled, quartered and thinly sliced
3 garlic cloves, peeled and finely chopped
2 poblano or anaheim peppers, seeded and thinly sliced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 cup shredded carrots, available in pouches in the produce department
1 1/2 pound chicken tenders cut into bite size chunks, 2 packages
2 small bundles from a 3.75 ounce package of bean thread noodles, there is usually 3 bundles in one package (recommended: Kame)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large heavy-bottomed soup pot with 0.33 tablespoons vegetable oil over high heat.
Once you see the oil ripple, add 0.17 medium size yellow onion (peeled, quartered, and thinly sliced), 1 finely chopped garlic clove, and 0.33 poblano pepper (seeded and thinly sliced).
Season the vegetables with a pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper and cook, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes.
Add 0.17 cup shredded carrot and 1 cup chicken broth. Cover with a lid and bring up to a simmer.
Once simmering, add 0.25 pound chicken tenders (cut into bite-size chunks) and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add approximately 0.67 ounces of bean thread noodles and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove the soup from the heat and add 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro, 5 chopped fresh basil leaves, and the juice of 0.33 lime.

original_instructions:
Bring water to a boil in a heavy medium saucepan. Add rice and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until rice is tender, about 40 minutes. Drain in a sieve. Heat butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides. Add nuts and cook, stirring, until butter and nuts are golden brown, about 4 minutes. Add rice and nutmeg to skillet and toss to coat.
Bring water to a boil in a heavy medium saucepan. Add rice and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until rice is tender, about 40 minutes. Drain in a sieve.
Heat butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides. Add nuts and cook, stirring, until butter and nuts are golden brown, about 4 minutes.
Add rice and nutmeg to skillet and toss to coat.
step_by_step_instructions: Bring 1 cup of water to a boil in a heavy medium saucepan.
Add 0.375 cups short-grain brown rice and a small pinch of salt, then reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until rice is tender, about 40 minutes.
Drain the rice in a sieve.
Heat 0.75 tablespoons unsalted butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides.
Add 0.3125 cups mixed nuts, chopped, and cook, stirring, until butter and nuts are golden brown, about 4 minutes.
Add the drained rice and a small pinch of grated nutmeg to the skillet and toss to coat.

original_instructions:
In a small saute pan over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and saute shallot until translucent. Add mushrooms, garlic, carrots and saute for 10 to 15 minutes, until most of the liquid from mushrooms has evaporated. Remove from heat and pour mixture into a large bowl. Let cool. Stir in parsley, bread crumbs, egg, balsamic vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. The mixing spoon should stand in the mixture. If not, add more bread crumbs Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Shape mushroom mixture into 4 burgers. Heat remaining oil in a large saute pan over medium high heat and sear until golden on both sides. Crumble cheese over the top and place pan in oven for 15 minutes until lightly browned. Remove each burger to a bun and serve with traditional garnish of sliced onion, tomato and fries.
ingredients: 1/4 bunch of Italian parsley, washed, stems removed, finely chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon olive oil in a small saute pan over medium heat.
Saute 0.25 shallot until translucent.
Add 0.5 pound portobello mushrooms, 0.06 cup button mushrooms, 0.5 garlic clove, and 0.13 cup carrots to the pan.
Saute for 2.5 minutes until most of the liquid from the mushrooms has evaporated.
Remove from heat and pour the mixture into a large bowl. Let cool.
Stir in 0.06 bunch of parsley, 0.5 cup bread crumbs, 0.25 egg, 0.38 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste.
Ensure the mixing spoon can stand in the mixture. If not, add more bread crumbs.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Shape the mushroom mixture into 1 burger.
Heat 0.25 tablespoon olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat.
Sear the burger until golden on both sides.
Crumble 1 ounce Stilton cheese over the top.
Place the pan in the oven for 15 minutes until lightly browned.
Remove the burger to a bun and serve with traditional garnish of sliced onion, tomato, and fries.

original_instructions:
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Place the pizza dough on the grill. Let cook for 1 minute, and then flip with tongs. Move to a cooler spot on the grill (about medium heat). Brush with the olive oil and top with the corn, tomatoes and mozzarella. Cover the grill and cook until the cheese melts and the dough is crisp, about 4 minutes. Top with the scallions and basil.
ingredients: 8 ounces prepared pizza dough, formed into a circle
1 ear of corn, kernels cut from the cob
1/4 cup grape tomatoes, sliced in half
1 tablespoon very thinly sliced scallions (white ends)
2 fresh basil leaves, torn into pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Place approximately 4 ounces of pizza dough on the grill.
Let cook for 1 minute, then flip the dough with tongs.
Move the dough to a cooler spot on the grill set to medium heat.
Brush the dough with about 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil.
Top the dough with around 0.5 ounce of corn kernels, 2 tablespoons of sliced grape tomatoes, and enough fresh mozzarella slices to cover lightly.
Cover the grill and cook until the cheese melts and the dough is crisp, about 4 minutes.
Top the cooked pizza with about 0.5 tablespoon of thinly sliced scallions and 1 torn fresh basil leaf.

original_instructions:
Heat 2 inches of oil in a heavy saucepan or fryer to 375 degrees.
Grate the sweet potatoes into medium-sized bowl, cover them with boiling water, and let them stand for 15 minutes. Drain off the water and slowly add the remaining ingredients, stirring to make sure that they are well mixed. You should have a thickish paste that will hold its shape when picked up in a tablespoon. If the mixture is too thick, add a bit of warm water. If it is too thin, add a bit more flour.
Drop the mixture, a few tablespoons at a time, into the hot oil and cook the fritters for 3 to 5 minutes, or until they float to the surface, turning them once to make sure that they are slightly browned on each side. Drain on absorbent paper and serve hot.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 2 inches of oil in a heavy saucepan or fryer to 375 degrees.
Grate approximately 113 grams of sweet potatoes into a medium-sized bowl.
Cover them with boiling water and let them stand for 15 minutes.
Drain off the water and slowly add approximately 28 grams of flour, a quarter of a beaten egg, salt, and pepper to taste, stirring to make sure that they are well mixed.
Ensure you have a thickish paste that will hold its shape when picked up in a tablespoon. Adjust with a bit of warm water if too thick or a bit more flour if too thin.
Drop the mixture, a few tablespoons at a time, into the hot oil.
Cook the fritters for 3 to 5 minutes, or until they float to the surface, turning them once to make sure they are slightly browned on each side.
Drain on absorbent paper and serve hot.

recipe_title: Pan Fried Potatoes with Paprika and Lemon
original_instructions:
Heat oil in heavy large pot over high heat. Add potatoes and sauté until beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion; sauté until onion is just tender, about 5 minutes. Mix in paprika. Cook until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle potato mixture with lemon juice and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in heavy large pot over high heat. Add potatoes and sauté until beginning to brown, about 12 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Add onion; sauté until onion is just tender, about 5 minutes. Mix in paprika. Cook until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle potato mixture with lemon juice and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 2 1/4 pounds russet potatoes, unpeeled, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a heavy large pot over high heat.
Add approximately 6 ounces of russet potatoes, unpeeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces, and sauté until beginning to brown, about 12 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium.
Add 1/4 of a medium onion, chopped, and sauté until onion is just tender, about 5 minutes.
Mix in 0.25 teaspoon of paprika.
Cook until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle potato mixture with 0.5 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice and 0.5 tablespoon of chopped fresh Italian parsley.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipe_title: Smoked Turkey Leg and Green Bean Salad
original_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat and add the string beans. Blanch until bright green, about 3 minutes, then transfer to an ice bath. Warm the butter and the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, a pinch of salt and pepper, and cook until they are softened but have no color. Add the bell pepper to the skillet and continue to saute another 2 minutes. Strain the string beans and pat dry. Add the beans, tomatoes, turkey and lemon juice and stir until all ingredients are evenly incorporated and warm. Transfer to a serving bowl, top with toasted pine nuts and serve.
ingredients: 1 pound string beans, ends trimmed, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small red onion, sliced in half moons
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 red bell pepper, seeded and julienned
6 sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, chopped
Meat from 1 (1-pound) smoked turkey leg, skin removed and meat roughly chopped, 10 ounces
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat.
Add approximately 113.40 g of string beans. Blanch until bright green, about 3 minutes.
Transfer the blanched beans to an ice bath.
Warm 0.50 tbsp of butter and 0.50 tbsp of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add approximately 0.13 of a small red onion (sliced into half moons) and 0.50 clove of minced garlic to the skillet.
Add a pinch of salt and pepper.
Cook until the onion and garlic are softened but have no color.
Add approximately 0.17 of a red bell pepper (julienned) to the skillet and continue to sauté for another 2 minutes.
Strain the string beans and pat dry.
Add the beans, approximately 1 chopped sun-dried tomato packed in oil, approximately 56.70 g of roughly chopped smoked turkey leg meat, and 0.50 tbsp of lemon juice to the skillet.
Stir until all ingredients are evenly incorporated and warm.
Transfer to a serving bowl, top with approximately 1 tbsp of toasted pine nuts, and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss to coat potatoes. Transfer potatoes to a large baking sheet or shallow roasting pan. Roast 25 to 30 minutes, until tender and golden.
ingredients: 6 to 8 small red potatoes, quartered into 1/2-inch pieces
1 tablespoon olive oil or garlic-flavored olive oil
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Quarter 1 small red potato into 1/2-inch pieces.
Combine potato pieces, 0.50 tablespoon olive oil, 0.50 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary leaves, 0.08 teaspoon salt, and 0.04 teaspoon ground black pepper in a large bowl.
Toss to coat the potato pieces evenly with the oil and seasonings.
Transfer the coated potato pieces to a large baking sheet or shallow roasting pan.
Roast the potato pieces in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, until tender and golden.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: a piping bag
Put the eggs in a pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a simmer, then remove from the heat, cover and let sit 10 minutes. Drain, cool and peel the eggs. Cut off the top third of each egg and scoop out the yolks into a medium bowl.
Mash the yolks with a fork. Add the mayonnaise, mustard, chives, hot sauce and paprika and mix until well blended. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the yolk mixture to a piping bag and pipe back into the whites. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Put 2 eggs in a pot and cover with cold water.
Bring to a simmer, then remove from the heat, cover and let sit for 10 minutes.
Drain, cool and peel the eggs.
Cut off the top third of each egg and scoop out the yolks into a medium bowl.
Mash the yolks with a fork.
Add 0.33 tbsp mayonnaise, 0.5 tsp mustard, 0.25 tsp chopped chives, 0.16 tsp hot sauce, and 0.16 tsp paprika to the yolks and mix until well blended.
Taste and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the yolk mixture to a piping bag and pipe back into the whites.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a large Dutch oven or heavy pot set over medium heat, cook the bacon, stirring occasionally until crisp, about 5 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to scoop out the bacon and transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate. Reserve the bacon fat in the pot and continue to heat over medium heat. Add the lima beans, corn, broth, onions and garlic, and bring to a simmer. Cook until the vegetables are heated through, about 15 minutes. Stir in the kale and cook until the kale begins to wilt, 3 to 5 minutes, and then add the butter, reserved bacon and some salt and pepper to serve.
ingredients: 5 slices applewood smoked bacon, cut into 1-by-1/4-inch pieces
6 cups frozen or fresh lima beans
4 cups frozen or fresh corn kernels
3 cups finely shredded kale or collard greens
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: In a large Dutch oven or heavy pot set over medium heat, cook approximately 0.83 ounces of bacon, stirring occasionally until crisp, about 5 minutes.
Use a slotted spoon to scoop out the bacon and transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate.
Reserve the bacon fat in the pot and continue to heat over medium heat.
Add approximately 1 cup of lima beans, 0.67 cup of corn, 0.33 cup of chicken broth, 0.33 cup of cipollini onions, and 0.5 clove of garlic, and bring to a simmer.
Cook until the vegetables are heated through, about 15 minutes.
Stir in approximately 0.5 cup of kale and cook until the kale begins to wilt, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add 0.67 tablespoon of butter, the reserved bacon, and some salt and pepper to taste before serving.

original_instructions: Cut the white bread into cubes. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan and fry the bread cubes in it until golden brown. Add the garlic and let it color a little. Season with the paprika powders and salt and pour on the meat stock. Cover and leave to simmer for about 15 minutes. Fill 4 earthenware bowls with soup. Carefully slip 1 egg into each bowl and leave to cook in a preheated oven at about 390 degree F for around 10 minutes. Serve the soup very hot.;
step_by_step_instructions: Cut approximately 2 slices of stale white bread into cubes.
Heat 1.5 tablespoons of olive oil in a saucepan and fry the bread cubes until golden brown.
Add about 1.5 to 2 cloves of chopped garlic and let it color a little.
Season with 0.25 tablespoon of mild paprika powder and 0.25 tablespoon of hot paprika powder, and a pinch of salt.
Pour approximately 1 cup of meat stock into the saucepan.
Cover and leave to simmer for about 15 minutes.
Fill an earthenware bowl with the soup.
Carefully slip 1 egg into the bowl.
Leave to cook in a preheated oven at about 390 degrees F for around 10 minutes.
Serve the soup very hot.

original_instructions: Arrange sliced veggies on a platter and squirt lime juice over them. Season vegetables with salt, chili powder and cayenne, then serve.
ingredients: 1/2 seedless European cucumber (super long and wrapped in plastic) thinly sliced on an angle into ovals
4 small celery stalks from the heart, cut into 4-inch pieces
1/2 green bell pepper, cut into thin strips
Several drops hot sauce or a sprinkle of cayenne pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Arrange approximately 3 ounces of sliced vegetables on a platter.
Squirt juice from 0.25 lime over the vegetables.
Season the vegetables with 0.12 teaspoon of salt, 0.5 teaspoon of chili powder, and a sprinkle of cayenne pepper.
Serve the seasoned vegetables immediately.

original_instructions:
Make the Bordelaise Garnish: Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and thyme and cook 5 minutes longer. Add the wine and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Discard the thyme.
Make the Seared Cod: Heat the olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Season the fillets with salt and pepper and slip them into the pan, skin side down, along with the garlic and thyme. Sear the fillets for 3 minutes, turn them over and cook for 3 minutes more. Reduce the heat to medium, add the butter and cook another 3 minutes, or until the fish is opaque, moist and lightly firm when pressed.
Spoon the Bordelaise Garnish onto a serving platter, top with the seared cod, and sprinkle with parsley.
ingredients: 6 sprigs flat-leaf parsley, leaves finely chopped
4 (6-ounce) center-cut cod fillets, skin left on
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Melt 0.5 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon of finely chopped shallots and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add 3 ounces of sliced mushrooms and 0.5 sprigs of thyme, and cook 5 minutes longer.
Add 2 ounces of dry red wine and cook until the liquid is reduced by half.
Discard the thyme.
Heat 0.25 tablespoons of olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Season 1 (6-ounce) cod fillet with salt and pepper.
Slip the fillet into the pan, skin side down, along with 1 clove of lightly crushed garlic and 1 sprig of thyme.
Sear the fillet for 3 minutes, turn it over and cook for 3 minutes more.
Reduce the heat to medium, add 0.25 tablespoons of butter and cook another 3 minutes, or until the fish is opaque, moist, and lightly firm when pressed.
Spoon the Bordelaise Garnish onto a serving platter, top with the seared cod, and sprinkle with 1.5 sprigs of finely chopped parsley leaves.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat large nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
Combine lime juice, hot sauce, cumin, red pepper flakes and seafood seasoning blend.
Quickly saute garlic and shallots in oil and butter for 1 minute, add shrimp and cook 3 minutes, tossing and turning frequently. Dump pink, firm, cooked shrimp from hot pan into hot seasoning blend and toss in seasoning mixture to coat shrimp evenly. Garnish with chopped chives. Serve warm or chilled.
ingredients: 2 ounces (1/4 cup) hot cayenne pepper sauce
2 pounds jumbo shrimp peeled and de-veined* (See Cook's Note)
12 to 15 blades fresh chives, chopped, for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat.
Combine the juice of 0.25 lime, 0.5 ounce hot cayenne pepper sauce, 0.25 teaspoon ground cumin, 0.06 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, and 0.25 tablespoon crab boil seasoning.
Quickly saute 1 clove garlic and 0.5 shallot in 0.25 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil and 0.5 tablespoon butter for 1 minute.
Add 0.25 pound jumbo shrimp and cook for 3 minutes, tossing and turning frequently.
Transfer the pink, firm, cooked shrimp from the hot pan into the hot seasoning blend and toss to coat the shrimp evenly.
Garnish with 3 chopped chives.
Serve warm or chilled.

recipe_title: Spring Greens Sauté with Bacon and Walnuts
original_instructions:
Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium-low heat. Add bacon; sauté until almost crisp, about 6 minutes. Add walnuts; sauté 1 minute. Add greens and toss until wilted but still bright green, 5 to 7 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowl. Sprinkle with cheese, if desired, and serve.
Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium-low heat. Add bacon; sauté until almost crisp, about 6 minutes. Add walnuts; sauté 1 minute. Add greens and toss until wilted but still bright green, 5 to 7 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowl. Sprinkle with cheese, if desired, and serve.
ingredients: 1 bunch dandelion greens, Swiss chard, or mustard greens (about 12 ounces), tough bottom stems removed, leaves cut into 1-inch pieces (about 8 cups)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoon of olive oil in a heavy large skillet over medium-low heat.
Add 0.33 ounce of chopped bacon; sauté until almost crisp, about 6 minutes.
Add 0.17 cup of chopped walnuts; sauté 1 minute.
Add 2.67 cups of chopped dandelion greens and toss until wilted but still bright green, 5 to 7 minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a bowl.
Sprinkle with 0.67 tablespoon of grated Gruyère cheese, if desired, and serve.

original_instructions:
Place the flour in a shallow bowl or plate. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg and 1 tablespoon water. In another shallow bowl or plate, combine the panko, cilantro, salt and pepper.
Begin by coating the mozzarella sticks in batches of 2, first dredging in the flour mixture and shaking off excess. Then dip in the egg mixture, letting any excess drip off. Finish by dredging in the panko crumb mixture and shaking any off excess. Transfer the breaded cheese sticks to a sheet pan greased with nonstick cooking spray. Cover and freeze until frozen, about 4 hours and up to 2 days (this will lessen the oozing of the cheese).
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Lightly spray the cheese sticks with nonstick cooking spray. Bake until the cheese is soft and the sticks are lightly browned, about 12 minutes.
step_by_step_instructions: Place approximately 0.06 cup of all-purpose flour in a shallow bowl or plate.
In a separate bowl, whisk together approximately 0.08 of an egg and 0.06 tablespoon water.
In another shallow bowl or plate, combine approximately 0.19 cup of panko breadcrumbs, 0.25 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, 0.13 teaspoon salt, and a small pinch of freshly ground black pepper.
Begin by coating about 1 mozzarella stick, first dredging in the flour mixture and shaking off excess.
Then dip the mozzarella stick in the egg mixture, letting any excess drip off.
Finish by dredging the mozzarella stick in the panko crumb mixture and shaking any off excess.
Transfer the breaded cheese stick to a sheet pan greased with nonstick cooking spray.
Cover and freeze until frozen, about 4 hours and up to 2 days.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Lightly spray the cheese stick with nonstick cooking spray.
Bake until the cheese is soft and the stick is lightly browned, about 12 minutes.

recipe_title: Chicken Provencale with Bell Peppers and Olives
original_instructions:
Use the heel of your hand to flatten chicken into more or less even 1/2-inch thickness. Sprinkle both sides with herbes de Provence and season with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Add chicken and saute over medium to medium high heat until well-browned on both sides and almost cooked through, about 5 minutes. Remove to plate, leaving drippings in pan.
Add remaining oil to pan. Add peppers and cook, stirring until they begin to soften and brown, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Add wine, bring to a boil, and cook, stirring up any brown bits, for 30 seconds. Return chicken and any accumulated juices to pan, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, partially covered, until chicken is cooked through, about 3 minutes. Add olives and heat through, about 1 minute.
ingredients: 4 skinless boneless chicken breast halves, about 5 ounces each
4 teaspoons dried mixed herbs de Provence
2/3 cup pitted and halved meaty black olives such as Gaeta
step_by_step_instructions: Flatten 1 chicken breast half to about 1/2-inch thickness using the heel of your hand.
Sprinkle both sides of the chicken with 1 teaspoon herbes de Provence and season with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium to medium-high heat.
Add the seasoned chicken to the skillet and sauté until well-browned on both sides and almost cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Remove the chicken to a plate, leaving drippings in the pan.
Add 1.5 tablespoons olive oil to the pan.
Add 1.5 cups mixed-color bell pepper strips to the pan and cook, stirring, until they begin to soften and brown, about 3 minutes.
Add 1.5 large garlic cloves, finely chopped, to the pan and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add 1/4 cup wine to the pan, bring to a boil, and cook, stirring up any brown bits, for 30 seconds.
Return the chicken and any accumulated juices to the pan, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, partially covered, until the chicken is cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Add about 2.5 tablespoons pitted and halved black olives to the pan and heat through, about 1 minute.

original_instructions:
Heat your wood-fired oven 2 hours before cooking. You want it to be a medium-high heat, about 400 degrees F.
Add the olive oil, rosemary, salt, pepper, garlic, lemon juice and zest in a mortar and pestle and smash until it reaches a paste. Place the lamb on a sheet tray and rub the paste all over the lamb, getting into every inch of space. If time allows, you can marinate the lamb for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Place the lamb on a sheet tray or roasting pan outfitted with a wire rack. Put in the oven and roast until the lamb reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees F, about 1 1/2 hours.
Allow the lamb to rest for 20 minutes for the juices to redistribute before carving. Carve against the grain, using the bone as a handle. Place the slices on a platter and garnish with rosemary sprigs and lemon zest. Serve with a simple arugula salad.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons roughly chopped fresh rosemary, plus more for garnish
Juice and zest of 1 lemon, plus more for garnish
One 6 to 7-pound leg of lamb, bone in
step_by_step_instructions: Heat your wood-fired oven to about 400 degrees F, starting 2 hours before cooking.

In a mortar and pestle, combine 0.5 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp chopped rosemary, 0.25 tsp kosher salt, 0.25 tsp black pepper, 1 clove garlic, and the juice and zest of 0.15 lemon. Smash until it forms a paste.
Place a portion of the lamb (approximately 0.8 lb) on a sheet tray and rub the paste all over the lamb, ensuring it covers every inch.
If possible, allow the lamb to marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Place the lamb on a sheet tray or roasting pan with a wire rack.
Roast the lamb in the oven until it reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees F, approximately 90 minutes.
Let the lamb rest for 20 minutes to allow the juices to redistribute.
Carve the lamb against the grain using the bone as a handle.
Serve carved slices on a platter, garnished with rosemary sprigs and lemon zest, alongside a simple arugula salad.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a 9-inch-square baking dish or a 9-inch cast-iron skillet with cooking spray. Whisk the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg, milk, sour cream and melted butter; whisk into the dry ingredients until combined. Fold in the scallions, broccoli and cheddar cheese.
Pour the batter into the prepared dish or skillet. Bake until the cornbread springs back when pressed in the center, 25 to 35 minutes. Let cool 15 minutes in the dish, then loosen the edges and slice.
ingredients: 1 cup sour cream or plain Greek yogurt
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Coat a 9-inch-square baking dish or a 9-inch cast-iron skillet with cooking spray.
Whisk 0.38 cup of yellow cornmeal, 0.06 cup of all-purpose flour, 0.5 tablespoon of sugar, 0.13 teaspoon of baking powder, 0.06 teaspoon of baking soda, and a pinch of kosher salt in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk 0.25 of an egg, 0.25 cup of milk, 0.25 cup of sour cream, and 0.5 tablespoon of melted butter.
Whisk the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients until combined.
Fold in 0.13 cup of chopped scallions, 0.13 cup of chopped blanched broccoli florets, and 0.13 cup of grated cheddar cheese.
Pour the batter into the prepared dish or skillet.
Bake until the cornbread springs back when pressed in the center, about 25 to 35 minutes.
Let cool for about 15 minutes in the dish, then loosen the edges and slice.

recipe_title: Grilled Avocado and Tomatoes, Basil Oil and Cotija Cheese with Pine Nuts
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Combine oil, basil, salt and pepper in a blender and blend for 1 minute. Strain into a bowl, discard solids
Combine tomatoes and onion in a bowl, add a few tablespoons of the basil oil and season with salt and pepper. Reserve remaining basil oil for Shrimp recipe.
Heat grill to medium heat. Brush avocado with oil on grill and season with salt and pepper. Grill cut side down until lightly golden brown, about 2 minutes. Remove to a platter, cut side up. Place some of the tomato mixture on top of each avocado, drizzle with more of the oil and sprinkle with the pine nuts and cheese. Garnish with basil leaves.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 ripe beef steak tomatoes, halves and seeded and finely diced
2 ripe Hass avocados, halved and peeled and pitted
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.09 cup of olive oil, 2 basil leaves, a pinch of salt and a pinch of pepper in a blender and blend for 1 minute.
Strain the mixture into a bowl and discard the solids.
In another bowl, combine 0.25 of a diced tomato and 0.08 of a diced red onion.
Add a few teaspoons of the basil oil to the tomato mixture and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Reserve the remaining basil oil for another use.
Heat the grill to medium heat.
Brush 0.5 of an avocado with canola oil and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Grill the avocado cut side down until lightly golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Remove the avocado to a platter, cut side up.
Place some of the tomato mixture on top of each avocado half.
Drizzle with a bit more of the basil oil.
Sprinkle with 0.5 tablespoon of pine nuts and 0.5 tablespoon of cotija cheese.
Garnish with a few basil leaves.

original_instructions:
Put the apple, cabbage, garlic, chile, spring onion, and cilantro in a medium bowl. Pour over the vinegar, season with salt and pepper, and toss to combine.
Put the apple, cabbage, garlic, chile, spring onion, and cilantro in a medium bowl. Pour over the vinegar, season with salt and pepper, and toss to combine.
ingredients: 1 red chile, finely chopped (keep the seeds if you like it hot)
1 1/4 cups (300 ml) white wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar
step_by_step_instructions: Grate approximately 0.67 green apple and put it in a medium bowl.
Grate approximately 0.11 head of red cabbage and add to the bowl.
Crush 0.12 garlic clove and add to the bowl.
Finely chop approximately 0.12 red chile (including seeds if desired) and add to the bowl.
Finely slice about 1 spring onion and add to the bowl.
Pick and add about 0.12 handful of cilantro leaves to the bowl.
Pour approximately 0.16 cup (38 ml) of apple cider vinegar over the ingredients.
Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss all the ingredients together to combine evenly.

original_instructions:
Mix the flours in a bowl and make a well in the middle. Beat the eggs, olive oil and 6 tablespoons cold water in a measuring cup and pour into the well. Stir with a fork.
Cut the dough into 6 pieces; wrap 5 pieces in plastic. Roll out 1 piece into a 12-by- 18-inch rectangle on a floured surface (about 18-inch thick).
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth, 5 minutes.Wrap in plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips, then cut the strips in half. Toss the pasta with flour on a baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining dough.
Photograph by Anna Williams
ingredients: 2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
step_by_step_instructions: Mix approximately 0.46 cups of all-purpose flour and 0.125 cups of buckwheat flour in a bowl and make a well in the middle.
Beat 0.5 large eggs, 0.5 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil and 1 tablespoon of cold water in a measuring cup and pour into the well.
Stir with a fork to combine the ingredients.
Cut the dough into 1 piece, wrap the remaining dough in plastic.
Roll out the dough piece into a 12-by-18-inch rectangle on a floured surface (about 18-inch thick).
Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth, about 5 minutes.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Cut the dough crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips, then cut the strips in half.
Toss the pasta with flour on a baking sheet.

original_instructions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add extra-virgin olive oil, 3 turns of the pan, then onions and peppers. Cook 6 to 7 minutes then add peas and cook another minute. Whisk eggs with salt and pepper then add to veggies and scramble to desired doneness. Remove from heat and stir in pesto then plate up and serve.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, 3 turns of the pan
8 rounded teaspoonfuls store bought, good quality basil pesto sauce
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add 0.38 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil, then add 0.13 cup of chopped onions and 0.13 cup of chopped red bell pepper.
Cook for 6 to 7 minutes, then add 0.13 cup of frozen green peas and cook for another minute.
Whisk 1 egg with salt and pepper, then add the egg to the veggies and scramble to desired doneness.
Remove from heat and stir in 1 rounded teaspoonful of basil pesto sauce, then plate up and serve.

original_instructions: Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan and saute onion and garlic until the onion begins to turn translucent. Add rice and stir to coat with oil, onions and garlic, and let rice "toast" lightly. Stir in chicken stock and poultry seasoning and bring to a boil. Then reduce heat and simmer covered until all liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and flake rice.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil in a small saucepan.
Saute 0.08 cup of finely chopped onion and 0.4 cloves of finely chopped garlic until the onion begins to turn translucent.
Add 0.33 cups of white rice and stir to coat with oil, onions, and garlic, and let rice 'toast' lightly.
Stir in 0.5 cups of chicken stock and 0.17 teaspoon of poultry seasoning and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer covered until all liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and flake rice.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Arrange the tomatoes on a sheet pan, cut sides up, in a single layer. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle the garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper over the tomatoes. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes, until the tomatoes are concentrated and beginning to caramelize. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 12 plum tomatoes, halved lengthwise, cores and seeds removed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Halve 2 plum tomatoes lengthwise, and remove the cores and seeds.
Arrange the halved tomatoes on a sheet pan, cut sides up, in a single layer.
Drizzle about 0.33 tablespoon of olive oil and 0.13 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar over the tomatoes.
Sprinkle approximately 0.33 minced garlic cloves, 0.33 teaspoon of sugar, 0.25 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 0.08 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper over the tomatoes.
Roast in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, until the tomatoes are concentrated and beginning to caramelize.
Serve the roasted tomatoes warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Butter a 9-inch cast iron skillet.
In a large bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or with a hand-held electric mixer and a large bowl, combine the butter and sugar and mix until light and airy. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well between each addition.
Add the cornmeal mixture to the butter mixture in 3 parts, alternating with the milk in 2 parts, until just combined into a thick batter. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake until lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Set aside to cool slightly before serving.
ingredients: 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus more for preparing the pan
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Butter a 9-inch cast iron skillet.
In a large bowl, whisk together 0.33 cup cornmeal, 0.17 cup flour, 0.67 teaspoon baking powder, and 0.13 teaspoon salt.
In another bowl, combine 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon sugar and mix until light and airy.
Add 0.33 egg to the butter mixture, mixing well.
Add the cornmeal mixture to the butter mixture in 3 parts, alternating with 0.33 cup milk in 2 parts, until just combined into a thick batter.
Using a rubber spatula, scrape the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top.
Bake until lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
Set aside to cool slightly before serving.
required_tools: standing mixer or hand-held electric mixer

recipe_title: Traditional Supper Stuffing with Cider Gravy
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat the oven to 325 degrees F and scatter bread on baking sheet, season with poultry seasoning and bake to toast bread, 10-12 minutes.
Quarter the apples and slice into each quarter on an angle to cut away the core. Chop apples into bite size pieces.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat with 3 tablespoons butter, when the butter melts, add the apples, onions, celery, bay leaf and parsley. Season with salt and pepper and cook until tender, 7 to 8 minutes. Add turkey to the skillet and combine with vegetables, heat through 2 to 3 minutes then fold in bread and moisten with about 2 cups chicken stock.
While stuffing cooks, melt 3 tablespoons butter in a sauce pan over medium heat and whisk in flour, 1 minute, whisk in cider and chicken stock and season with salt and pepper to taste, reduce 4 to 5 minutes.
Serve stuffing doused with 1/2 cup gravy.
ingredients: 4-5 cups farmhouse-style crusty bread, cut into 1-inch cubes
4 McIntosh, Golden Delicious, Gala or Honey Crisp apples
2 onions, chopped into bite size pieces
6 ribs celery from the heart, chopped into bite sized pieces
2 pounds roast turkey breast, 3 slices - inch thick from the deli counter, cut into bite sized cubes
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Scatter approximately 1 cup of bread cubes on a baking sheet, season with a pinch of poultry seasoning, and bake to toast for about 10-12 minutes.
Quarter 1 apple and slice to remove the core, then chop it into bite-sized pieces.
Chop about 0.5 onion into bite-sized pieces.
Chop about 1 celery rib into bite-sized pieces.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat with 1 tablespoon of butter.
Once the butter melts, add the chopped apple, onion, celery, a small piece of bay leaf, and a pinch of parsley to the skillet.
Season with salt and pepper and cook until the mixture is tender, about 7-8 minutes.
Add approximately 3 oz of turkey breast cubes to the skillet and combine with the vegetables, heating through for 2-3 minutes.
Fold in the toasted bread cubes and moisten the mixture with about 0.5 cup of chicken stock.
While the stuffing cooks, melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Whisk in 1 teaspoon of flour for 1 minute.
Whisk in about 0.25 cup of apple cider and 0.5 cup of chicken stock, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reduce the gravy for about 4-5 minutes.
Serve the stuffing doused with about 2 tablespoons of the gravy.

recipe_title: Roasted Pears with Amaretti and Amaretto
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Mix amaretto and vinegar in a 13 by 9-inch baking dish. Put pears, cut sides down, in dish.
Roast pears 15 minutes. Add water and roast until pears are tender but still hold their shape, 8 to 10 minutes more.
Arrange pears, cut sides up, on a platter and spoon pan juices over them. Sprinkle with half of cookie crumbs, then baste with pan juices. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs and serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons amaretto or other almond-flavored liqueur
4 firm-ripe Bartlett pears, halved lengthwise and cored
4 amaretti cookies (Italian almond macaroons; 1/2 inch in diameter), crumbled
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Mix 0.75 tablespoons amaretto and 0.25 tablespoons balsamic vinegar in a small baking dish.
Cut 1 pear in half lengthwise and core it.
Place the pear halves, cut sides down, in the dish.
Roast the pears for 15 minutes.
Add 0.08 cups of water to the dish and continue roasting until the pears are tender but still hold their shape, about 8 to 10 minutes more.
Arrange the pear halves, cut sides up, on a platter and spoon the pan juices over them.
Sprinkle with half of the crumbled cookies, then baste with pan juices.
Sprinkle with the remaining cookie crumbs and serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Halve the potatoes and place them in a bowl. Cover them with water if you cut them ahead of time.
In another bowl, mix olive oil, oregano, garlic, salt, and pepper. Mix well. Drain potatoes well and add them to the oil mixture. Toss with olive oil mixture. Spread the potatoes on a sheet pan. Roast for 30 minutes until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Halve approximately 0.5 pounds of Peruvian purple potatoes and place them in a bowl. Cover them with water if you cut them ahead of time.

In another bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil, 0.25 tablespoon of Mexican oregano, 0.25 tablespoon of minced garlic, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of freshly ground black pepper. Mix well.
Drain potatoes well and add them to the oil mixture. Toss with olive oil mixture.
Spread the potatoes on a sheet pan.
Roast for 30 minutes until potatoes are tender.
Sprinkle with 0.25 tablespoon of cilantro and serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.
Put the pizza shell or focaccia onto a pizza pan or cookie sheet. Drizzle shell with oil and scatter minced garlic over shell to edges. Cover the pie with a layer of all 3 cheeses combined and work all the way to the edge of the shells. Top with artichoke hearts. Cook 6 to 8 minutes, until cheeses have melted and begin to bubble. Remove from oven and garnish with parsley. Cut pie with pizza wheel or knife into bite-size squares and serve.
ingredients: 1 package thin crust prepared pizza shell or prepared focaccia, 16 ounces
1 cup shredded mozzarella (found in dairy aisle)
1 cup shredded provolone (found in dairy aisle)
1/4 cup grated Parmigiano Reggiano or Romano (a handful)
1 (15-ounce) can artichoke hearts in water, drained and thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 500 degrees F.
Place approximately 4 ounces of the pizza shell or focaccia onto a pizza pan or cookie sheet.
Drizzle the shell with about 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil.
Scatter around 0.5 clove of minced garlic over the shell to the edges.
Combine 0.25 cup of shredded mozzarella, 0.25 cup of shredded provolone, and 0.06 cup of grated Parmigiano Reggiano or Romano.
Cover the pie with the mixed cheeses all the way to the edge of the shell.
Top with about 3.75 ounces of sliced artichoke hearts.
Cook in the oven for 6 to 8 minutes, until the cheeses have melted and begin to bubble.
Remove from oven and garnish with approximately 0.06 cup of chopped parsley.
Cut the pie into bite-size squares and serve.

original_instructions:
Put the potatoes, whole, in a pot and cover with cold water. Salt the water. Bring to a boil, and simmer until very tender, about 30 minutes, depending on size.
Meanwhile, drop the garlic, bay leaf, and thyme in a saucepan with the milk, bring to a boil, turn off the heat, cover, and set aside to infuse 10 minutes. Pull out the garlic and herbs, and discard.
When the potatoes are done, drain them and peel while hot. Put them through a food mill set on the smallest setting over a large pot. Beat in the butter a piece at a time. Bring the milk to a boil and beat it in, splash by splash, until completely absorbed. You are looking for a very soft, fine puree, not unlike baby food! Check the seasonings, and serve.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Put approximately 0.33 pounds (150 g) of potatoes, whole, in a pot and cover with cold water.
Add a pinch of salt to the water.
Bring to a boil, and simmer until very tender, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, drop a portion of garlic, bay leaf, and thyme in a saucepan with approximately 0.17 cups (40 ml) of milk.
Bring to a boil, turn off the heat, cover, and set aside to infuse for 10 minutes.
Pull out the garlic and herbs, and discard.
When the potatoes are done, drain them and peel while hot.
Put them through a food mill set on the smallest setting over a large pot.
Beat in approximately 0.08 cups (17 g) of butter a piece at a time.
Bring the milk to a boil again and beat it in, splash by splash, until completely absorbed.
Check the seasonings and add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Serve the puree.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, onions, and garlic. Saute until mushrooms are browned, about 5 to 6 minutes.
Stir in red pepper flakes and saute for 1 more minute. Add chicken stock and Worcestershire sauce, remove from heat and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine egg, panko, blue cheese, and mushroom mixture. Fold in turkey and combine. Don't over work or the meatloaf will be tough.
Shape into a long rectangular loaf directly on a sheet tray. Spoon tomato sauce on top of the loaf and shingle sliced shallots down the top. Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes, and serve.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1 ounce of mushrooms, 0.125 of a large onion, and 0.25 clove of garlic.
Saute until mushrooms are browned, about 5 to 6 minutes.
Stir in a pinch of red pepper flakes and saute for 1 more minute.
Add 0.03 cup of chicken stock and 0.125 tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce, remove from heat and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine 0.125 of a lightly beaten egg, 1 tablespoon of panko, 0.75 ounce of crumbled blue cheese, and the cooled mushroom mixture.
Fold in 0.25 pound of ground turkey and combine. Don't over work.
Shape into a small loaf directly on a sheet tray.
Spoon 1 ounce of tomato sauce on top of the loaf and shingle 0.125 of a shallot, sliced, down the top.
Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes, and serve.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit Butterfly meat until about 2-inches thick around. Season with garlic and fresh herbs and spices to your taste. From the narrow end, roll tightly toward the broad end. Place fat or skin over roll and tie to secure. Bake for 20 minutes per pound. For a crispier skin, roast at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for the first 20 minutes then reduce heat to 350 degrees until done. Slice and serve as you wish.;
ingredients: 1 pork shoulder, boneless, roast with skin
Garlic, herbs and spices, to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Butterfly the pork shoulder until it is about 2-inches thick.
Season the pork with garlic, fresh herbs, and spices to taste.
From the narrow end, roll the pork tightly toward the broad end.
Place the fat or skin over the roll and tie it to secure.
Bake the pork in the oven for approximately 20 minutes per pound.
For a crispier skin, roast at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for the first 20 minutes, then reduce the heat to 350 degrees until done.
Slice and serve the porchetta as desired.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly coat a small baking pan with olive oil. Layer potatoes and onion in pan. Season with salt and pepper. Pour stock over potatoes and onion; cover and bake 30 minutes. Lightly spray or brush with olive oil and return to oven, uncovered, 10 more minutes to lightly brown potatoes.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly coat a small baking pan with olive oil. Layer potatoes and onion in pan. Season with salt and pepper. Pour stock over potatoes and onion; cover and bake 30 minutes. Lightly spray or brush with olive oil and return to oven, uncovered, 10 more minutes to lightly brown potatoes.
ingredients: 2 large russet potatoes, peeled and sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Lightly coat a small baking pan with olive oil.
Layer approximately 1/2 of a large russet potato in the pan.
Add approximately 1/4 of a large yellow onion, thinly sliced, on top of the potatoes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Pour approximately 2 tablespoons of chicken stock over the potatoes and onion.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
Lightly spray or brush with olive oil and return to oven, uncovered, for 10 more minutes to lightly brown the potatoes.

original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the red onion and cook, stirring, until soft, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the potato, cayenne, garlic, bay leaf, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper and cook, stirring, until the potatoes are well coated, 2 to 3 minutes. Pour in the broth and bring to a simmer.
Add bell pepper and tomatoes, bring the mixture back to a simmer and cook until the potatoes and vegetables are tender, adjusting the heat as needed to maintain a simmer, about 20 minutes. Remove from the heat, discard the bay leaf and let cool at least 5 minutes. Carefully puree until smooth with a handheld immersion blender or in 2 to 3 batches in a blender (do not fill the blender more than halfway full).
Reheat the soup and adjust the consistency with water if needed. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with a sprinkle of parsley and almonds and a drizzle of oil.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for drizzling
