With a heat-resistant whisk, dissolve 0.25 tablespoon of butter into the sauce.
Season the sauce with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Return the chicken breast to the pan and heat it up quickly.
Serve the chicken breast on a preheated platter and drizzle with the pan juices.

recipe_title: Wild Rice with Butternut Squash, Leeks, and Corn
original_instructions:
Rinse rice in strainer under cold water; drain. Bring 6 cups water and 2 teaspoons coarse salt to boil in large saucepan. Add rice; bring to boil. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered until rice grains begin to split and are tender but still slightly chewy, about 45 minutes. Drain. Spread on rimmed baking sheet to cool. Transfer to bowl. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill. Preheat oven to 350°F. Oil rimmed baking sheet. Toss squash cubes and 3 tablespoons oil in medium bowl. Spread squash in single layer on prepared sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast just until tender but firm enough to hold shape, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. Transfer squash to bowl. Cool. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill. Melt 4 tablespoons butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add leeks and 3/4 cup water; simmer until leeks are tender, about 7 minutes. Add corn; simmer 2 minutes longer. Add rice and butternut squash; simmer until heated through and liquid is absorbed, about 4 minutes. Stir in 2 tablespoons butter and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowl and serve.
Rinse rice in strainer under cold water; drain. Bring 6 cups water and 2 teaspoons coarse salt to boil in large saucepan. Add rice; bring to boil. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered until rice grains begin to split and are tender but still slightly chewy, about 45 minutes. Drain. Spread on rimmed baking sheet to cool. Transfer to bowl. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Oil rimmed baking sheet. Toss squash cubes and 3 tablespoons oil in medium bowl. Spread squash in single layer on prepared sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast just until tender but firm enough to hold shape, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. Transfer squash to bowl. Cool. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.
Melt 4 tablespoons butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add leeks and 3/4 cup water; simmer until leeks are tender, about 7 minutes. Add corn; simmer 2 minutes longer. Add rice and butternut squash; simmer until heated through and liquid is absorbed, about 4 minutes. Stir in 2 tablespoons butter and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowl and serve.
ingredients: 3 cups 1/2-inch cubes peeled butternut squash (from 11/2-pound squash)
1 1/2 cups finely chopped leeks (white part only)
1 1/2 cups frozen white corn kernels, thawed
step_by_step_instructions: Rinse 0.25 cup wild rice in strainer under cold water; drain.
Bring 1 cup water and 0.33 teaspoon coarse salt to a boil in a large saucepan.
Add rice; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; simmer uncovered until rice grains begin to split and are tender but still slightly chewy, about 45 minutes.
Drain the rice.
Spread the rice on a rimmed baking sheet to cool.
Oil a rimmed baking sheet and preheat the oven to 350°F.
Toss 0.5 cup butternut squash cubes and 0.5 tablespoon olive oil in a medium bowl.
Spread squash in a single layer on the prepared sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast just until tender but firm enough to hold shape, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Transfer squash to a bowl and allow to cool.
Melt 0.67 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add 0.25 cup finely chopped leeks and 0.13 cup water; simmer until leeks are tender, about 7 minutes.
Add 0.25 cup corn; simmer 2 minutes longer.
Add rice and butternut squash to the skillet; simmer until heated through and liquid is absorbed, about 4 minutes.
Stir in 0.33 tablespoon butter and 0.17 tablespoon chopped parsley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a bowl and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
For the garnish: In a skillet, heat the oil on medium heat and cook the shallots until caramelized, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
For the popovers: Place 6 ramekins on a baking tray and put a spoonful of duck fat into each ramekin. Place the tray in the oven and let warm for about 5 minutes so that the fat melts, but doesn't burn.
Meanwhile, mix the flour and salt in a bowl. In a saucepan, heat the milk on low heat for about 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs until they get very frothy, 2 to 3 minutes. Slowly add the hot milk and continue to whisk. Stir the liquid ingredients into the flour mixture stirring the batter just until mixed. Do not over beat.
Take the pan out of the oven and pour the batter into each ramekin, about three quarters full. Divide the caramelized shallot mixture on top of each popover and cover with rosemary, grated Cheddar and freshly ground pepper. Bake in the oven until they start to look crusty and golden brown, about 15 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F. Continue cooking for about 15 minutes. Make a small incision in each popover 5 minutes before the time is up to release the steam and dry the inside of the popovers. The popovers will be puffy, light, and golden brown.
ingredients: 1/4 cup bacon fat or duck fat, melted
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
In a skillet, heat 0.33 tbsp of olive oil on medium heat.
Cook 0.5 minced shallot until caramelized, about 10 minutes.
Season with a pinch of salt and freshly ground pepper.
Set aside the caramelized shallots for garnish.
Place 1 ramekin on a baking tray and add 0.67 tbsp of duck fat into the ramekin.
Place the tray in the oven and let warm for about 5 minutes so that the fat melts, but doesn't burn.
Meanwhile, mix 0.33 cup of flour and 0.17 tsp of salt in a bowl.
In a saucepan, heat 0.33 cup of milk on low heat for about 5 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk 0.67 egg until very frothy, 2 to 3 minutes.
Slowly add the hot milk to the eggs and continue to whisk.
Stir the liquid ingredients into the flour mixture until just mixed. Do not over beat.
Take the pan out of the oven and pour the batter into the ramekin, about three quarters full.
Divide the caramelized shallot mixture on top of the popover.
Cover with a pinch of rosemary, 0.17 cup of grated Cheddar, and freshly ground pepper.
Bake in the oven until the popover starts to look crusty and golden brown, about 15 minutes.
Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F and continue cooking for about 15 minutes.
Make a small incision in the popover 5 minutes before the time is up to release the steam and dry the inside.
The popover will be puffy, light, and golden brown.

original_instructions:
Finely grind the almonds in a food processor. With an electric mixer, beat the egg yolks with the sugar to a smooth pale cream. Beat in the zests and almond extract. Add the ground almonds and mix very well. With clean beaters, beat the egg whites in a large bowl until stiff peaks form. Fold them into the egg and almond mixture (the mixture is thick, so that you will need to turn it over quite a bit into the egg whites). Grease an 11-inch springform pan, preferably nonstick, with butter and dust it with flour. Pour in the cake batter, and bake into a preheated 350°F for 40 minutes, or until it feels firm to the touch. Let cool before turning out. Just before serving, dust the top of the cake with confectioners' sugar. Or, if you like, cut a St. James cross out of paper. Place it in the middle of the cake, and dust the cake with confectioners' sugar, then remove the paper.
Finely grind the almonds in a food processor.
With an electric mixer, beat the egg yolks with the sugar to a smooth pale cream. Beat in the zests and almond extract. Add the ground almonds and mix very well.
With clean beaters, beat the egg whites in a large bowl until stiff peaks form. Fold them into the egg and almond mixture (the mixture is thick, so that you will need to turn it over quite a bit into the egg whites).
Grease an 11-inch springform pan, preferably nonstick, with butter and dust it with flour. Pour in the cake batter, and bake into a preheated 350°F for 40 minutes, or until it feels firm to the touch. Let cool before turning out.
Just before serving, dust the top of the cake with confectioners' sugar. Or, if you like, cut a St. James cross out of paper. Place it in the middle of the cake, and dust the cake with confectioners' sugar, then remove the paper.
step_by_step_instructions: Finely grind approximately 0.22 cups of blanched whole almonds in a food processor.
With an electric mixer, beat about 1 egg yolk with 0.21 cups of superfine sugar to a smooth pale cream.
Beat in a small amount of orange zest and lemon zest, along with about 1 drop of almond extract.
Add the ground almonds and mix very well.
With clean beaters, beat about 1 egg white in a large bowl until stiff peaks form.
Fold the beaten egg whites into the egg and almond mixture, turning it over quite a bit as the mixture is thick.
Grease a small portion of an 11-inch springform pan with butter and dust with flour.
Pour in the cake batter and bake it in a preheated oven at 350°F for about 40 minutes until it feels firm to the touch.
Let the cake cool before turning it out.
Just before serving, dust the top of the cake with a small amount of confectioners' sugar.

recipe_title: Baked Chicken and Bacon-Wrapped Lady Apples
original_instructions:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400°F. Cook bacon in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, turning over once, until edges are lightly browned but bacon is still flexible (it will continue to cook in oven), 6 to 8 minutes total. Transfer to paper towels to drain, reserving fat in skillet. While bacon cooks, core apples, if desired, from bottom, with pointed end of a vegetable peeler or a paring knife, leaving stems intact. Wrap a slice of bacon around each of 8 apples, securing ends of bacon by piercing with stem or using half a wooden pick. Brush a 3-quart (13- by 9-inch) shallow baking dish with some bacon fat, then add apples to dish and bake, uncovered, 10 minutes. Meanwhile, pat chicken dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat bacon fat in skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook chicken, turning over once, until browned, about 8 minutes total. Transfer chicken with tongs to baking dish, rearranging some of apples so that chicken fits in bottom of dish, and bake, uncovered, 5 minutes. While chicken bakes, pour off fat from skillet and add cider, vinegar, and marjoram sprigs to skillet. Boil, stirring and scraping up brown bits, until reduced by half (about 3/4 cup), about 5 minutes. Pour sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a measuring cup, pressing on and then discarding solids. Add butter and chopped marjoram to sauce, stirring until butter is melted. Pour sauce over chicken and apples and continue to bake, uncovered, until chicken is cooked through and apples are tender, about 20 minutes more.
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400°F.
Cook bacon in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, turning over once, until edges are lightly browned but bacon is still flexible (it will continue to cook in oven), 6 to 8 minutes total. Transfer to paper towels to drain, reserving fat in skillet.
While bacon cooks, core apples, if desired, from bottom, with pointed end of a vegetable peeler or a paring knife, leaving stems intact. Wrap a slice of bacon around each of 8 apples, securing ends of bacon by piercing with stem or using half a wooden pick.
Brush a 3-quart (13- by 9-inch) shallow baking dish with some bacon fat, then add apples to dish and bake, uncovered, 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, pat chicken dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat bacon fat in skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook chicken, turning over once, until browned, about 8 minutes total. Transfer chicken with tongs to baking dish, rearranging some of apples so that chicken fits in bottom of dish, and bake, uncovered, 5 minutes.
While chicken bakes, pour off fat from skillet and add cider, vinegar, and marjoram sprigs to skillet. Boil, stirring and scraping up brown bits, until reduced by half (about 3/4 cup), about 5 minutes. Pour sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a measuring cup, pressing on and then discarding solids. Add butter and chopped marjoram to sauce, stirring until butter is melted. Pour sauce over chicken and apples and continue to bake, uncovered, until chicken is cooked through and apples are tender, about 20 minutes more.
ingredients: 12 lady apples (about 1 to 2 inches in diameter
6 chicken thighs (2lb; with skin and bones)
2 sprigs fresh marjoram plus 2 teaspoons chopped fresh marjoram, or to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

Cook 1 slice of bacon in a skillet over moderate heat, turning over once, until the edges are lightly browned but still flexible, about 6 to 8 minutes. Drain on paper towels, reserving fat in the skillet.
Core 1 lady apple from the bottom using a vegetable peeler or a paring knife, leaving the stem intact.
Wrap the cooked bacon around the apple, securing it with the stem or using half a wooden pick.
Brush a small section of a baking dish with some reserved bacon fat and place the bacon-wrapped apple in the dish.
Bake the apple, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
Pat 1 chicken thigh dry and sprinkle with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Heat the reserved bacon fat in the skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking.
Cook the chicken thigh in the skillet, turning over once, until browned, about 8 minutes.
Transfer the chicken to the baking dish, rearranging the apple to fit the chicken in the dish, and bake, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
Pour off any remaining fat from the skillet and add 1/6 cup of apple cider, 1/12 cup of cider vinegar, and 1 marjoram sprig.
Boil the mixture, stirring and scraping up brown bits, until reduced by half (about 1/8 cup), about 5 minutes.
Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a measuring cup, discarding solids.
Add 1/6 tablespoon of butter and 1/3 teaspoon of chopped marjoram to the sauce, stirring until the butter is melted.
Pour the sauce over the chicken and apple in the baking dish.
Continue to bake, uncovered, until the chicken is cooked through and the apple is tender, about 20 minutes more.

original_instructions:
Place a large disposable aluminum pan in the bottom of a charcoal grill; add 2 cups water to pan. Fill a charcoal chimney with charcoal; light. Pat turkey dry with paper towels. Place apple, orange, and onion in cavity. Tie legs with kitchen twine. Rub bird inside and out with butter. Season skin lightly with salt and pepper. When coals are covered with ash, spread half on either side of disposable pan. Set top grate on grill. Place turkey on grate over pan (do not allow any part of turkey to sit over coals). Cover grill. Insert stem of an instant-read thermometer into hole in hood. Maintain temperature as close as possible to 350°F by opening vents to increase temperature and closing vents to reduce it, lifting grate with turkey to replenish coals as needed using charcoal chimney. If using wood chips, scatter a handful of drained chips over charcoal every 30 minutes. Cook turkey, rotating every hour for even browning (lift the grate with the turkey on it; rotate grate 180 degrees), until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part of the thigh without touching bone registers 165°F (juices should run clear when thermometer is removed), about 2 3/4 hours. Transfer turkey to a platter. Tent with foil and let rest for 1 hour before carving.
Place a large disposable aluminum pan in the bottom of a charcoal grill; add 2 cups water to pan. Fill a charcoal chimney with charcoal; light.
Pat turkey dry with paper towels. Place apple, orange, and onion in cavity. Tie legs with kitchen twine. Rub bird inside and out with butter. Season skin lightly with salt and pepper.
When coals are covered with ash, spread half on either side of disposable pan. Set top grate on grill. Place turkey on grate over pan (do not allow any part of turkey to sit over coals). Cover grill. Insert stem of an instant-read thermometer into hole in hood. Maintain temperature as close as possible to 350°F by opening vents to increase temperature and closing vents to reduce it, lifting grate with turkey to replenish coals as needed using charcoal chimney. If using wood chips, scatter a handful of drained chips over charcoal every 30 minutes.
Cook turkey, rotating every hour for even browning (lift the grate with the turkey on it; rotate grate 180 degrees), until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part of the thigh without touching bone registers 165°F (juices should run clear when thermometer is removed), about 2 3/4 hours.
Transfer turkey to a platter. Tent with foil and let rest for 1 hour before carving.
ingredients: 1 12-14-pound turkey, giblets and neck removed, brined, at room temperature for 1 hour
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Special equipment: A charcoal chimney; 2 cups wood chips, soaked in water for at least 2 hours (optional)
step_by_step_instructions: Place a disposable aluminum pan in the bottom of a charcoal grill and add about 0.13 cups of water to the pan.
Fill a charcoal chimney with charcoal and light it.
Pat the turkey dry with paper towels.
Place approximately 0.08 of an apple, 0.08 of an orange, and 0.08 of a red onion in the turkey cavity.
Tie the turkey legs with kitchen twine.
Rub the turkey inside and out with about 0.13 tablespoons of unsalted butter.
Season the turkey skin lightly with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
When coals are covered with ash, spread half on either side of the disposable pan.
Set the top grate on the grill and place the turkey on the grate over the pan, ensuring no part of the turkey sits over coals.
Cover the grill and insert the stem of an instant-read thermometer into the hole in the hood.
Maintain the grill temperature as close as possible to 350°F, adjusting vents as needed and replenishing coals with the charcoal chimney.
If using wood chips, scatter a handful of drained chips over the charcoal every 30 minutes.
Cook the turkey, rotating every hour for even browning, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh registers 165°F, about 20.5 minutes for a single portion.
Transfer the turkey to a platter, tent with foil, and let rest for approximately 20 minutes before carving.

original_instructions:
Remove the ham from the refrigerator 1 hour before baking. Trim off any skin, leaving an even layer of fat (about 1/2 inch thick). Use a sharp paring knife to score through the fat in a diagonal crosshatch pattern without cutting through to the meat. Place the ham, flat-side down, on a roasting rack set in a large roasting pan.
Position a rack in the lower third of the oven; preheat to 350 degrees F. Combine the orange juice, 1 cup chicken broth and the melted butter in a measuring cup. Pour over the ham and tent with foil. Bake, basting with the pan juices every 30 minutes, until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the ham registers 130 degrees F, 2 to 2 1/2 hours.
Make the glaze: Remove the ham from the oven, spoon out about 1/4 cup of the pan juices and transfer to a medium bowl. Whisk the pepper jelly, mustard, brown sugar, marmalade, vinegar, thyme, chile powder, coriander, cayenne and orange zest into the bowl.
Brush the ham with about one-quarter of the glaze. Add the remaining 1 cup broth to the pan. Return to the oven and bake, brushing the ham with more glaze twice (reserve some for finishing), until the surface is caramelized and a thermometer inserted into the thickest part registers 140 degrees F, 1 1/2 to 2 more hours. Transfer the ham to a cutting board. Brush with the reserved glaze; let rest 15 minutes before carving.
Photograph by Con Poulos
ingredients: Finely grated zest and juice of 1 orange
step_by_step_instructions: Remove approximately 1 pound of ham from the refrigerator and let it sit for 1 hour before baking.
Trim off any skin, leaving a fat layer of about 1/2 inch thick.
Score the fat in a diagonal crosshatch pattern without cutting through to the meat.
Place the ham, flat-side down, on a roasting rack set in a large roasting pan.
Position a rack in the lower third of the oven and preheat to 350 degrees F.
Combine approximately 0.5 ounce of orange juice, 0.25 cup of chicken broth, and 0.5 tablespoon of melted butter.
Pour the mixture over the ham and tent with foil.
Bake, basting with the pan juices every 30 minutes, until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the ham registers 130 degrees F, about 30 minutes to 45 minutes.
Remove the ham from the oven and spoon out about 1 tablespoon of the pan juices into a medium bowl.

Whisk in 1 tablespoon of hot pepper jelly, 1 tablespoon of mustard, 1 tablespoon of brown sugar, 1 tablespoon of orange marmalade, 0.5 tablespoon of sherry vinegar, 0.5 tablespoon of chopped fresh thyme, 0.25 teaspoon of ancho chile powder, 0.25 teaspoon of ground coriander, 0.12 teaspoon of cayenne pepper, and 0.5 teaspoon of orange zest.
Brush the ham with about one-quarter of the glaze.
Add the remaining 0.25 cup of broth to the pan.

Return to the oven and bake, brushing the ham with more glaze twice, until the surface is caramelized and a thermometer inserted into the thickest part registers 140 degrees F, about 45 minutes to 60 minutes.
Transfer the ham to a cutting board.
Brush with the reserved glaze and let rest for 15 minutes before carving.

original_instructions:
Wash the potato slices well and dry them on a towel. Pour a thin layer of heavy cream on the bottom of a 9" by 12" baking dish and alternate layers of potatoes and cheese.Top with cream. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover with foil and place in a pan of hot water. Bake at 350°F. until the potatoes are just tender. If all the cream has been absorbed, add more. Remove from pan of water, take off foil and replace in the oven to brown lightly. Just before serving, sprinkle with cheese and brown again. This is delicious served with baby lamb.
Wash the potato slices well and dry them on a towel. Pour a thin layer of heavy cream on the bottom of a 9" by 12" baking dish and alternate layers of potatoes and cheese.Top with cream. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover with foil and place in a pan of hot water. Bake at 350°F. until the potatoes are just tender. If all the cream has been absorbed, add more. Remove from pan of water, take off foil and replace in the oven to brown lightly. Just before serving, sprinkle with cheese and brown again. This is delicious served with baby lamb.
ingredients: 3-4 large potatoes, cut in thin slices
step_by_step_instructions: Wash the potato slices well and dry them on a towel.
Pour a thin layer of heavy cream on the bottom of a 9" by 12" baking dish.
Alternate layers of potatoes and cheese, topping with cream.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Cover with foil and place in a pan of hot water.
Bake at 350°F until the potatoes are just tender.
If all the cream has been absorbed, add more cream.
Remove from the pan of water, take off the foil, and replace in the oven to brown lightly.
Just before serving, sprinkle with cheese and brown again.

original_instructions:
1. Soak the mushrooms in 1 cup hot water for 20 minutes. 2. Heat a heavy-based, high-sided frying pan or saucepan over medium heat. Add a generous chunk of butter and a glug of oil and sauté the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes until soft but not colored. 3. Add the rice and stir vigorously around the pan for a couple of minutes until the grains start to turn slightly translucent at the edges. Deglaze the pan by pouring in the wine and scraping up the bits at the bottom. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for a minute or two to burn off the alcohol. 4. Meanwhile, heat the stock and add the soaking liquor from the mushrooms. Add a ladleful of the hot stock mixture to the rice and stir over medium heat until absorbed, then add another ladleful. Repeat until all the stock is used up or the rice is tender but still al dente. Make sure to stir regularly to create a creamy risotto. (This should take about 20 minutes.) 5. Chop the rehydrated mushrooms into small pieces and gently stir into the cooked risotto. Add a chunk of butter and the Parmesan, then stir to mix well. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary, then leave the risotto to cool (it will do this more quickly if you spread it onto a baking sheet). 6. If using mini mozzarella balls, halve them; if using part of a large ball, cut it into 3/4-inch cubes. 7. Lay out 3 plates or shallow bowls. Put the beaten eggs in one, the flour (seasoned with a pinch of salt and pepper) in another, and the breadcrumbs in the final one. 8. Once the risotto is cooled (it doesn't matter if it is still a little warm, as long as it has stiffened up a bit and is cool enough to handle), roll it into balls the size of golf balls. Push a piece of mozzarella into the middle of each ball, making sure that the cheese is completely enclosed. Leave to set in the fridge for at least 30 minutes or overnight. 9. Heat a deep-fat fryer to 340°F or fill a large saucepan one-third full of flavorless oil and heat until a cube of bread dropped into the hot oil sizzles and turns golden brown in 30 seconds. 10. Dip a rice ball into the flour, shake off any excess, then dip into the egg, allowing any excess to drip off. Finish by coating completely in the breadcrumbs. Repeat with the remaining balls. 11. Deep-fry the balls in batches for 2-3 minutes until golden brown all over. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve immediately while the middles are still melting. Drizzle with lemon juice, if using.
1. Soak the mushrooms in 1 cup hot water for 20 minutes.
2. Heat a heavy-based, high-sided frying pan or saucepan over medium heat. Add a generous chunk of butter and a glug of oil and sauté the onion and garlic for about 5 minutes until soft but not colored.
3. Add the rice and stir vigorously around the pan for a couple of minutes until the grains start to turn slightly translucent at the edges. Deglaze the pan by pouring in the wine and scraping up the bits at the bottom. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for a minute or two to burn off the alcohol.
4. Meanwhile, heat the stock and add the soaking liquor from the mushrooms. Add a ladleful of the hot stock mixture to the rice and stir over medium heat until absorbed, then add another ladleful. Repeat until all the stock is used up or the rice is tender but still al dente. Make sure to stir regularly to create a creamy risotto. (This should take about 20 minutes.)
5. Chop the rehydrated mushrooms into small pieces and gently stir into the cooked risotto. Add a chunk of butter and the Parmesan, then stir to mix well. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary, then leave the risotto to cool (it will do this more quickly if you spread it onto a baking sheet).
6. If using mini mozzarella balls, halve them; if using part of a large ball, cut it into 3/4-inch cubes.
7. Lay out 3 plates or shallow bowls. Put the beaten eggs in one, the flour (seasoned with a pinch of salt and pepper) in another, and the breadcrumbs in the final one.
8. Once the risotto is cooled (it doesn't matter if it is still a little warm, as long as it has stiffened up a bit and is cool enough to handle), roll it into balls the size of golf balls. Push a piece of mozzarella into the middle of each ball, making sure that the cheese is completely enclosed. Leave to set in the fridge for at least 30 minutes or overnight.
9. Heat a deep-fat fryer to 340°F or fill a large saucepan one-third full of flavorless oil and heat until a cube of bread dropped into the hot oil sizzles and turns golden brown in 30 seconds.
10. Dip a rice ball into the flour, shake off any excess, then dip into the egg, allowing any excess to drip off. Finish by coating completely in the breadcrumbs. Repeat with the remaining balls.
11. Deep-fry the balls in batches for 2-3 minutes until golden brown all over. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve immediately while the middles are still melting. Drizzle with lemon juice, if using.
ingredients: 1 small onion or large shallot, peeled and finely diced
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
9 mini mozzarella cheese balls or 1/2 large ball
1 cup panko breadcrumbs or regular breadcrumbs
step_by_step_instructions: 1. Soak about 0.14 ounces of dried wild mushrooms in 0.14 cups of hot water for 20 minutes.

2. Heat a heavy-based, high-sided frying pan or saucepan over medium heat. Add a chunk of butter (approximately 0.5 tablespoons) and a glug of oil (approximately 0.5 tablespoons). Sauté 0.17 small onion (or equivalent shallot) and 0.11 garlic clove for about 5 minutes until soft but not colored.
3. Add about 0.19 cups of risotto rice and stir vigorously around the pan for a couple of minutes until the grains start to turn slightly translucent at the edges.
4. Deglaze the pan by pouring in approximately 0.07 cups of dry white wine. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer for a minute or two to burn off the alcohol.

5. Meanwhile, heat about 0.29 cups of stock and add the soaking liquor from the mushrooms. Add a ladleful of the hot stock mixture to the rice and stir over medium heat until absorbed, then add another ladleful. Repeat until all the stock is used up or the rice is tender but still al dente.

6. Chop the rehydrated mushrooms into small pieces and gently stir into the cooked risotto. Add another chunk of butter (approximately 0.5 tablespoons) and about 0.14 ounces of Parmesan cheese, then stir to mix well. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper if necessary, then leave the risotto to cool.
7. If using mini mozzarella balls, halve approximately 1 ball; if using part of a large ball, cut about 0.056 ounces into 3/4-inch cubes.

8. Lay out 3 plates or shallow bowls. Put about 0.33 beaten eggs in one, about 0.11 cups of flour (seasoned with a pinch of salt and pepper) in another, and about 0.14 cups of breadcrumbs in the final one.

9. Once the risotto is cooled, roll it into a ball the size of a golf ball. Push a piece of mozzarella into the middle of the ball, making sure that the cheese is completely enclosed. Leave to set in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
10. Heat a deep-fat fryer to 340°F or fill a large saucepan one-third full of flavorless oil and heat until a cube of bread dropped into the hot oil sizzles and turns golden brown in 30 seconds.
11. Dip a rice ball into the flour, shake off any excess, then dip into the egg, allowing any excess to drip off. Finish by coating completely in the breadcrumbs.

12. Deep-fry the ball for 2-3 minutes until golden brown all over. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve immediately while the middle is still melting. Drizzle with lemon juice if using.

original_instructions:
In a large bowl blend the flour, the butter, the vegetable shortening, and the salt until the mixture resembles meal. Add 3 tablespoons ice water, toss the mixture until the water is incorporated, and form the dough into a ball. Knead the dough lightly with the heel of the hand against a smooth surface for a few seconds to distribute the fat evenly and re-form it into a ball. Dust the dough with flour and chill it, wrapped in wax paper, for 1 hour.
In a large bowl blend the flour, the butter, the vegetable shortening, and the salt until the mixture resembles meal. Add 3 tablespoons ice water, toss the mixture until the water is incorporated, and form the dough into a ball. Knead the dough lightly with the heel of the hand against a smooth surface for a few seconds to distribute the fat evenly and re-form it into a ball. Dust the dough with flour and chill it, wrapped in wax paper, for 1 hour.
ingredients: 3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter, cut into bits
step_by_step_instructions: Blend the flour, butter, vegetable shortening, and salt in a large bowl until the mixture resembles meal.
Add 0.75 tablespoons of ice water, then toss the mixture until the water is incorporated.
Form the dough into a ball.
Knead the dough lightly with the heel of your hand against a smooth surface for a few seconds to distribute the fat evenly.
Re-form the dough into a ball.
Dust the dough with flour.
Wrap the dough in wax paper and chill it in the refrigerator for 1 hour.

recipe_title: Paniolo Steak with Wicked Wahine Chimichurri
original_instructions:
Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Set an oven-proof (cast iron) grill pan on a burner over high heat. Lightly brush steaks with olive oil on both sides and season with salt and pepper. When the grill pan is very hot, add the steaks. Sear the steaks over high heat for 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Remove the pan from the heat and set it in the oven to finish cooking. Keep the steak in the oven for 6 to 8 minutes for rare to medium-rare (or until an instant-read thermometer inserted in the middle of the steaks registers 165 degrees F). When steaks reach desired doneness, remove them from the oven and let them "rest" for another 4 to 6 minutes before slicing.
While the steaks are cooking, prepare the chimichurri sauce. Combine all of the ingredients in a food processor or blender and pulse until all ingredients are chopped fine and well combined, stopping to scrape down the sides, if necessary. The mixture should have the consistency of a coarse pesto. Set aside until ready to serve.
To serve, slice the steaks thinly against the grain and arrange on a platter. Drizzle some of the chimichurri sauce over the steak and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds. Garnish the platter with pineapple rings, if desired. Transfer the remaining sauce to a bowl and pass with the steak.
ingredients: 2 (1 to 1 1/2 pound) flat iron steaks (beef chuck top blade)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 bunch cilantro, tough stems removed, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
1 bunch Italian parsley, tough stems removed, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
2 tablespoons fresh ginger root, peeled and coarsely chopped
4 green onions (root tips and tough green ends removed) coarsely chopped
1 teaspoons Asian hot chili sauce (use 2 if you like it spicy!)
For garnish: 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds and a few pineapple rings (use good quality canned), if desired.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Set an oven-proof grill pan on a burner over high heat.
Brush approximately 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil on each side of the steak and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
When the grill pan is very hot, add the steak and sear over high heat for about 1.5 to 2 minutes on each side.
Remove the pan from the heat and place it in the oven to finish cooking for about 3 to 4 minutes for rare to medium-rare, or until an instant-read thermometer registers 165 degrees F.
Once cooked, remove the steak from the oven and let it rest for 2 to 3 minutes before slicing.

While the steak is cooking, combine roughly 0.25 cup of chopped cilantro, 0.25 cup of chopped parsley, 1 clove of chopped garlic, 0.5 tablespoon of chopped ginger, 1 chopped green onion, 1 tablespoon of rice wine vinegar, 0.75 tablespoon of lime juice, 0.75 tablespoon of sesame oil, 1 to 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, 0.75 tablespoon of pineapple juice, and 0.25 teaspoon of Asian hot chili sauce in a food processor.
Pulse until all ingredients are chopped fine and well combined, resembling a coarse pesto.
Slice the steak thinly against the grain and arrange on a platter.
Drizzle some of the chimichurri sauce over the steak and sprinkle with about 0.5 tablespoon of toasted sesame seeds.
Garnish the platter with a couple of pineapple rings, if desired.
Transfer the remaining sauce to a bowl to serve alongside the steak.

recipe_title: Lemon Herb Chicken Pasta with Green Peas, Snap Peas and Spinach
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt it generously. Add the pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes. Reserve 1/4 cup of the cooking liquid. Drain the pasta and set aside.
Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil to a large pan over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F, about 5 minutes per side. Remove the chicken and slice it into strips.
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pan. Add the garlic and shallot and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook until fragrant, 1 minute. Add the lemon juice and sugar snap peas and cook, 2 minutes. Add the reserved pasta water and the frozen peas. Cook until the peas are just cooked through, 2 minutes more.
Add the cooked pasta, spinach, sliced chicken, chopped basil, chopped parsley and the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil. Toss all the ingredients together to coat, season with additional salt and pepper and garnish with parsley leaves. Serve immediately.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2 cups trimmed and sliced sugar snap peas
3 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, plus additional leaves for serving
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt it generously.
Add approximately 113 g of penne pasta and cook until al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Reserve around 15 ml of the cooking liquid.
Drain the pasta and set aside.
Sprinkle a single chicken breast with salt and pepper.
Add 0.5 tbsp olive oil to a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook the chicken until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove the chicken and slice it into strips.
Add 0.15 tbsp olive oil to the pan.
Add 0.75 finely chopped garlic clove and 0.25 finely chopped shallot, sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add 2 tbsp lemon juice and 57 g of sugar snap peas.
Cook for 2 minutes.
Add the reserved pasta water and approximately 71 g of frozen peas.
Cook until the peas are just cooked through, about 2 minutes more.
Add the cooked pasta, 1 cup of spinach, sliced chicken, 0.5 tbsp chopped basil, 0.5 tbsp chopped parsley, and the remaining 0.5 tbsp olive oil.
Toss all the ingredients together to coat, season with additional salt and pepper.
Garnish with parsley leaves and serve immediately.

recipe_title: Butter Lettuce and Radish Salad with Lemon-Garlic Vinaigrette
original_instructions:
In 1-cup liquid measuring cup, whisk together lemon juice, vinegar, sugar, and 2 tablespoons water. Using mortar and pestle or food processor, grind or crush garlic, lemon zest, and kosher salt into fine paste. Whisk paste into lemon juice mixture. Gradually whisk in oil. Whisk in table salt and pepper to taste. In large bowl, toss together lettuce, radishes, minced herbs, and dressing. Divide mixture among 6 salad plates. Using vegetable peeler, shave curls of Parmesan atop each salad and serve.
In 1-cup liquid measuring cup, whisk together lemon juice, vinegar, sugar, and 2 tablespoons water. Using mortar and pestle or food processor, grind or crush garlic, lemon zest, and kosher salt into fine paste. Whisk paste into lemon juice mixture. Gradually whisk in oil. Whisk in table salt and pepper to taste.
In large bowl, toss together lettuce, radishes, minced herbs, and dressing. Divide mixture among 6 salad plates. Using vegetable peeler, shave curls of Parmesan atop each salad and serve.
ingredients: Table salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
3 heads butter lettuce, outer leaves discarded, leaves torn
1/4 cup mixed fresh herbs, such as parsley, tarragon, chervil, basil, and chives, minced
step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, a pinch of sherry vinegar, and a small pinch of sugar with 1 teaspoon water.
Using a mortar and pestle or food processor, grind or crush 1/6 clove garlic, a small pinch of lemon zest, and a small pinch of kosher salt into a fine paste.
Whisk the paste into the lemon juice mixture.
Gradually whisk in 2 teaspoons canola oil.
Season with table salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
In a large bowl, toss together approximately 1/2 head butter lettuce, 2 thinly sliced radishes, and a small amount of minced fresh herbs with the dressing.
Divide the mixture onto a salad plate.
Using a vegetable peeler, shave curls from 0.5 ounce Parmesan cheese over the salad and serve.

recipe_title: Cornish Game Hen with Raspberry-Red Wine Sauce
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 500°F. Sprinkle hen halves with thyme, salt and pepper. Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add hen halves, skin side down, and cook until brown, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer hen halves to baking sheet (do not clean skillet). Roast until juices run clear when thigh is pierced, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, pour off all but 2 tablespoons fat from skillet. Add shallots and sauté over medium heat until soft, about 3 minutes. Add broth, wine, raspberries, 2 teaspoons sugar and allspice. Boil until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon, scraping up browned bits and crushing raspberries, about 12 minutes. Strain wine sauce into small bowl. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper; add more sugar, if desired. Serve hen halves with sauce.
Preheat oven to 500°F. Sprinkle hen halves with thyme, salt and pepper. Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add hen halves, skin side down, and cook until brown, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer hen halves to baking sheet (do not clean skillet). Roast until juices run clear when thigh is pierced, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, pour off all but 2 tablespoons fat from skillet. Add shallots and sauté over medium heat until soft, about 3 minutes. Add broth, wine, raspberries, 2 teaspoons sugar and allspice. Boil until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon, scraping up browned bits and crushing raspberries, about 12 minutes. Strain wine sauce into small bowl. Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper; add more sugar, if desired. Serve hen halves with sauce.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 500°F.
Sprinkle hen half with 0.5 teaspoon dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add hen half, skin side down, and cook until brown, about 6 minutes per side.
Transfer hen half to baking sheet (do not clean skillet).
Roast in oven until juices run clear when thigh is pierced, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, pour off all but 1 tablespoon fat from skillet.
Add 2 tablespoons chopped shallots and sauté over medium heat until soft, about 3 minutes.
Add 1 cup canned low-salt chicken broth, 0.33 cup dry red wine, 0.33 cup frozen raspberries, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 0.125 teaspoon ground allspice.
Boil until sauce thickens enough to coat spoon, scraping up browned bits and crushing raspberries, about 12 minutes.
Strain wine sauce into small bowl.
Season sauce to taste with salt and pepper; add more sugar, if desired.
Serve hen half with sauce.

original_instructions:
Mix 8 cups water and vinegar in large bowl. Working with 1 Jerusalem artichoke at a time, peel and place in vinegar water to prevent discoloration. Set aside. Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add onion, leek, and garlic; sprinkle with salt and sauté until soft and translucent, stirring often, about 12 minutes. Drain artichokes; rinse well and drain again. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Add to onion mixture and sauté 5 minutes. Add 7 cups vegetable broth, increase heat to high, and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until artichokes are very tender, about 1 hour. Cool slightly. Working in batches, puree soup in blender until very smooth. Return to pot. Rewarm soup, adding more broth by 1/4 cupfuls if needed to thin. Stir in cream and season to taste with salt and white pepper. do ahead Can be made 1 day ahead. Cool, cover, and chill. Rewarm before continuing. Divide soup among bowls and garnish with toasted pumpkin seeds; top with a drizzle of pumpkin seed oil and some sautéed mushrooms, if desired. Tubers of a variety of sunflower; available in the produce section of some supermarkets and at farmers' markets.
Mix 8 cups water and vinegar in large bowl. Working with 1 Jerusalem artichoke at a time, peel and place in vinegar water to prevent discoloration. Set aside.
Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add onion, leek, and garlic; sprinkle with salt and sauté until soft and translucent, stirring often, about 12 minutes. Drain artichokes; rinse well and drain again. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Add to onion mixture and sauté 5 minutes. Add 7 cups vegetable broth, increase heat to high, and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until artichokes are very tender, about 1 hour. Cool slightly.
Working in batches, puree soup in blender until very smooth. Return to pot. Rewarm soup, adding more broth by 1/4 cupfuls if needed to thin. Stir in cream and season to taste with salt and white pepper. do ahead Can be made 1 day ahead. Cool, cover, and chill. Rewarm before continuing. Divide soup among bowls and garnish with toasted pumpkin seeds; top with a drizzle of pumpkin seed oil and some sautéed mushrooms, if desired.

Tubers of a variety of sunflower; available in the produce section of some supermarkets and at farmers' markets.
ingredients: 1 cup chopped leek (white and pale green parts only)
step_by_step_instructions: Mix 1 cup water and 0.19 teaspoons white wine vinegar in a large bowl.
Peel 0.25 pounds Jerusalem artichokes and place them in the vinegar water to prevent discoloration. Set aside.
Melt 0.38 tablespoons butter in a heavy large pot over medium heat.
Add 0.12 cups chopped onion, 0.12 cups chopped leek, and 0.25 garlic cloves, chopped. Sprinkle with salt and sauté until soft and translucent, stirring often, about 12 minutes.
Drain the artichokes, rinse well, and drain again. Cut into 1-inch pieces.
Add the artichokes to the onion mixture and sauté for 5 minutes.
Add 0.88 cups vegetable broth, increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until artichokes are very tender, about 1 hour.
Cool slightly, then work in batches to puree soup in blender until very smooth.
Return to pot and rewarm soup, adding more broth by 0.03 cupfuls if needed to thin.
Stir in 0.06 cups heavy whipping cream and season to taste with salt and ground white pepper.
Divide soup among bowls and garnish with toasted pumpkin seeds. Optionally, top with a drizzle of pumpkin seed oil and some sautéed chanterelle mushrooms.

recipe_title: Mussels with Sausage, Coconut Milk and Lime
original_instructions:
Heat oil in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, sausage, lemongrass, ginger and garlic and sauté 5 minutes. Add all remaining ingredients except cilantro and mussels and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Mix in half of cilantro. Meanwhile, place mussels in large pot. Cover and cook over medium heat until mussels open and release their juices, about 5 minutes (discard any mussels that do not open). Divide mussels among shallow soup bowls. Stir any mussel liquid into coconut-milk mixture; ladle over mussels. Sprinkle with remaining cilantro.
Heat oil in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion, sausage, lemongrass, ginger and garlic and sauté 5 minutes. Add all remaining ingredients except cilantro and mussels and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Mix in half of cilantro.
Meanwhile, place mussels in large pot. Cover and cook over medium heat until mussels open and release their juices, about 5 minutes (discard any mussels that do not open).
Divide mussels among shallow soup bowls. Stir any mussel liquid into coconut-milk mixture; ladle over mussels. Sprinkle with remaining cilantro.
ingredients: 8 ounces hot links sausage, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
2 cups fish stock or bottled clam juice
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoon of sesame oil in a heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat.

Add approximately 0.42 cup of thinly sliced red onions, 1.33 ounces of hot links sausage cut into 1/2-inch pieces, 0.07 cup of thinly sliced peeled lemongrass, 0.08 tablespoon of minced peeled fresh ginger, and 0.08 tablespoon of minced garlic.
Sauté the mixture for 5 minutes.

Add 0.33 cup of fish stock or bottled clam juice, 0.13 cup of canned unsweetened coconut milk, 0.5 tablespoon of fresh lime juice, 0.33 tablespoon of rice vinegar, 0.17 tablespoon of soy sauce, and 0.25 teaspoon of ground coriander to the saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Mix in 0.04 cup of chopped fresh cilantro into the coconut-milk mixture.
Meanwhile, place 6 mussels in a large pot.
Cover and cook over medium heat until the mussels open and release their juices, about 5 minutes. Discard any mussels that do not open.
Divide the mussels among shallow soup bowls.
Stir any mussel liquid into the coconut-milk mixture and ladle it over the mussels.
Sprinkle with the remaining cilantro.

recipe_title: Fava Bean, Asparagus, and Arugula Salad with Shaved Pecorino
original_instructions:
Cut asparagus stalks on a long diagonal into 1/8-inch-thick slices, leaving 1-inch-long tips (reserve tips separately). Blanch asparagus tips (but not sliced stalks) in a 4-quart pot of boiling salted water 2 minutes, then immediately transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Return water to a boil and blanch fava beans 1 minute, then immediately transfer with slotted spoon to ice water to stop cooking. Drain asparagus tips and beans and gently peel skins from beans (it's not necessary to peel edamame, if using). Toss beans and asparagus (blanched tips and raw sliced stalks) in a bowl with 1 tablespoon oil and salt and pepper to taste, then divide among 4 plates. Toss arugula with remaining tablespoon oil and salt and pepper to taste and mound on top of vegetables. Shave thin slices of cheese over salad with a vegetable peeler (use about half of piece), then drizzle with vinegar.
Cut asparagus stalks on a long diagonal into 1/8-inch-thick slices, leaving 1-inch-long tips (reserve tips separately).
Blanch asparagus tips (but not sliced stalks) in a 4-quart pot of boiling salted water 2 minutes, then immediately transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking.
Return water to a boil and blanch fava beans 1 minute, then immediately transfer with slotted spoon to ice water to stop cooking. Drain asparagus tips and beans and gently peel skins from beans (it's not necessary to peel edamame, if using).
Toss beans and asparagus (blanched tips and raw sliced stalks) in a bowl with 1 tablespoon oil and salt and pepper to taste, then divide among 4 plates. Toss arugula with remaining tablespoon oil and salt and pepper to taste and mound on top of vegetables. Shave thin slices of cheese over salad with a vegetable peeler (use about half of piece), then drizzle with vinegar.
ingredients: 2 cups shelled fresh fava beans (2 1/2 lb in pods) or shelled edamame (fresh soybeans)
step_by_step_instructions: Cut 2 ounces of asparagus stalks on a long diagonal into 1/8-inch-thick slices, leaving 1-inch-long tips and reserve the tips separately.
Blanch the asparagus tips in a pot of boiling salted water for 2 minutes.
Immediately transfer the blanched tips with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking.
Return the water to a boil and blanch 1/2 cup of shelled fava beans for 1 minute.
Immediately transfer the blanched beans to ice water to stop cooking.
Drain the asparagus tips and beans, then gently peel the skins from the beans.
Toss the peeled beans and asparagus (both blanched tips and raw sliced stalks) in a bowl with 3/4 tablespoon of olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Divide the mixture onto a plate.
Toss 1 ounce of arugula with the remaining 3/4 tablespoon of olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Mound the arugula on top of the vegetables.
Shave thin slices of Pecorino Romano over the salad using a vegetable peeler, using about 1 ounce of cheese.
Drizzle the salad with 1/2 teaspoon of balsamic vinegar.

original_instructions:
1. Boil a large pot of salted water. 2. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the flour. Blend well, then slowly stir in the flour until the mixture becomes a stiff batter. 3. Place a colander with large holes over the pot and, with a rubber spatula, press small amounts of the batter through the holes directly into the water. 4. As the spaetzle gradually rise to the surface of the boiling water, use a slotted spoon to transfer them to a serving dish. Serve immediately, while still warm.
1. Boil a large pot of salted water.
2. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the flour. Blend well, then slowly stir in the flour until the mixture becomes a stiff batter.
3. Place a colander with large holes over the pot and, with a rubber spatula, press small amounts of the batter through the holes directly into the water.
4. As the spaetzle gradually rise to the surface of the boiling water, use a slotted spoon to transfer them to a serving dish. Serve immediately, while still warm.
ingredients: 1 cup ricotta cheese, Greek yogurt, or buttermilk
step_by_step_instructions: Boil a pot of salted water.
In a bowl, combine 0.25 cup ricotta cheese, 0.75 egg, 0.25 teaspoon salt, 0.125 teaspoon white pepper, and 0.125 teaspoon grated nutmeg. Blend well.
Slowly stir in 0.625 cup all-purpose flour until the mixture becomes a stiff batter.
Place a colander with large holes over the pot and, with a rubber spatula, press small amounts of the batter through the holes directly into the boiling water.
As the spaetzle rise to the surface, use a slotted spoon to transfer them to a serving dish. Serve immediately, while still warm.

original_instructions:
For lamb: Whisk sugar, 3/4 cup salt, and 10 cups water in a large bowl until salt and sugar dissolve. Add lamb, cover, and chill for at least 12 hours and up to 2 days. Heat oil in a large heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add onions, garlic, rosemary sprig, thyme sprig, and bay leaf. Cook, stirring often, until onions are golden brown and soft, 10-15 minutes. Remove pot from heat and add wine, stirring and scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan. Return pot to heat and simmer until wine is reduced by half, about 3 minutes. Remove lamb shoulder from brine; add to pot, along with broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer gently, partially covered and skimming fat occasionally, until lamb is fork-tender, 5-6 hours. Transfer lamb to a platter and remove bones. Cut or shred meat into bite-size pieces. If needed, boil cooking liquid in pot until reduced to 6 cups, 15-30 minutes. Season sauce with salt, if needed. Return lamb to pot. DO AHEAD: Lamb can be prepared 3 days ahead. Let cool slightly, then chill until cold. Cover and keep chilled. Discard fat and reheat before serving.
Whisk sugar, 3/4 cup salt, and 10 cups water in a large bowl until salt and sugar dissolve. Add lamb, cover, and chill for at least 12 hours and up to 2 days.
Heat oil in a large heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add onions, garlic, rosemary sprig, thyme sprig, and bay leaf. Cook, stirring often, until onions are golden brown and soft, 10-15 minutes. Remove pot from heat and add wine, stirring and scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan. Return pot to heat and simmer until wine is reduced by half, about 3 minutes.

Return lamb to pot. DO AHEAD: Lamb can be prepared 3 days ahead. Let cool slightly, then chill until cold. Cover and keep chilled. Discard fat and reheat before serving.
For garlic emulsion and garnish: Place eggs in a small saucepan and add water to cover by 1". Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Cover and let sit for 3 minutes. Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water and let cool completely. Peel. Combine eggs, garlic, 3 tablespoons lemon juice, and 1/2 teaspoons salt in a blender. With the motor running, gradually add oil, blending until a creamy sauce forms. Season garlic emulsion with salt and more lemon juice, if desired. Cook broccoli in a large pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Drain; rinse under cold water. Divide stew among bowls and garnish with broccoli, parsley, tarragon, and garlic emulsion.
Place eggs in a small saucepan and add water to cover by 1". Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Cover and let sit for 3 minutes. Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water and let cool completely. Peel.
Combine eggs, garlic, 3 tablespoons lemon juice, and 1/2 teaspoons salt in a blender. With the motor running, gradually add oil, blending until a creamy sauce forms. Season garlic emulsion with salt and more lemon juice, if desired.
Cook broccoli in a large pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Drain; rinse under cold water.
Divide stew among bowls and garnish with broccoli, parsley, tarragon, and garlic emulsion.
ingredients: 1 bunch broccoli, stems reserved for another use, cut into small florets
Flat-leaf parsley and fresh tarragon leaves (for garnish)
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk 1.04 g sugar, 3.12 g salt, and 41.67 ml water in a large bowl until salt and sugar dissolve.
Add 90.72 g lamb shoulder, cover, and chill for at least 12 hours and up to 2 days.
Heat 2.08 ml oil in a large heavy pot over medium-high heat.
Add 0.33 medium onions, 0.33 garlic cloves, 0.08 rosemary sprig, 0.08 thyme sprig, and 0.08 bay leaf.
Cook, stirring often, until onions are golden brown and soft, about 10-15 minutes.
Remove pot from heat and add 41.67 ml wine, stirring and scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan.
Return pot to heat and simmer until wine is reduced by half, about 3 minutes.
Remove lamb shoulder from brine; add to pot, along with 333.33 ml broth.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer gently, partially covered and skimming fat occasionally, until lamb is fork-tender, about 5-6 hours.
Transfer lamb to a platter and remove bones. Cut or shred meat into bite-size pieces.
If needed, boil cooking liquid in pot until reduced to 250 ml, about 15-30 minutes.
Season sauce with salt, if needed.
Return lamb to pot.
Place 0.17 large eggs in a small saucepan and add water to cover by 1 inch.
Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Cover and let sit for 3 minutes.
Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water and let cool completely. Peel.
Combine eggs, 0.33 garlic cloves, 3.12 ml lemon juice, and 0.08 teaspoons salt in a blender.
With the motor running, gradually add 12.5 ml oil, blending until a creamy sauce forms.
Season garlic emulsion with salt and more lemon juice, if desired.
Cook 30 g broccoli in a large pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 4 minutes.
Drain; rinse under cold water.
Divide stew among bowls and garnish with broccoli, parsley, tarragon, and garlic emulsion.

original_instructions:
Boil potatoes in large pot of water just until centers can be pierced with sharp knife, about 20 minutes. Drain. Cover and refrigerate until well chilled. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead.) Peel potatoes. Using hand grater, coarsely grate potatoes into large bowl. Gently mix in green onions. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Beat eggs with cumin and gently mix into potato mixture. Form potatoes into 2 1/2-inch-diameter cakes (about 1 inch thick). Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook. (Can be prepared 6 hours ahead.) Heat 2 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potato cakes in batches and fry until golden brown, about 8 minutes per side, adding more oil as necessary.
Boil potatoes in large pot of water just until centers can be pierced with sharp knife, about 20 minutes. Drain. Cover and refrigerate until well chilled. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead.)
Peel potatoes. Using hand grater, coarsely grate potatoes into large bowl. Gently mix in green onions. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Beat eggs with cumin and gently mix into potato mixture. Form potatoes into 2 1/2-inch-diameter cakes (about 1 inch thick). Cover and refrigerate until ready to cook. (Can be prepared 6 hours ahead.)
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potato cakes in batches and fry until golden brown, about 8 minutes per side, adding more oil as necessary.
ingredients: 12 green onions (white and green parts), chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Boil 0.5 pounds of potatoes in a large pot of water until centers can be pierced with a sharp knife, about 20 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and cover them. Refrigerate until well chilled, which can be done 1 day ahead.
Peel the chilled potatoes.
Coarsely grate the potatoes into a large bowl using a hand grater.
Gently mix in 2 green onions, chopped.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Beat 0.33 eggs with 0.33 teaspoons of ground cumin.
Gently mix the egg mixture into the potato mixture.
Form the potato mixture into cakes that are 2.5 inches in diameter and about 1 inch thick.
Cover the potato cakes and refrigerate them until ready to cook, which can be done up to 6 hours ahead.
Heat 0.5 tablespoons of olive oil in a heavy large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add potato cakes in batches and fry until golden brown, about 8 minutes per side, adding more oil as necessary.

original_instructions:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 200°F. Stack 4 ovenproof plates on oven rack to warm. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 10-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot but not smoking. Stack 2 tortillas in skillet and cook 30 seconds, then flip stack over with tongs and cook 30 seconds more. While second tortilla cooks on bottom, turn top tortilla over with tongs, keeping tortillas stacked. Flip stack again and cook in same manner, turning over top tortilla and flipping stack again so that both tortillas are softened and both sides puff slightly, then deflate (do not let them become browned or crisp). Wrap tortillas loosely in foil and keep warm in oven. Fry remaining tortillas in same manner, adding 1 tablespoon oil to skillet for each batch. (Do not clean skillet.) Purée tomatoes with their juice, onion, cilantro, chipotle, garlic, and salt in a blender until very smooth. Carefully add mixture to hot skillet (it may spatter) and simmer, stirring occasionally, until salsa is slightly thickened, about 10 minutes. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch heavy nonstick skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then crack 4 eggs into skillet and cook 3 to 4 minutes for runny yolks, or to desired doneness. Transfer to a plate and keep warm, covered, then cook remaining 4 eggs in remaining tablespoon oil in same manner. Season eggs with salt and pepper. Spoon 1/4 cup salsa onto each plate and top with 2 tortillas, slightly overlapping them. Transfer 2 eggs to tortillas on each plate and top with some of remaining salsa. Sprinkle with cilantro.
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 200°F. Stack 4 ovenproof plates on oven rack to warm.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 10-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot but not smoking. Stack 2 tortillas in skillet and cook 30 seconds, then flip stack over with tongs and cook 30 seconds more. While second tortilla cooks on bottom, turn top tortilla over with tongs, keeping tortillas stacked. Flip stack again and cook in same manner, turning over top tortilla and flipping stack again so that both tortillas are softened and both sides puff slightly, then deflate (do not let them become browned or crisp). Wrap tortillas loosely in foil and keep warm in oven. Fry remaining tortillas in same manner, adding 1 tablespoon oil to skillet for each batch. (Do not clean skillet.)
Purée tomatoes with their juice, onion, cilantro, chipotle, garlic, and salt in a blender until very smooth. Carefully add mixture to hot skillet (it may spatter) and simmer, stirring occasionally, until salsa is slightly thickened, about 10 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch heavy nonstick skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then crack 4 eggs into skillet and cook 3 to 4 minutes for runny yolks, or to desired doneness. Transfer to a plate and keep warm, covered, then cook remaining 4 eggs in remaining tablespoon oil in same manner. Season eggs with salt and pepper.
Spoon 1/4 cup salsa onto each plate and top with 2 tortillas, slightly overlapping them. Transfer 2 eggs to tortillas on each plate and top with some of remaining salsa. Sprinkle with cilantro.
ingredients: 2 (14- to 15-ounce) cans whole tomatoes in juice
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro plus additional for sprinkling
1 tablespoon chopped canned chipotle chiles in adobo
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°F and place one ovenproof plate on the rack to warm.
Heat 0.75 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a 10-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot but not smoking.
Stack 1 tortilla in the skillet and cook for 30 seconds, then flip it over with tongs and cook for another 30 seconds.
Flip the tortilla again, ensuring both sides are softened and puffed slightly, then deflate. Do not let it become browned or crisp.
Wrap the tortilla loosely in foil and keep it warm in the oven.

Purée 3.5 ounces of tomatoes with 1.06 ounces of their juice, 0.06 ounces of chopped white onion, 0.03 ounces of chopped fresh cilantro, 0.003 ounces of chopped canned chipotle chiles in adobo, 0.25 garlic cloves, and 0.13 teaspoons of salt in a blender until very smooth.
Carefully add the mixture to the hot skillet and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the salsa is slightly thickened, about 10 minutes.
Heat 0.25 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a 12-inch heavy nonstick skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking.
Crack 1 egg into the skillet and cook for 3 to 4 minutes for runny yolks, or to desired doneness.
Season the egg with salt and pepper.
Spoon approximately 0.06 cups of salsa onto the warmed plate and top with the warmed tortilla.
Transfer the cooked egg onto the tortilla and top with some of the remaining salsa.
Sprinkle with a bit of cilantro.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Drizzle a thin layer of olive oil on a baking sheet. Stir together the salt, cumin and paprika in a small bowl until combined. Sprinkle a little of the spice mixture over the surface of the oiled baking sheet.
Spread the pita wedges evenly on the baking sheet and rub them in the oil to coat the undersides. Drizzle more oil over the tops of the pita, and season lightly with the spice mixture.
Bake until light golden brown and crisp, 7 to 10 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: Three 6-inch pita bread pockets, cut into small wedges
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Drizzle a thin layer of olive oil on a baking sheet.
Stir together 0.67 tablespoon kosher salt, 0.17 teaspoon ground cumin, and 0.17 teaspoon smoked paprika in a small bowl until combined.
Sprinkle a little of the spice mixture over the surface of the oiled baking sheet.
Spread approximately 3 ounces of pita wedges evenly on the baking sheet and rub them in the oil to coat the undersides.
Drizzle more olive oil over the tops of the pita, and season lightly with the spice mixture.
Bake until light golden brown and crisp, about 7 to 10 minutes.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions: Place almond paste and fondant in a mixing bowl with the dough hook attachment, set on first speed, beat until soft. Gradually add the syrups, then the powdered sugar to form a nice clay-like dough. Add food coloring by kneading it into the paste, by hand, on a board with a little powdered sugar. Shape into a 1-inch diameter log. Cut into 1-inch pieces and roll into a ball. Take a paring knife and gently make the indentations of the pumpkin.
step_by_step_instructions: Place 1.75 ounces of almond paste and 0.5 teaspoons of fondant in a mixing bowl with the dough hook attachment, set on first speed, and beat until soft.
Gradually add 0.5 teaspoons of corn syrup, then 1 tablespoon of powdered sugar to form a nice clay-like dough.
Add 1 drop of orange food coloring by kneading it into the paste by hand on a board with a little powdered sugar.
Shape into a 1-inch diameter log.
Cut into 1-inch pieces and roll into a ball.
Take a paring knife and gently make the indentations of the pumpkin.

recipe_title: Roasted Beet Salad with Pears and Marcona Almonds
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Place the beets on a sheet tray and roast until fork tender, about an hour. Remove and let cool.
Using a paring knife, peel the beets. Grate the beets and the pears on the largest holes of a box grater. Toss them with the balsamic, olive oil and salt.
Divide the arugula between 4 salad plates, spoon some of the beet-pear mixture onto the arugula and top with the chopped almonds and chives. Serve immediately.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Place 1 beet (approximately 0.25 of the total beets) on a sheet tray and roast until fork tender, about 1 hour. Remove and let cool.
Using a paring knife, peel the beet.
Grate the beet and 0.5 of a pear on the largest holes of a box grater.
Toss the grated beet and pear with 0.75 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, 1 teaspoon olive oil, and a pinch of salt.
Place 0.5 cup arugula on a salad plate.
Spoon some of the beet-pear mixture onto the arugula.
Top with 1 tablespoon chopped almonds and a sprinkle of chives.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
In a medium bowl, lightly toss the crabmeat, celery, chives, and tarragon together.
In a small bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, and mustard. Add the dressing to the crabmeat mixture and stir until just coated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. If not using right away refrigerate until ready to serve.
Serve on toasted rolls or on a bed of lettuce.
ingredients: 1 pound jumbo lump crabmeat, picked over to remove any shell or cartilage
1 stalk celery, peeled, and cut into 1/8-inch dice
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
Serving suggestions: Toasted hot dog rolls or Boston or Bibb lettuce leaves
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium bowl, lightly toss 2.67 oz crabmeat, 0.33 oz celery, 0.27 tsp chives, and 0.07 tsp tarragon together.
In a small bowl, stir together 0.88 tbsp mayonnaise, 0.8 tsp sour cream, 0.2 tsp lemon juice, and 0.1 tsp mustard.
Add the dressing to the crabmeat mixture and stir until just coated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
If not using right away, refrigerate until ready to serve.
Serve on a toasted roll or on a bed of lettuce.

original_instructions:
Place a medium soup pot over medium heat. Add the olive oil, butter, onions, garlic, salt and pepper. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the peas and basil, and heat until the peas are thawed.
Place the pea mixture in a blender. Add 1 cup of the chicken broth and pulse until pureed, adding more broth, if necessary, to puree. Return the pureed mixture to the pot. Stir in the remaining chicken broth and cream. Return the pan to medium heat and cook until hot, but not boiling.
To serve, place the soup in bowls. Float a thin slice of fresh mozzarella cheese on top of each soup and sprinkle with the diced roasted red bell peppers. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 4 to 6 very thin slices fresh mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup diced roasted red bell peppers (jarred is fine)
step_by_step_instructions: Place a medium soup pot over medium heat.
Add 0.33 tablespoon olive oil, 0.17 tablespoon butter, 0.17 small onion (diced), 0.17 clove garlic (minced), 0.17 teaspoon salt, and 0.08 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper to the pot.
Cook the mixture until the onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add approximately 0.75 cup frozen peas and 0.13 cup chopped fresh basil leaves to the pot, and heat until the peas are thawed.
Transfer the pea mixture to a blender.
Add 0.33 cup of chicken broth to the blender and pulse until pureed. Add more broth if necessary to puree.
Return the pureed mixture to the pot.
Stir in the remaining 0.67 cup chicken broth and 0.67 cup cream.
Return the pot to medium heat and cook until hot, but not boiling.
To serve, place the soup in a bowl.
Float a very thin slice of fresh mozzarella cheese (approximately 0.5 ounce) on top of the soup and sprinkle with approximately 0.04 cup diced roasted red bell peppers.
Serve immediately.
processed_ingredients: 0.04 cup diced roasted red bell peppers

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a large skillet, (seasoned cast iron does well here) cook the bacon over medium-high heat until crisp. Turn off the heat and transfer the bacon to a paper towel lined plate. Reserve the drippings in the pan.
On a cutting board, cut the stalk ends of the corn cobs to make a flat surface; stand them up and shave the corn from the cobs with a sharp chef's knife. Return the skillet to medium-low heat, and add the corn kernels. With the back of the knife, firmly scrape the cobs over a shallow plate to extract as much liquid (milk) as possible and add it to the skillet.
Season corn lightly with salt and pepper and cook until broken down and creamy, about 30 to 45 minutes, stirring often; add water if the pan gets too dry.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 8 large cobs fresh corn, preferably white, shucked and cleaned
Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: In a large skillet, cook 1 slice of bacon over medium-high heat until crisp.
Turn off the heat and transfer the bacon to a paper towel lined plate. Reserve the drippings in the pan.
On a cutting board, cut the stalk ends of 1 corn cob to make a flat surface; stand it up and shave the corn from the cob with a sharp chef's knife.
Return the skillet to medium-low heat, and add approximately 1 cup of corn kernels.
With the back of the knife, firmly scrape the cob over a shallow plate to extract as much liquid (milk) as possible and add it to the skillet.
Season corn lightly with a pinch of salt and pepper and cook until broken down and creamy, about 30 to 45 minutes, stirring often; add water if the pan gets too dry.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat skillet over medium high heat. Add oil, then butter. When butter melts, add red peppers and squash. Saute 12 to 14 minutes until squash is tender. Add salt, pepper and parsley. Add chives or scallions if you would like a layer of light onion flavor on the dish as well.
ingredients: 2 small to medium yellow squash, sliced
2 tablespoons chopped chives or 2 scallions, optional
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a skillet over medium high heat.
Add 0.25 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil and 0.5 tablespoon of butter to the skillet.
When the butter melts, add 0.06 red bell pepper (about 0.5 ounce) chopped and 0.5 small to medium yellow squash (about 3 ounces) sliced.
Sauté for 12 to 14 minutes until the squash is tender.
Add salt, pepper, and 0.5 tablespoon of chopped parsley leaves.
Optionally, add 0.5 tablespoon of chopped chives or scallions for a light onion flavor.

original_instructions: Top the pizza with the BBQ sauce, then add the chicken. Top with the onion slices and cheese. Bake according to the instructions on the pizza box, adding an extra minute or 2 if needed.
ingredients: Several thin slices red onion (sliced on a mandolin)
1 cup shredded Cheddar Jack cheese blend
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat your oven according to the instructions on the frozen cheese pizza box.
Spread approximately 2 tablespoons of BBQ sauce evenly over the pizza.
Shred about 3 ounces of rotisserie chicken and distribute it evenly on top of the BBQ sauce.
Slice the red onion thinly, using about 1/8 of an onion, and spread the slices over the chicken.
Sprinkle approximately 1/4 cup of shredded Cheddar Jack cheese evenly over the top.
Bake the pizza according to the instructions on the pizza box, adding an extra minute or two if needed.
processed_ingredients: 0.25 cup shredded Cheddar Jack cheese blend

recipe_title: White Rice Pilaf with Corn, Roasted Chiles, and Fresh Cheese
original_instructions: In a large heavy saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the rice and the onion and stir frequently for about 7 minutes, until the onion is softened but not browned. Add the hot broth, salt, and chile strips to the pan and bring it back up to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for about 10 minutes. Add the corn and simmer for 5 minutes more. Remove from the heat and let stand, covered, for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the rice is perfectly tender. Add the crumbled cheese and parsley and fluff with a fork, mixing all the ingredients evenly. Transfer to a warmed serving bowl and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 cups hot vegetable or chicken broth, preferably homemade
3 medium poblano chiles, roasted, peeled, stemmed, seeded (see Note), and cut into strips
1 cup fresh or thawed frozen corn kernels
1/2 cup Mexican queso fresco or feta cheese
1/2 bunch flatleaf parsley, leaves only, finely chopped
step_by_step_instructions: In a large heavy saucepan, heat 0.25 tablespoons of vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add 0.17 cup of long grain white rice and 0.17 cup of finely diced onion to the pan.
Stir frequently for about 7 minutes, until the onion is softened but not browned.
Add 0.33 cup of hot vegetable or chicken broth, 0.08 teaspoon of salt, and approximately 0.5 medium poblano chile, cut into strips, to the pan.
Bring the mixture back up to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for about 10 minutes.
Add 0.17 cup of fresh or thawed frozen corn kernels to the pan.
Simmer for 5 minutes more.
Remove from the heat and let stand, covered, for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the rice is perfectly tender.
Add 0.08 cup of crumbled Mexican queso fresco or feta cheese and 0.08 cup of finely chopped flatleaf parsley to the rice.
Fluff with a fork, mixing all the ingredients evenly.
Transfer to a warmed serving bowl and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cook bacon until crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towels and drain. Crumble bacon; reserve 2 tablespoons bacon drippings.
Sift flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder and salt into bowl. Add butter and rub in using fingertips until mixture resembles coarse meal. Whisk eggs, buttermilk, cumin and reserved bacon drippings in small bowl. Add to flour mixture and stir until moist dough forms. Mix in bacon.
Turn out dough onto lightly floured surface. Knead gently until smooth. Roll out to 3/4 inch thickness. Cut out biscuits with round cookie cutter. Place on greased baking sheet. Sprinkle with peppercorns.
Bake until golden brown and puffed, about 25 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons chilled unsalted butter, cut into pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Cook 1 slice of bacon until crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towels and drain. Crumble bacon; reserve 0.25 tablespoon bacon drippings.
Sift 0.25 cup all-purpose flour, 0.125 cup yellow cornmeal, 0.375 teaspoon sugar, 0.625 teaspoon baking powder, and 0.125 teaspoon salt into a bowl.
Add 1 tablespoon chilled unsalted butter, cut into pieces, and rub in using fingertips until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Whisk 0.25 large egg, 0.75 tablespoon buttermilk, 0.125 teaspoon ground cumin, and reserved bacon drippings in a small bowl.
