Add to flour mixture and stir until moist dough forms. Mix in crumbled bacon.
Turn out dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead gently until smooth.
Roll out to 3/4 inch thickness. Cut out a biscuit with a round cookie cutter.
Place on greased baking sheet. Sprinkle with fresh cracked black peppercorns.
Bake until golden brown and puffed, about 25 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Mix flour, cornstarch and garlic salt in medium bowl. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper. Dredge pork chops in flour mixture (do not shake off excess). Pour enough vegetable oil into heavy large skillet to reach depth of 1 inch. Heat oil to 350°F. Fry pork chops in oil until golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side
Mix flour, cornstarch and garlic salt in medium bowl. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper. Dredge pork chops in flour mixture (do not shake off excess).
Pour enough vegetable oil into heavy large skillet to reach depth of 1 inch. Heat oil to 350°F. Fry pork chops in oil until golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side
ingredients: 4 7-ounce center-cut pork loin rib chops (each about 3/4 inch thick)
step_by_step_instructions: Mix 2 tablespoons of flour, 1 tablespoon of cornstarch, and a pinch of garlic salt in a medium bowl.
Sprinkle the 7-ounce pork chop with salt and pepper.
Dredge the pork chop in the flour mixture, ensuring it is well-coated but not shaking off the excess.
Pour enough vegetable oil into a heavy large skillet to reach a depth of 1 inch.
Heat the oil to 350°F.
Fry the pork chop in the oil until it is golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes on each side.

recipe_title: Green Pea, Asparagus, and Parsley Soup
original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the leeks and sauté for 4 minutes, until softened. Add the broth and bring to a simmer. Stir in the peas and asparagus and simmer, covered, for 3 minutes longer. Carefully place half of the soup in a high-powered blender and puree until smooth, then return it to the pot. Add the parsley and thyme (if using), and stir well to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.
Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the leeks and sauté for 4 minutes, until softened. Add the broth and bring to a simmer. Stir in the peas and asparagus and simmer, covered, for 3 minutes longer. Carefully place half of the soup in a high-powered blender and puree until smooth, then return it to the pot. Add the parsley and thyme (if using), and stir well to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.
ingredients: 2 bunches of asparagus (30 to 40 stalks), tough ends removed and cut into 1-inch pieces
Himalayan or sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.13 tablespoon coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add 0.19 cup chopped leeks and sauté for 4 minutes, until softened.
Add 0.75 cup low-sodium vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
Stir in 1 cup frozen green peas and 0.25 cup asparagus pieces, then simmer, covered, for 3 minutes longer.
Carefully place half of the soup in a high-powered blender and puree until smooth, then return it to the pot.
Add 0.06 cup chopped fresh parsley and 0.25 teaspoon minced fresh thyme (optional), and stir well to combine.
Season with Himalayan salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste and serve.

original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the carrots, celery and onions and cook until the onions are soft and translucent, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the thyme and garlic and cook until fragrant, 45 to 60 seconds. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the flour over and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in the stock, and then the milk. Add the potatoes and bring the soup to a boil over high heat. Decrease the heat to low and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, puree the soup; leave it coarse and chunky if you prefer a more rustic soup, or puree until smooth for a more elegant soup. Add the cheese, about 1/3 cup at a time, stirring after each addition until melted and smooth. Taste and adjust for seasoning with salt and pepper.
To serve, ladle the soup into warmed bowls. Sprinkle with chives and serve immediately.
ingredients: Coarse kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
4 cups chicken stock or reduced-fat low-sodium chicken broth
4 russet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 1 3/4 pounds)
2 cups packed grated sharp white Cheddar (about 8 ounces)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoons of canola oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add 0.08 cups of finely chopped carrots, 0.08 cups of finely chopped celery, and 0.17 cups of finely chopped sweet onion; cook until onions are soft and translucent, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Add 0.17 teaspoons of chopped fresh thyme and 0.33 cloves of finely chopped garlic; cook until fragrant, 45 to 60 seconds.
Season with coarse kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of all-purpose flour over the mixture and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Gradually whisk in 0.67 cups of chicken stock and 0.5 cups of whole milk.
Add 0.5 of a russet potato, peeled and cut into 0.5-inch cubes, and bring the soup to a boil over high heat.
Decrease the heat to low and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, puree the soup to your desired consistency.
Add 0.67 ounces of grated sharp white Cheddar cheese, about 0.17 ounces at a time, stirring after each addition until melted and smooth.
Taste and adjust for seasoning with salt and pepper.
Ladle the soup into a warmed bowl and sprinkle with snipped fresh chives.

original_instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and drizzle with canola oil. Place 1 tortilla in the skillet to warm. Sprinkle over half the cheese. Spread half the chicken mixture over the cheese and top with a second tortilla. Cook 3 minutes. Flip it over and cook until the bottom is browned and the cheese is melted, another 2 to 3 minutes. Repeat for the second quesadilla. Slice and serve with the remoulade and top with cilantro, if desired.
ingredients: 1 cup shredded Monterey jack cheese, divided
Reserved 1/2 cup remoulade from Cajun Catfish Cakes with Remoulade
Chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish, optional
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and drizzle with 0.5 tablespoon canola oil.
Place 1 tortilla in the skillet to warm.
Sprinkle over 0.25 cup shredded Monterey jack cheese.
Spread 0.375 cup chicken mixture over the cheese and top with a second tortilla.
Cook for 3 minutes.
Flip it over and cook until the bottom is browned and the cheese is melted, another 2 to 3 minutes.
Slice and serve with 0.125 cup remoulade and top with cilantro if desired.

original_instructions:
1. Slice the apple into 1/2 inch thick slices. Rub the apple with the lemon wedge to prevent from going brown. 2. Slice the cheddar cheese into 1/2 inch wide slices and the ham in 1/2 or in 1/4 (the ham needs to be large enough to wrap around the apple). 3. Place an apple slice and a cheese slice on top of the deli meat and fold over deli meat to wrap.
1. Slice the apple into 1/2 inch thick slices. Rub the apple with the lemon wedge to prevent from going brown.
2. Slice the cheddar cheese into 1/2 inch wide slices and the ham in 1/2 or in 1/4 (the ham needs to be large enough to wrap around the apple).
3. Place an apple slice and a cheese slice on top of the deli meat and fold over deli meat to wrap.
ingredients: 2 slices cheddar cheese, cut in half
2 slices deli turkey or ham, cut in half
step_by_step_instructions: Slice the apple into 1/2 inch thick slices.
Rub the apple slices with the lemon wedge to prevent them from going brown.
Slice the cheddar cheese into 1/2 inch wide slices.
Slice the deli turkey into halves or quarters to ensure it is large enough to wrap around the apple.
Place an apple slice and a cheese slice on top of the deli meat.
Fold over the deli meat to wrap the apple and cheese slice.

original_instructions: Place potatoes in a medium saucepan and add water to cover generously. Add salt, turn on the heat, and bring to a simmer. Simmer 20 minutes or until tender when pierced with a knife. Drain and let cool. As soon as they are cool enough to handle, peel. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add peeled potatoes and roll around to coat evenly. Cook 5 minutes until starting to brown. Sprinkle over cilantro and fresh pepper and roll around to coat evenly. Serve immediately.;
ingredients: 1216 small Yukon Gold or Red Bliss potatoes, scrubbed but not peeled
step_by_step_instructions: Place 1 small potato in a medium saucepan and add water to cover generously.
Add 0.01 teaspoon salt, turn on the heat, and bring to a simmer.
Simmer for 20 minutes or until tender when pierced with a knife.
Drain and let cool.
As soon as it is cool enough to handle, peel the potato.
Heat 0.05 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add peeled potato and roll around to coat evenly.
Cook for 5 minutes until starting to brown.
Sprinkle over 0.01 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves and 0.01 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper and roll around to coat evenly.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: In a large skillet over medium high heat brown bacon and render its fat. Add chopped greens to the pan in batches and turn until they wilt, then add more greens. When all of the greens are in the pan, add vinegar and cook a minute. Season greens with sugar and salt. Add chicken broth to the pan and cover. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer greens 15 to 20 minutes then serve.
ingredients: 3 bunches mustard greens, trimmed and chopped
step_by_step_instructions: In a large skillet over medium high heat, brown approximately 1 slice of chopped bacon and render its fat.
Add about 1/3 of a bunch of chopped mustard greens to the pan in batches and turn until they wilt. Repeat until all greens are in the pan.
Add about 2 teaspoons of white vinegar to the greens and cook for a minute.
Season the greens with approximately 0.67 teaspoons of sugar and a pinch of coarse salt.
Add about 0.67 cups of chicken broth to the pan and cover.
Reduce heat to medium low and simmer the greens for 15 to 20 minutes, then serve.

recipe_title: Zucchine alla Scapece: Zucchini Finished in Vinegar
original_instructions: Heat up extra-virgin olive oil in a deep, heavy-bottomed pan for frying. Gently place the zucchini in hot oil and fry until golden. Then place the zucchini on an absorbent paper towel to drain excess the oil. Allow to cool. Place the fried zucchini, mint leaves, and garlic into a bowl. Season the zucchini with fresh extra-virgin olive oil, white wine vinegar, and salt. Mix well to coat evenly. Remove the quartered garlic cloves before serving.
ingredients: Extra-virgin olive oil, for frying, plus extra for seasoning
Small bunch fresh mint, leaves picked and chopped
step_by_step_instructions: Heat up approximately 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil in a deep, heavy-bottomed pan for frying.
Gently place about 1 small zucchini, thinly sliced, into the hot oil and fry until golden.
Place the fried zucchini on an absorbent paper towel to drain excess oil. Allow to cool.
In a bowl, combine the fried zucchini with about 0.5 tablespoon of fresh mint leaves and 0.5 clove of garlic, quartered.
Season the zucchini with an additional 0.5 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil, 0.5 tablespoon of white wine vinegar, and a pinch of salt.
Mix well to coat the zucchini evenly, then remove the quartered garlic cloves before serving.

original_instructions:
Combine tomatoes and juice in large bowl. Add corn, green onions, bell pepper, 2 tablespoons basil and garlic and blend well. Season to taste with hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper. Chill at least 15 minutes and up to 2 hours. Ladle soup into four bowls, dividing evenly. Garnish with yogurt and chopped basil and serve.
Combine tomatoes and juice in large bowl. Add corn, green onions, bell pepper, 2 tablespoons basil and garlic and blend well. Season to taste with hot pepper sauce, salt and pepper. Chill at least 15 minutes and up to 2 hours.
Ladle soup into four bowls, dividing evenly. Garnish with yogurt and chopped basil and serve.
ingredients: 2 cups chopped ripe plum tomatoes (about 14 ounces)
2 tablespoons finely shredded fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried, crumbled
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.5 cup chopped ripe plum tomatoes and 0.375 cup V8 vegetable juice in a bowl.
Add 0.25 cup thawed frozen corn kernels, 0.5 finely chopped green onion, 1 tablespoon chopped green bell pepper, 0.5 tablespoon finely shredded fresh basil, and 0.5 minced garlic clove.
Blend well and season with hot pepper sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Chill the mixture for at least 15 minutes, up to 2 hours.
Ladle the soup into a bowl.
Garnish with 1 tablespoon plain low-fat yogurt and chopped fresh basil.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Whisk the butter, olive oil, oregano and garlic salt. Toss with the bread cubes. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake until golden brown and toasted, 15 to 20 minutes.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Melt and whisk together 0.33 tablespoons unsalted butter, 0.33 tablespoons olive oil, 0.08 teaspoons dried oregano, and 0.08 teaspoons garlic salt.
Toss the mixture with 0.33 cups of 1/2-inch cubes of crusty Italian bread.
Spread the coated bread cubes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake until golden brown and toasted, approximately 15 to 20 minutes.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 3 large baking sheets with foil; butter foil. Place 1 1/4 cups chocolate chips in medium glass bowl. Microwave on medium-high until melted, stirring every 30 seconds, about 2 minutes. Cool 15 minutes. Mix flour and baking powder in small bowl. Using electric mixer, beat sugar, eggs, corn syrup and extract in medium bowl until thick, about 3 minutes. Gradually beat in melted chocolate, then dry ingredients. Mix in remaining chocolate chips; freeze 10 minutes. Drop 7 heaping tablespoons batter on each prepared baking sheet, spacing 3 inches apart (cookies will spread). Bake until cookies are cracked on top and softly set, about 15 minutes. Cool cookies on baking sheets 5 minutes. Using metal spatula, transfer cookies to racks and cool completely.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 3 large baking sheets with foil; butter foil. Place 1 1/4 cups chocolate chips in medium glass bowl. Microwave on medium-high until melted, stirring every 30 seconds, about 2 minutes. Cool 15 minutes.
Mix flour and baking powder in small bowl. Using electric mixer, beat sugar, eggs, corn syrup and extract in medium bowl until thick, about 3 minutes. Gradually beat in melted chocolate, then dry ingredients. Mix in remaining chocolate chips; freeze 10 minutes.
Drop 7 heaping tablespoons batter on each prepared baking sheet, spacing 3 inches apart (cookies will spread). Bake until cookies are cracked on top and softly set, about 15 minutes. Cool cookies on baking sheets 5 minutes. Using metal spatula, transfer cookies to racks and cool completely.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Line a large baking sheet with foil; butter the foil.
Place approximately 0.31 cup of chocolate chips in a medium glass bowl.
Microwave on medium-high until melted, stirring every 30 seconds, about 2 minutes.
Cool for 15 minutes.
Mix approximately 0.75 tablespoon of flour and 0.06 teaspoon of baking powder in a small bowl.
Using an electric mixer, beat approximately 0.19 cup of sugar, 1 egg, 0.5 tablespoon of corn syrup, and 0.06 teaspoon of peppermint extract in a medium bowl until thick, about 3 minutes.
Gradually beat in melted chocolate, then the dry ingredients.
Mix in the remaining approximately 0.19 cup of chocolate chips; freeze the mixture for 10 minutes.
Drop approximately 2 heaping tablespoons of batter on the prepared baking sheet, spacing 3 inches apart.
Bake until cookies are cracked on top and softly set, about 15 minutes.
Cool cookies on the baking sheet for 5 minutes.
Using a metal spatula, transfer cookies to a rack and cool completely.

recipe_title: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio With Lots of Kale
original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Meanwhile, strip kale leaves from ribs and stems, then tear leaves crosswise into 2"–3" pieces. Cook kale in boiling water until bright green and slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Using tongs, transfer kale to a colander and rinse under cold water, tossing; squeeze out excess liquid from leaves. Keep water at a boil (you’ll use it for the pasta). Whack garlic with the side of a chef’s knife to crush; peel off skins. Heat 1/4 cup oil in a large heavy pot over medium. Cook garlic, stirring occasionally, until sizzling, about 3 minutes. Season very generously with black pepper and cook, smashing with a wooden spoon, until cloves break into rough pieces, soften, and look golden. Add kale to pot and cook, stirring often, until darkened in color and very tender, about 8 minutes (garlic will break into even smaller pieces). Season with kosher salt and pepper. Meanwhile, cook pasta, stirring occasionally, until very al dente (2–3 minutes less than package directions). Using tongs, add pasta to kale; splash in about 1 cup pasta cooking liquid. Cook, tossing and adding more pasta cooking liquid as needed, until sauce lightly coats pasta, about 2 minutes. Serve pasta topped with Parmesan, red pepper flakes, sea salt, and more black pepper.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Meanwhile, strip kale leaves from ribs and stems, then tear leaves crosswise into 2"–3" pieces. Cook kale in boiling water until bright green and slightly softened, about 2 minutes. Using tongs, transfer kale to a colander and rinse under cold water, tossing; squeeze out excess liquid from leaves. Keep water at a boil (you’ll use it for the pasta).
Whack garlic with the side of a chef’s knife to crush; peel off skins. Heat 1/4 cup oil in a large heavy pot over medium. Cook garlic, stirring occasionally, until sizzling, about 3 minutes. Season very generously with black pepper and cook, smashing with a wooden spoon, until cloves break into rough pieces, soften, and look golden. Add kale to pot and cook, stirring often, until darkened in color and very tender, about 8 minutes (garlic will break into even smaller pieces). Season with kosher salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, cook pasta, stirring occasionally, until very al dente (2–3 minutes less than package directions).
Using tongs, add pasta to kale; splash in about 1 cup pasta cooking liquid. Cook, tossing and adding more pasta cooking liquid as needed, until sauce lightly coats pasta, about 2 minutes.
Serve pasta topped with Parmesan, red pepper flakes, sea salt, and more black pepper.
ingredients: 3 large or 4 smaller bunches kale, any type (about 1 1/2 pounds)
1/4 cup olive oil, plus more for drizzling
12 ounces spaghetti, thick spaghetti, bucatini, or other long strand pasta
Parmesan and crushed red pepper flakes (for serving)
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Strip about 0.5 pound of kale leaves from ribs and stems, then tear leaves crosswise into 2"–3" pieces.
Cook kale in boiling water until bright green and slightly softened, about 2 minutes.
Using tongs, transfer kale to a colander and rinse under cold water, tossing; squeeze out excess liquid from leaves.
Keep water at a boil for the pasta.
Whack 1 garlic clove with the side of a chef’s knife to crush; peel off skins.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large heavy pot over medium.
Cook garlic, stirring occasionally, until sizzling, about 3 minutes.
Season very generously with black pepper and cook, smashing with a wooden spoon, until cloves break into rough pieces, soften, and look golden.
Add kale to pot and cook, stirring often, until darkened in color and very tender, about 8 minutes.
Season with kosher salt and pepper.
Meanwhile, cook 3 ounces of pasta, stirring occasionally, until very al dente (2–3 minutes less than package directions).
Using tongs, add pasta to kale; splash in about 0.25 cup pasta cooking liquid.
Cook, tossing and adding more pasta cooking liquid as needed, until sauce lightly coats pasta, about 2 minutes.
Serve pasta topped with Parmesan, red pepper flakes, sea salt, and more black pepper.

original_instructions:
Preheat 2 medium non-stick skillets over medium-low heat for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, lay the fillets on a piece of wax paper, parchment, or a baking sheet and blot dry with paper towels. Season the fillets with salt and pepper. (If the fillets tapers down to a very thin tail, fold the tail back to make a more uniformly thick fillet.) Put the flour on a plate. Dredge the rounded-sides of the fillets in the flour and shake off any excess.
Raise the heat to medium-high and add 1 tablespoon of butter to each skillet. When the butter stops foaming, add 2 fillets to each pan, rounded-side down, and cook, lightly shaking the skillets occasionally, until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Turn off the heat, flip the fillets with a spatula, and let the fillets finish cooking in the residual heat in the pans, about 2 minutes more. Transfer the fillets to 4 warm plates and cover loosely with foil.
Add the lemon juice and water to one of the skillets. While moving the skillet in a circular motion, add the remaining 3 tablespoons butter, little by little, until melted and a smooth, creamy sauce is formed. Stir in the parsley and thyme and season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon some of the sauce over each fillet and serve immediately.
ingredients: Four 4-ounce skinless sole or flounder fillets
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
5 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into tablespoon-sized pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a medium non-stick skillet over medium-low heat for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, lay one fillet on a piece of wax paper, parchment, or a baking sheet and blot dry with paper towels.
Season the fillet with salt and pepper.
If the fillet tapers down to a very thin tail, fold the tail back to make a more uniformly thick fillet.
Put some flour on a plate.
Dredge the rounded side of the fillet in the flour and shake off any excess.
Raise the heat to medium-high and add 0.5 tablespoon of butter to the skillet.
When the butter stops foaming, add the fillet to the pan, rounded side down, and cook, lightly shaking the skillet occasionally, until golden brown, about 2 minutes.
Turn off the heat, flip the fillet with a spatula, and let it finish cooking in the residual heat in the pan, about 2 minutes more.
Transfer the fillet to a warm plate and cover loosely with foil.
Add 0.5 tablespoon of lemon juice and 0.5 teaspoon of water to the skillet.
While moving the skillet in a circular motion, add 0.75 tablespoon butter, little by little, until melted and a smooth, creamy sauce is formed.
Stir in 0.25 teaspoon parsley and 0.25 teaspoon thyme and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon some of the sauce over the fillet and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Set aside 2 garlic cloves for bread slices. Place remaining garlic on double layer of heavy-duty foil; drizzle 3 tablespoons olive oil over. Fold up and seal packet. Place directly on grill rack and cook until garlic is very tender and golden, about 30 minutes. Open packet; cool garlic. Toss shrimp (in shells) and 1 tablespoon oil in medium bowl to coat; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine plum tomatoes, green onions, sweet onion, both bell peppers, and 2 tablespoons oil in large bowl; toss to coat. Arrange cucumber halves and bread slices on baking sheet; brush with 2 tablespoons oil. Sprinkle all vegetables with salt and pepper. Grill shrimp until just opaque, about 2 1/2 minutes per side; transfer to another bowl and cool. Grill vegetables until crisp-tender, turning frequently, about 3 minutes for plum tomatoes and green onions, 5 minutes for cucumbers, and 15 minutes for sweet onion and bell peppers. Transfer to large rimmed baking sheet. Grill bread slices until just beginning to crisp and grill marks appear, about 2 1/2 minutes per side. Rub bread with reserved garlic cloves, then discard garlic cloves. Peel shrimp; transfer to large bowl. Cut all vegetables and bread into 1/2- to 3/4-inch pieces; add to shrimp along with any accumulated juices. Stir in grilled garlic cloves and grape tomatoes. Whisk vinegar, hot pepper sauce, and remaining 4 tablespoons oil in small bowl; pour over salad and toss to coat. Do ahead: Can be made 1 1/2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Stir thinly sliced basil into salad. Season salad to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with lime wedges.
Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Set aside 2 garlic cloves for bread slices. Place remaining garlic on double layer of heavy-duty foil; drizzle 3 tablespoons olive oil over. Fold up and seal packet. Place directly on grill rack and cook until garlic is very tender and golden, about 30 minutes. Open packet; cool garlic.
Toss shrimp (in shells) and 1 tablespoon oil in medium bowl to coat; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine plum tomatoes, green onions, sweet onion, both bell peppers, and 2 tablespoons oil in large bowl; toss to coat. Arrange cucumber halves and bread slices on baking sheet; brush with 2 tablespoons oil. Sprinkle all vegetables with salt and pepper. Grill shrimp until just opaque, about 2 1/2 minutes per side; transfer to another bowl and cool. Grill vegetables until crisp-tender, turning frequently, about 3 minutes for plum tomatoes and green onions, 5 minutes for cucumbers, and 15 minutes for sweet onion and bell peppers. Transfer to large rimmed baking sheet. Grill bread slices until just beginning to crisp and grill marks appear, about 2 1/2 minutes per side. Rub bread with reserved garlic cloves, then discard garlic cloves.
Peel shrimp; transfer to large bowl. Cut all vegetables and bread into 1/2- to 3/4-inch pieces; add to shrimp along with any accumulated juices. Stir in grilled garlic cloves and grape tomatoes. Whisk vinegar, hot pepper sauce, and remaining 4 tablespoons oil in small bowl; pour over salad and toss to coat.
Do ahead: Can be made 1 1/2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature.
Stir thinly sliced basil into salad. Season salad to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with lime wedges.
ingredients: 2 medium heads of garlic, separated into cloves, peeled (about 24 cloves)
1 1/2 pounds uncooked large shrimp, deveined but with shells intact*
2 bunches green onions; root ends trimmed, onions left whole
1 1-pound sweet onion (such as Vidalia or Maui), cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices
1 1/2 large English hothouse cucumbers, peeled, halved lengthwise
step_by_step_instructions: Prepare a barbecue to medium-high heat.
Set aside 2 garlic cloves for bread slices.
Place the remaining garlic cloves on a double layer of heavy-duty foil and drizzle about 1 tablespoon of olive oil over them.
Fold up and seal the foil packet.
Place the packet directly on the grill rack and cook until the garlic is very tender and golden, about 30 minutes. Open the packet and let the garlic cool.
Toss about 3 ounces of shrimp (in shells) with approximately 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a medium bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Combine about 1 tomato, 2 green onions, 2 slices of sweet onion, 1/4 red bell pepper, and 1/4 yellow bell pepper with approximately 2 teaspoons of olive oil in a large bowl and toss to coat.
Arrange 1 cucumber half and 1 bread slice on a baking sheet; brush with about 2 teaspoons of olive oil.
Sprinkle all vegetables with salt and pepper.
Grill shrimp until just opaque, approximately 2 1/2 minutes per side, then transfer to another bowl and cool.

Grill vegetables until crisp-tender, turning frequently. Grill for about 3 minutes for tomatoes and green onions, 5 minutes for cucumbers, and 15 minutes for onions and bell peppers. Transfer to a large rimmed baking sheet.
Grill bread slices until just beginning to crisp and grill marks appear, about 2 1/2 minutes per side.
Rub grilled bread with reserved garlic cloves, then discard the garlic cloves.
Peel shrimp and transfer to a large bowl.
Cut all vegetables and bread into 1/2- to 3/4-inch pieces; add to shrimp along with any accumulated juices.
Stir in grilled garlic cloves and about 1/2 cup of halved grape tomatoes.
Whisk 1 tablespoon of red wine vinegar, 1/4 teaspoon of hot pepper sauce, and about 2 teaspoons of olive oil in a small bowl; pour over the salad and toss to coat.
Let the salad stand at room temperature for up to 1 1/2 hours if needed.
Stir about 1 tablespoon of thinly sliced basil into the salad.
Season the salad to taste with salt and pepper.
Serve with lime wedges.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Put the potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water by 1 inch; season with salt. Bring to a boil; reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until tender, 10 minutes. Drain.
Combine the buttermilk, mayonnaise and relish in a large bowl. Add the potatoes, sliced celery, scallions, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste; toss. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Whisk the egg whites in a large bowl. Put the breadcrumbs in another bowl. Season the fish with the paprika, 1 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Dip each piece in the egg whites, then dredge in the breadcrumbs, pressing to coat. Transfer to a rack set over a baking sheet.
Coat the fish on both sides with cooking spray. Bake until golden brown and just cooked through, about 12 minutes. Top the potato salad with celery leaves. Serve with the fish and lemon wedges.
Photograph by Justin Walker
ingredients: 2 stalks celery, thinly sliced, plus chopped celery leaves for topping
1 1/4 pounds cod (preferably Pacific cod), cut into 8 pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Put about 5.4 ounces of quartered potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water by 1 inch; season with salt.
Bring to a boil; reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain.
Combine 0.5 tablespoon of buttermilk, 0.5 tablespoon of mayonnaise, and 0.67 teaspoon of relish in a large bowl.
Add the cooked potatoes, about 0.5 ounce of sliced celery, 0.5 tablespoon of sliced scallions, approximately 0.05 teaspoon of salt, and pepper to taste; toss.
Refrigerate the potato salad until ready to serve.
Whisk 0.5 large egg white in a large bowl.
Put about 0.25 cup of panko breadcrumbs in another bowl.
Season approximately 2 ounces of cod with about 0.125 teaspoon of paprika, 0.17 teaspoon of salt, and a few grinds of pepper.
Dip each piece of cod in the egg white, then dredge in the breadcrumbs, pressing to coat.
Transfer to a rack set over a baking sheet.
Coat the fish on both sides with cooking spray.
Bake until golden brown and just cooked through, about 12 minutes.
Top the potato salad with chopped celery leaves.
Serve the fish with the potato salad and a lemon wedge.

original_instructions:
Soak bread in water to cover 30 minutes, then squeeze gently to remove as much water as possible. Pulse onion in a food processor until finely chopped. Add parsley and pulse to finely chop. Add lamb, bread, spices, and 1 tsp salt and pulse until combined. Divide mixture into 20 portions (about 1/4 cup each), forming each into a ball. Roll each ball into a 5-inch-long "cigar." Slide a skewer lengthwise through center of each. Prepare grill for direct-heat cooking over medium-hot charcoal (medium-high heat for gas). Oil grill rack, then grill köfte, covered only if using a gas grill, rotating a quarter turn occasionally, until just cooked through, about 5 minutes total.
Soak bread in water to cover 30 minutes, then squeeze gently to remove as much water as possible.
Pulse onion in a food processor until finely chopped. Add parsley and pulse to finely chop. Add lamb, bread, spices, and 1 tsp salt and pulse until combined.
Divide mixture into 20 portions (about 1/4 cup each), forming each into a ball. Roll each ball into a 5-inch-long "cigar." Slide a skewer lengthwise through center of each.
Prepare grill for direct-heat cooking over medium-hot charcoal (medium-high heat for gas).
Oil grill rack, then grill köfte, covered only if using a gas grill, rotating a quarter turn occasionally, until just cooked through, about 5 minutes total.
ingredients: 3 slices firm white sandwich bread, torn into pieces
1 teaspoon Aleppo pepper or 1/2 teaspoon hot red-pepper flakes
20 (8- to 10-inch) wooden skewers, soaked in water 30 minutes
tarator sauce ; chopped tomatoes; chopped onion; pita bread
step_by_step_instructions: Soak 0.15 slices of firm white sandwich bread in water for 30 minutes, then squeeze gently to remove as much water as possible.
Pulse 0.05 medium onion in a food processor until finely chopped.
Add 0.03 cup of chopped flat-leaf parsley to the food processor and pulse to finely chop.

Add 0.08 lb ground lamb, soaked bread, 0.05 teaspoon ground allspice, 0.05 teaspoon Aleppo pepper, 0.03 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 0.01 teaspoon ground cloves, and 0.05 teaspoon salt to the food processor and pulse until combined.
Divide the mixture into 1 portion, forming it into a ball, then roll into a 5-inch-long 'cigar.'
Slide a skewer lengthwise through the center of the 'cigar.'
Prepare grill for direct-heat cooking over medium-hot charcoal or medium-high heat if using gas.
Oil the grill rack, then grill the köfte, covered only if using a gas grill, rotating a quarter turn occasionally, until just cooked through, about 5 minutes.

original_instructions:
Heat oil in a large Dutch oven or skillet over medium and cook bacon, turning occasionally, until brown and lightly crisped, 5–8 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Season chicken generously with salt and pepper. Cook, skin side down, in bacon drippings, until skin is very deep golden brown, 12–15 minutes. Transfer to plate with bacon, placing skin side up. Add garlic and tomatoes to same pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until garlic is lightly browned and tomatoes have burst, about 5 minutes. Add wine, scraping up browned bits. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced by three-fourths. Add half of kimchi and nestle bacon and chicken, skin side up, into tomatoes (make sure chicken skin is above surface of liquid to keep it crispy). Bring to a simmer and cook, reducing heat if needed, until chicken is tender and cooked through, 45–60 minutes. Transfer chicken back to plate and bring braising liquid to a simmer; cook until slightly thickened, 8–10 minutes. Meanwhile, cook egg noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid. Return noodles to pasta pot and add butter and 1/4 cup pasta cooking liquid. Toss, adding more pasta cooking liquid as needed, until pasta is coated with buttery sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Stir remaining kimchi into chicken braising liquid; season with salt and pepper. Place chicken, skin side up, in braising liquid. Sprinkle half of chives over chicken and half over noodles; toss noodles to combine. Serve chicken and tomato-kimchi sauce over buttery noodles.
Heat oil in a large Dutch oven or skillet over medium and cook bacon, turning occasionally, until brown and lightly crisped, 5–8 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Season chicken generously with salt and pepper. Cook, skin side down, in bacon drippings, until skin is very deep golden brown, 12–15 minutes. Transfer to plate with bacon, placing skin side up.
Add garlic and tomatoes to same pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until garlic is lightly browned and tomatoes have burst, about 5 minutes. Add wine, scraping up browned bits. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced by three-fourths.
Add half of kimchi and nestle bacon and chicken, skin side up, into tomatoes (make sure chicken skin is above surface of liquid to keep it crispy). Bring to a simmer and cook, reducing heat if needed, until chicken is tender and cooked through, 45–60 minutes.
Transfer chicken back to plate and bring braising liquid to a simmer; cook until slightly thickened, 8–10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook egg noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid.
Return noodles to pasta pot and add butter and 1/4 cup pasta cooking liquid. Toss, adding more pasta cooking liquid as needed, until pasta is coated with buttery sauce. Season with salt and pepper.
Stir remaining kimchi into chicken braising liquid; season with salt and pepper. Place chicken, skin side up, in braising liquid. Sprinkle half of chives over chicken and half over noodles; toss noodles to combine.
Serve chicken and tomato-kimchi sauce over buttery noodles.
ingredients: 4 ounces slab bacon, sliced 1/4 inch thick, cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces
1 (3 1/2–4-pound) chicken, cut into 10 pieces; or 4 chicken legs, drumsticks and thighs separated, plus 2 skin-on, bone-in breasts, cut crosswise
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or skillet over medium heat.
Cook 1 ounce slab bacon, sliced 1/4 inch thick and cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces, turning occasionally, until brown and lightly crisped, 5–8 minutes.
Transfer bacon to a plate.
Season 1 chicken piece (about 1/2 lb) generously with salt and pepper.
Cook chicken, skin side down, in bacon drippings, until skin is very deep golden brown, 12–15 minutes.
Transfer chicken to the plate with bacon, placing skin side up.
Add 2 cloves garlic, lightly crushed, and approximately 4 ounces cherry tomatoes to the same pot.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until garlic is lightly browned and tomatoes have burst, about 5 minutes.
Add 1/4 cup dry white wine, scraping up browned bits.
Bring to a boil and cook until reduced by three-fourths.
Add 1/2 cup kimchi and nestle bacon and chicken, skin side up, into tomatoes (make sure chicken skin is above surface of liquid to keep it crispy).
Bring to a simmer and cook, reducing heat if needed, until chicken is tender and cooked through, 45–60 minutes.
Transfer chicken back to plate and bring braising liquid to a simmer; cook until slightly thickened, 8–10 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook 1.5 ounces wide egg noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente.
Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons pasta cooking liquid.
Return noodles to pasta pot and add 0.5 tablespoon unsalted butter and 1 tablespoon pasta cooking liquid.
Toss, adding more pasta cooking liquid as needed, until pasta is coated with buttery sauce.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir remaining 1/2 cup kimchi into chicken braising liquid; season with salt and pepper.
Place chicken, skin side up, in braising liquid.
Sprinkle 1 tablespoon sliced chives over chicken and 1 tablespoon over noodles; toss noodles to combine.
Serve chicken and tomato-kimchi sauce over buttery noodles.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Wash the fingerling potatoes, pat dry, and season with olive oil spray and half of the salt, pepper, and fresh herbs. Place the potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes or until soft to the touch.
Slice the zucchini in thirds crosswise; slice each piece into quarters lengthwise. For a classic French presentation, round the angled sides to form 12 oval sticks
Season the chicken with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, and 1 teaspoon herbs. Heat a saute pan over medium-high heat and add the olive oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pan. Sear the chicken breasts on 1 side for about 2 minutes and turn over. Add the leeks, carrots, mushrooms, zucchini, and garlic. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute to sear the vegetables. Add the white wine, and boil until the wine is reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Stir in the stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, 7 to 10 minutes. Add the Swiss chard to 1 side of the pan to braise the greens in the cooking liquid, about 1 minute.
To serve: Place 1/2 cup of the Swiss chard in the center of 4 large soup bowls. Slice each chicken breast on an angle into 5 pieces. Arrange the chicken on top of the Swiss chard. Divide the vegetables among the 4 bowls and ladle the broth around the vegetables.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons fresh herb mix (equal parts finely chopped fresh basil, oregano, flat-leaf parsley, and thyme)
4 (4-ounce) chicken or pheasant breasts, skin removed
1 leek (white part only), cut in 1/2 lengthwise, cut into 1/2-inch slices
1 cup morel or small crimini mushrooms
2 cups chicken stock, or canned chicken broth
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Wash 2 fingerling potatoes, pat dry, and season with a light spray of olive oil and a pinch of salt, pepper, and herb mix.
Place the potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes or until soft to the touch.
Slice 1/4 of a zucchini into thirds crosswise; slice each piece into quarters lengthwise to form oval sticks.
Season 1 chicken breast with a pinch of salt, pepper, and herb mix.
Heat a saute pan over medium-high heat and add 0.06 teaspoon olive oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pan.
Sear the chicken breast on one side for about 2 minutes and turn over.
Add 1/4 of a leek, 2 baby carrots, 0.25 cup mushrooms, zucchini slices, and 0.25 teaspoon minced garlic.
Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute to sear the vegetables.
Add 0.12 cup white wine, and boil until the wine is reduced by half, about 2 minutes.
Stir in 0.5 cup chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, 7 to 10 minutes.
Add 1 cup chopped Swiss chard to one side of the pan to braise the greens in the cooking liquid, about 1 minute.
To serve, place 1/2 cup of the Swiss chard in the center of a soup bowl.
Slice the chicken breast on an angle into 5 pieces and arrange on top of the Swiss chard.
Divide the vegetables among the bowl and ladle the broth around the vegetables.

recipe_title: "Pearl Balls" - Pork Meatballs in Sticky Rice
original_instructions:
Put the pork on a large cutting board and very finely mince it with a sharp, heavy knife or cleaver until the fat is broken down (or use 2 large heavy cleavers to get the job done quicker!). Spread out the pork into a thin layer on the board. Grate the ginger, shallot and bouillon over the meat using a fine grater, and then sprinkle on the cornstarch, five-spice, Shaoshing, salt, pepper and egg yolk. Mix well until combined using a knife or spatula.
Put some cornstarch in a shallow bowl. Roll the pork mixture into ping pong ball-size meatballs, and then roll in the cornstarch to lightly coat. Shake off the excess and transfer the meatballs to a plate.
Using wet hands, put some of the soaked rice in your palm and roll the meatball in it with your hands, pressing gently, until evenly coated in rice. Continue rolling until the meatballs are all coated with the rice.
Fill a wok one-third full with water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Put a shallow flat bowl or plate with a lip into a bamboo steamer basket (make sure the plate is at least 1/2 inch smaller than the diameter of the basket) and evenly space the rice balls on the plate, being sure they do not touch each other. Cover the basket with the lid and lower it into the wok. Steam the meatballs, adding water to the wok as necessary to prevent the basket from scorching, until set and firm, 20 to 25 minutes.
Carefully remove the rice balls from the steamer and transfer to a platter. Serve the meatballs with toothpicks on the side for skewering and dipping into vinegar, chili oil, or soy sauce.
ingredients: One 12-ounce piece boneless, skinless pork belly or ground pork
1 teaspoon cornstarch, plus more for rolling
Sea salt and freshly ground white pepper
1/2 cup glutinous white rice, soaked overnight in cold water and drained
Black rice vinegar, chili oil, or soy sauce, for dipping, optional
step_by_step_instructions: Finely mince 3 ounces of boneless, skinless pork belly using a sharp knife or cleaver.
Spread the minced pork into a thin layer on the cutting board.
Grate a small piece of ginger and a shallot over the pork using a fine grater.
Sprinkle 0.13 cube of vegetable bouillon over the mixture.

Add 0.25 teaspoon of cornstarch, 0.25 teaspoon of Chinese five-spice powder, 0.25 teaspoon of Shaoshing rice wine, a pinch of salt, a pinch of white pepper, and 0.25 of a beaten egg yolk to the pork mixture.
Mix all ingredients well until combined using a knife or spatula.
Place 0.25 teaspoon of cornstarch in a shallow bowl.
Roll the pork mixture into a ping pong ball-sized meatball and lightly coat with cornstarch. Shake off the excess.
With wet hands, place some soaked glutinous rice in your palm and roll the meatball in it until evenly coated.
Fill a wok one-third full with water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Place a shallow flat bowl or plate with a lip into a bamboo steamer basket.
Evenly space the rice-coated meatball on the plate, ensuring it does not touch the sides.
Cover the basket with the lid and lower it into the wok.
Steam the meatball for 20 to 25 minutes until set and firm, adding water to the wok as necessary.
Carefully remove the rice ball from the steamer and transfer to a platter.
Serve the meatball with a toothpick for dipping into soy sauce.

original_instructions:
Blend together flour, butter, shortening, and salt in a bowl with your fingertips or a pastry blender (or pulse in a food processor) until most of mixture resembles coarse meal, with the rest in small (roughly pea-size) lumps. Drizzle 4 tablespoons ice water evenly over and gently stir with a fork (or pulse in a food processor) until incorporated. Gently squeeze a small handful: It should hold together without falling apart. If it doesn’t, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, stirring (or pulsing) after each addition until incorporated, continuing to test. (Do not overwork dough or it will become tough.) Turn out onto a work surface and divide into 2 portions. With heel of your hand, smear each portion once in a forward motion to help distribute fat. Gather each portion of dough and form it, rotating on work surface, into a disk. Wrap disks separately in plastic wrap and chill until firm, at least 1 hour.
Blend together flour, butter, shortening, and salt in a bowl with your fingertips or a pastry blender (or pulse in a food processor) until most of mixture resembles coarse meal, with the rest in small (roughly pea-size) lumps. Drizzle 4 tablespoons ice water evenly over and gently stir with a fork (or pulse in a food processor) until incorporated.
Gently squeeze a small handful: It should hold together without falling apart. If it doesn’t, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, stirring (or pulsing) after each addition until incorporated, continuing to test. (Do not overwork dough or it will become tough.)
Turn out onto a work surface and divide into 2 portions. With heel of your hand, smear each portion once in a forward motion to help distribute fat. Gather each portion of dough and form it, rotating on work surface, into a disk. Wrap disks separately in plastic wrap and chill until firm, at least 1 hour.
ingredients: 1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
step_by_step_instructions: Blend together 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 3 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, 1 tablespoon cold vegetable shortening, and a pinch of salt in a bowl with your fingertips or a pastry blender until most of the mixture resembles coarse meal, with the rest in small lumps.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon ice water evenly over the mixture and gently stir with a fork until incorporated.
Gently squeeze a small handful of the mixture: It should hold together without falling apart. If it doesn’t, add more water, 1 teaspoon at a time, stirring after each addition until incorporated.
Turn the mixture out onto a work surface and divide it into 1 portion.
With the heel of your hand, smear the portion once in a forward motion to help distribute the fat.
Gather the dough and form it, rotating on the work surface, into a disk.
Wrap the disk in plastic wrap and chill until firm, at least 1 hour.

original_instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F. 2. In a large plastic bag, combine the thyme, oregano, basil, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Shake well. Add two breasts at a time to the bag and shake to coat the chicken. Continue until all the breasts are coated. 3. Place the yogurt in a large bowl, and the cereal on a large plate. Dip each breast in the yogurt and then in the cereal. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. 4. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until the chicken is brown and cooked through. Do not cover or turn the chicken during the baking process. 5. When the chicken is completely cooked, remove the baking sheet from the oven and let cool ten minutes before serving.
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2. In a large plastic bag, combine the thyme, oregano, basil, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Shake well. Add two breasts at a time to the bag and shake to coat the chicken. Continue until all the breasts are coated.
3. Place the yogurt in a large bowl, and the cereal on a large plate. Dip each breast in the yogurt and then in the cereal. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
4. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until the chicken is brown and cooked through. Do not cover or turn the chicken during the baking process.
5. When the chicken is completely cooked, remove the baking sheet from the oven and let cool ten minutes before serving.
ingredients: 2 cups Special K cereal, crushed with a rolling pin or in a food processor or coffee grinder
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a large plastic bag, combine 0.33 tsp dried thyme, 0.33 tsp dried oregano, 0.33 tsp dried basil, 0.33 tsp garlic powder, 0.33 tsp kosher salt, and 0.33 tsp fresh black pepper. Shake well.
Add one chicken breast to the bag and shake to coat the chicken.
Place 0.33 cup plain nonfat yogurt in a large bowl, and 0.33 cup Special K cereal, crushed, on a large plate.
Dip the coated chicken breast in the yogurt and then in the crushed cereal.
Place the chicken breast on a baking sheet sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until the chicken is brown and cooked through.
When the chicken is completely cooked, remove the baking sheet from the oven and let cool for ten minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
Melt 2 tablespoons chicken fat in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken generously with salt and pepper. Add chicken to skillet and cook, turning once, until golden brown, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate. Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining chicken fat to skillet. Add shallots and sauté until soft, about 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and sauté until they begin to release liquid, about 1 minute. Using a slotted spoon, transfer mushrooms to a plate. Add wine to skillet and boil until reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Add stock; bring to a boil. Return chicken to skillet, cover with lid slightly ajar, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Transfer chicken to a platter. Return mushrooms to skillet; add cream. Simmer, uncovered, until sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over chicken and serve.
Melt 2 tablespoons chicken fat in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken generously with salt and pepper. Add chicken to skillet and cook, turning once, until golden brown, about 6 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate. Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining chicken fat to skillet. Add shallots and sauté until soft, about 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and sauté until they begin to release liquid, about 1 minute. Using a slotted spoon, transfer mushrooms to a plate. Add wine to skillet and boil until reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Add stock; bring to a boil. Return chicken to skillet, cover with lid slightly ajar, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Transfer chicken to a platter. Return mushrooms to skillet; add cream. Simmer, uncovered, until sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over chicken and serve.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons rendered chicken fat (schmaltz), duck fat, or vegetable oil, divided
1 4-pound free-range organic chicken, backbone removed, cut into 8 pieces
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Melt 0.5 tablespoon chicken fat in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Season 1 piece of chicken with salt and pepper.
Add chicken to skillet and cook, turning once, until golden brown, about 6 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to a plate.
Reduce heat to medium.
Add 0.17 tablespoon chicken fat to skillet.
Add 1 tablespoon minced shallots and sauté until soft, about 2 minutes.
Add 4 ounces morel mushrooms and sauté until they begin to release liquid, about 1 minute.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer mushrooms to a plate.
Add 0.25 cup wine to skillet and boil until reduced by half, about 2 minutes.
Add 0.25 cup chicken stock; bring to a boil.
Return chicken to skillet, cover with lid slightly ajar, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Transfer chicken to a platter.
Return mushrooms to skillet; add 0.13 cup cream.
Simmer, uncovered, until sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Pour sauce over chicken and serve.

original_instructions:
Make the dough: Put a pizza stone or inverted baking sheet on the lowest oven rack and preheat to 450 degrees F. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Add the water and olive oil and mix to make a shaggy, sticky dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead into a smooth and elastic ball, 2 to 3 minutes. Divide the dough in half and shape each half into a flat disk. Wrap each disk in plastic wrap and let rest in a warm place, 15 minutes.
Brush two large sheets of parchment paper with olive oil. Place a ball of dough between the parchment, oiled-sides in; use a rolling pin to roll the dough into a 12- to 14-inch round, about 1/8 inch thick. Remove the top piece of parchment and transfer the dough (and the bottom piece of parchment) to a pizza peel or inverted baking sheet.
Spread 1/3 cup sauce on the crust; scatter with 3/4 cup mozzarella. Slide the pizza (on the parchment) onto the hot stone. Bake until the crust is crisp and golden brown and the cheese is bubbling, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and let cool 1 to 2 minutes before slicing. Repeat to make the second pizza.
Photograph by Levi Brown
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
1 1/2 cups shredded low-moisture mozzarella cheese (about 6 ounces)
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat your oven to 450 degrees F and place a pizza stone or inverted baking sheet on the lowest oven rack.
In a large bowl, combine 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 0.38 teaspoon of baking powder, and 0.38 teaspoon of kosher salt.
Add 0.38 cup of water and 1.5 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil to the dry ingredients and mix to form a shaggy, sticky dough.
Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Divide the dough into two equal portions and shape each into a flat disk.
Wrap each disk in plastic wrap and let it rest in a warm place for 15 minutes.
Brush a sheet of parchment paper with olive oil and place one dough disk on it.
Use a rolling pin to roll the dough into a round about 12-14 inches in diameter and 1/8 inch thick.
Remove the top parchment paper and transfer the dough with the bottom parchment to a pizza peel or baking sheet.
Spread approximately 0.33 cup of pizza sauce over the crust.
Scatter about 0.75 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Slide the pizza (on the parchment) onto the hot stone in the oven.
Bake the pizza until the crust is crisp and golden brown and the cheese is bubbling, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Once baked, transfer the pizza to a cutting board and let it cool for 1 to 2 minutes before slicing.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a bowl, combine the lemon juice, soy sauce, basil, oil, vinegar, and lemon zest. Lay the tofu slices in a baking dish that can hold them in a single snug layer. Pour the marinade over the tofu. Bake for 30 minutes, or until the tofu is nearly dry and well browned.
To make the broccoli rabe, chop the tender stalks and greens into 2-inch pieces and soak them in a large basin of cold water.
In a heavy, wide saute pan over medium heat, warm the oil. Add the garlic and saute gently for 3 to 5 minutes, until golden. Add the red pepper flakes and tofu and saute for 1 minute. Scoop the greens from the water and add them to the pan. Raise the heat and turn the greens over in the oil with a pair of tongs. When the greens begin to simmer, reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes, until the greens are tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve drizzled with some of the liquor and garnished with the lemon wedges and garlic cloves.
ingredients: 1 pound firm tofu, rinsed, patted dry, and sliced 1/2 inch thick
2 pounds broccoli rabe, tough stalks trimmed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.

In a bowl, combine 0.5 tablespoons of lemon juice, 0.33 tablespoons of soy sauce, 0.33 tablespoons of chopped basil, 0.33 tablespoons of olive oil, 0.17 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar, and 0.17 teaspoons of lemon zest.
Lay 2 slices of tofu in a baking dish.
Pour the marinade over the tofu and bake for 30 minutes, or until the tofu is nearly dry and well browned.
Chop 0.33 pounds of broccoli rabe into 2-inch pieces and soak in a large basin of cold water.
In a heavy, wide saute pan over medium heat, warm 0.67 tablespoons of olive oil.
Add 1 garlic clove, sliced, and saute gently for 3 to 5 minutes, until golden.
Add 0.08 teaspoons of red pepper flakes and the baked tofu, and saute for 1 minute.
Scoop the broccoli rabe from the water and add to the pan.
Raise the heat and turn the greens over in the oil with a pair of tongs.
When the greens begin to simmer, reduce the heat to low and cover.
Cook for 10 to 15 minutes, until the greens are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve drizzled with some of the cooking liquid and garnished with lemon wedges and remaining garlic clove.

recipe_title: Skirt Steak Fajitas with Grilled Cabbage and Scallions
original_instructions:
For steak: Purée garlic, lime juice, oil, paprika, cilantro, cumin, salt, and onion powder in a blender until smooth. Transfer marinade to a resealable plastic bag and add steak. Seal bag and turn to coat; chill at least 4 hours. DO AHEAD: Steak can be marinated 1 day ahead. Keep chilled.
Purée garlic, lime juice, oil, paprika, cilantro, cumin, salt, and onion powder in a blender until smooth. Transfer marinade to a resealable plastic bag and add steak. Seal bag and turn to coat; chill at least 4 hours.
DO AHEAD: Steak can be marinated 1 day ahead. Keep chilled.
For vegetables and assembly: Prepare grill for medium-high heat. (Alternatively, heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.) Drizzle cabbage, white onion, and scallions with 4 tablespoons oil; season with salt and pepper. Grill, turning occasionally, until vegetables are charred and softened, about 4 minutes for scallions, 10–12 minutes for cabbage and onion. Let vegetables cool slightly. Core cabbage and cut into bite-size pieces along with scallions and onion. Toss chopped vegetables in a large bowl with red onion, lime juice, cilantro, and remaining 2 tablespoons oil; season with salt and pepper. Remove steak from marinade, scraping off excess; season with salt and pepper. Grill steak until medium-rare, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5–10 minutes before slicing. Serve steak with vegetables, tortillas, and Dried Chile Salsa.
Prepare grill for medium-high heat. (Alternatively, heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.) Drizzle cabbage, white onion, and scallions with 4 tablespoons oil; season with salt and pepper. Grill, turning occasionally, until vegetables are charred and softened, about 4 minutes for scallions, 10–12 minutes for cabbage and onion. Let vegetables cool slightly.
Core cabbage and cut into bite-size pieces along with scallions and onion. Toss chopped vegetables in a large bowl with red onion, lime juice, cilantro, and remaining 2 tablespoons oil; season with salt and pepper.
Remove steak from marinade, scraping off excess; season with salt and pepper. Grill steak until medium-rare, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 5–10 minutes before slicing. Serve steak with vegetables, tortillas, and Dried Chile Salsa.
ingredients: 2 pounds skirt steak, cut into 4 equal pieces
1/2 medium head green cabbage, cut into 2 wedges, core intact
1 large white onion, halved with some root end attached
step_by_step_instructions: Purée 0.5 garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon lime juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 0.75 tablespoon paprika, 0.5 tablespoon cilantro, 0.25 tablespoon cumin, 0.25 teaspoon salt, and 0.25 teaspoon onion powder in a blender until smooth.
Transfer marinade to a resealable plastic bag and add 0.5 pound skirt steak. Seal bag and turn to coat; chill for at least 4 hours.
Prepare grill for medium-high heat. Drizzle 0.12 medium head cabbage, 0.25 large white onion, and 2-3 scallions with 1 tablespoon olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
Grill vegetables, turning occasionally, until charred and softened, about 4 minutes for scallions, 10–12 minutes for cabbage and onion.
Let vegetables cool slightly. Core cabbage and cut into bite-size pieces along with scallions and onion.
Toss chopped vegetables in a large bowl with 0.06 small red onion, 0.75 tablespoon lime juice, 0.25 tablespoon cilantro, and 0.5 tablespoon olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
Remove steak from marinade, scraping off excess; season with salt and pepper.
Grill steak until medium-rare, about 3 minutes per side.
Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest 5–10 minutes before slicing.
Serve steak with vegetables, warm flour tortillas, and Dried Chile Salsa.

original_instructions:
To cook en papillote (on the grill, enclosed in foil), preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Rinse beef to remove any unwanted smells, pat dry with paper toweling and season with garlic powder and salt and pepper, and set aside briefly. Make an oven pouch out of a 3 foot length of heavy duty foil by bringing the 2 ends to the center, folding the sides to seal, and leaving an opening at the top center through which to place the sauce and beef. Shake flour in the pouch to coat the inside. Sear all sides of beef on the grill, then put beef in pouch and pour 1/2 cup of the barbecue sauce and 1 tablespoon of the hot sauce over the meat (reserving the rest of the barbeque sauce and hot sauce). Seal the foil pouch by folding shut. Grill bagged beef directly on grill for about 30 minutes per pound. Ideally this should be cooked until fork tender, so that you can pull it apart with a fork.
Let beef rest 10 minutes before carving into thin slices, or pulling it apart with a fork. Heat the reserved barbeque sauce and hot sauce in a small saucepan. Then chop or shred the sliced beef and serve on Kaiser rolls or crusty Italian rolls. Spoon a bit of the extra sauce over the meat.
ingredients: 1 (2 1/2 to 3-pound) beef chuck pot roast, or other cut suitable for roasting
12 Kaiser rolls or crusty Italian rolls, sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Rinse a portion of beef, approximately 0.25 lb, to remove any unwanted smells, pat dry with paper toweling.
Season with about 0.08 tablespoon garlic powder and a pinch of salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Set aside briefly.
Make an oven pouch out of a piece of heavy-duty foil large enough to enclose the beef portion.
Shake a small pinch of flour in the pouch to coat the inside.
Sear all sides of the beef on the grill for a few minutes until browned.
Put the beef in the pouch and pour about 0.04 cup of barbecue sauce and 0.02 tablespoon of hot sauce over the meat.
Seal the foil pouch by folding shut.
Grill bagged beef directly on grill for about 30 minutes.
Let beef rest for 10 minutes before carving into thin slices or pulling it apart with a fork.
Heat the remaining barbecue sauce and hot sauce in a small saucepan.
Chop or shred the sliced beef and serve on one Kaiser roll or crusty Italian roll.
Spoon a bit of the extra sauce over the meat.

original_instructions:
For the steaks: In a baking dish, sprinkle the steaks on both sides with the salt and pepper and drizzle with the oil. Place the rosemary in the dish and allow to marinate on the counter at room temperature for 1 hour, turning the steaks halfway through to infuse all over with rosemary.
For the rosemary butter: In a saucepan over medium-low heat, add the butter and salt. Stir to melt the butter and dissolve the salt, then add the rosemary. Continue cooking on low until the butter is fragrant from the rosemary, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove the rosemary and discard.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to high heat. Remove the steaks from the baking dish, discard the rosemary and place the steaks directly on the grill. Cook for about 5 minutes on both sides for medium-rare. Remove from the grill and allow to rest under loosely fitted aluminum foil for 10 minutes.
Using the direction of the muscles as a guide, thinly slice the meat against the grain into strips and place on a serving dish. Pour the infused butter over the meat and serve.
ingredients: 4 (1 pound) New York strip steaks, 1-inch thick
2 sprigs fresh rosemary, cut in half
step_by_step_instructions: Sprinkle 1 steak on both sides with 0.50 teaspoon salt and 0.06 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper.
Drizzle the steak with 0.50 tablespoon vegetable oil.
Place 1 half-sprig fresh rosemary in the dish with the steak.
Allow the steak to marinate on the counter at room temperature for 1 hour, turning the steak halfway through.
In a saucepan over medium-low heat, add 1.50 tablespoons butter and 0.25 teaspoon salt.
Stir to melt the butter and dissolve the salt, then add 0.75 sprig fresh rosemary.
Continue cooking on low until the butter is fragrant from the rosemary, 10 to 12 minutes.
Remove the rosemary from the butter and discard.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to high heat.
Remove the steak from the baking dish, discard the rosemary, and place the steak directly on the grill.
Cook for about 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Remove from the grill and allow to rest under loosely fitted aluminum foil for 10 minutes.
Thinly slice the steak against the grain into strips and place on a serving dish.
Pour the infused butter over the meat and serve.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. First, make the marinara sauce. In a saucepan heat oil. Add onion and cook for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes more. Add tomatoes, pinch of sugar, salt and pepper and simmer, covered, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes. Puree the mixture through the fine disk of a food mill and then return to the saucepan. Reduce for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make your filling. In a bowl mix together ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, egg yolk, minced basil, parsley, nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste. Fill your manicotti tubes with the filling mixture. When all the tubes are filled place them in a baking dish. Spoon marinara sauce over the tubes and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. (Can be refrigerated for several hours or overnight at this point or may be frozen.) When ready to cook, place in the oven and bake, covered for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake for 5 to 10 minutes longer, or until bubbling and heated through. Serve each portion with a sprig of fresh basil.
ingredients: 2 pounds ripe tomatoes, cored and cut into 1-inch pieces or 2 (28-ounce) cans plum tomatoes, drained
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Heat 2 teaspoons of olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add 2 tablespoons of minced onions and cook for 3 minutes.
Add 1 clove of minced garlic and cook for 2 minutes more.
Add 7 ounces of ripe tomatoes, a pinch of sugar, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of pepper. Simmer, covered, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.
Puree the mixture through a fine disk of a food mill and return to the saucepan. Reduce for 15 minutes.

In a bowl, mix together 2 ounces of ricotta cheese, 1 tablespoon of grated Parmesan cheese, 1/8 of an egg yolk, 1 teaspoon of minced basil, 1 teaspoon of minced parsley, a small pinch of freshly grated nutmeg, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Fill 1 large pasta tube with the ricotta filling mixture.
Place the filled pasta tube in a baking dish.
Spoon a portion of the marinara sauce over the tube and sprinkle with 1 ounce of mozzarella cheese.
Place in the oven and bake, covered, for 20 minutes.
Uncover and bake for an additional 5 to 10 minutes, or until bubbling and heated through.
Serve with a sprig of fresh basil.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 425°F with rack in middle. Finely grind peppercorns with salt in grinder. Pat chicken dry, then rub with olive oil and 2 teaspoons pepper-salt (reserve remainder). Transfer to a rack set over a roasting pan. Pour 1 cup water into bottom of pan and roast chicken until skin is golden and crisp and a thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh (do not touch bone) registers 170°F, 50 minutes to 1 hour. Transfer chicken to a platter and let rest 10 minutes. Serve chicken with remaining pepper-salt on the side.
Preheat oven to 425°F with rack in middle.
Finely grind peppercorns with salt in grinder.
Pat chicken dry, then rub with olive oil and 2 teaspoons pepper-salt (reserve remainder). Transfer to a rack set over a roasting pan. Pour 1 cup water into bottom of pan and roast chicken until skin is golden and crisp and a thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh (do not touch bone) registers 170°F, 50 minutes to 1 hour.
Transfer chicken to a platter and let rest 10 minutes. Serve chicken with remaining pepper-salt on the side.
ingredients: an electric coffee/spice grinder; an instant-read thermometer
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F with rack in middle.
Finely grind 0.25 tablespoon Sichuan peppercorns with 0.5 teaspoon salt in grinder.
Pat chicken dry, then rub with 0.25 tablespoon olive oil and 0.5 teaspoon pepper-salt.
Transfer to a rack set over a roasting pan.
Pour 0.25 cup water into bottom of pan and roast chicken until skin is golden and crisp and a thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh (do not touch bone) registers 170°F, about 50 minutes.
Transfer chicken to a platter and let rest 10 minutes.
Serve chicken with remaining pepper-salt on the side.

recipe_title: Grilled Pizzetta with Ricotta, Sausage, Arugula and Chili Oil
original_instructions:
For the chili oil: Bring the chilies and oil to a simmer in a small saucepan; remove from the heat and let the peppers steep in the oil for at least an hour or until the dough has risen and you're ready to make the pizzas. This can be done way in advance.
For the dough: In a small bowl, add 1/2 cup warm water (if the water is too hot the yeast will die and if the water is too cold the yeast will not activate). Add the dry yeast and sugar, stir to combine and let sit for 15 minutes. The top of the water will bubble and it will smell very yeasty; this is what you want.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt. Make a well in the center of the flour and add the olive oil and the yeast/water mixture. Using a fork, gradually stir the flour into the yeast/water mix. Once most of the flour has combined, turn the dough out to a smooth, clean work surface dusted with flour and use your hands to knead the dough to a smooth consistency.
Lightly coat the mixing bowl with oil, return the dough to the bowl, cover with plastic wrap and set in a warm place until the dough has doubled in size, at least 1 hour.
For the pizza topping: Coat a large saute pan with oil, add the sausage and bring to medium heat. Cook the sausage until brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and reserve.
While the sausage cooks, mix together in a medium bowl the ricotta, Parmigiano-Reggiano and oregano.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F and preheat a grill.
When the dough is ready, portion it into six golf-ball-size pieces. (If you're not using the dough right away, wrap each ball individually in plastic and refrigerate until ready to use.) Dust a work surface with flour and roll each piece of dough into a rectangle (or whatever shape you like; I like irregular shapes).
Brush the grill with oil and arrange each piece of dough on the grill; you might need to work in batches here. Grill until the dough is stiff and crisp and has lovely grill marks on it, then flip and repeat on the second side, moving occasionally so the bottom doesn't burn.
Put the pizzas on baking sheets, smear each with some of the ricotta mixture, top with sausage and put as many pizzas as will comfortably fit in the oven; bake until the cheese has melted, 3 to 4 minutes. Again, you may have to work in batches. Remove the pizzas from the oven, top with arugula and drizzle with the deliciously spicy chili oil!
ingredients: 5 to 6 Fresno chili peppers, roughly chopped
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for coating bowl and grill
Extra-virgin olive oil, for coating pan
8 ounces sweet Italian sausage, casings removed
1 sprig fresh oregano, leaves removed and gently chopped
step_by_step_instructions: For the chili oil, take approximately 1 Fresno chili pepper and roughly chop it. Combine with around 0.25 cup extra-virgin olive oil in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer, then remove from heat and let steep for at least 1 hour.
In a small bowl, add about 0.08 cup warm water, along with roughly 0.25 teaspoon dry yeast and a pinch of sugar. Stir to combine and let sit for 15 minutes until bubbly.

In a large mixing bowl, combine approximately 0.25 cup all-purpose flour with a pinch of kosher salt. Make a well in the center, add about 0.33 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil and the yeast mixture, and gradually stir to form a dough.
Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth. Coat the mixing bowl with a bit of oil, place the dough back in, cover, and let rise in a warm place for at least 1 hour until doubled in size.

Coat a large saute pan with a small amount of oil. Add about 1.33 ounces of sweet Italian sausage (with casings removed) and cook over medium heat until browned, around 10-15 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and reserve.
In a medium bowl, mix approximately 0.17 cup ricotta, 0.08 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, and a few chopped fresh oregano leaves.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F and preheat a grill.
Divide the dough into one portion (about 1/6 of the total dough), roll out into a rectangle on a floured surface.
Brush the grill with oil and grill the dough until stiff and crisp with grill marks, then flip and repeat on the second side.
Place the grilled dough on a baking sheet. Smear with the ricotta mixture, top with the cooked sausage, and bake in the oven for 3 to 4 minutes until the cheese melts.
Remove from oven, top with a handful of arugula, and drizzle with the prepared chili oil.

recipe_title: Lettuce Cups with Tofu and Beef
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a bowl, whisk together chili-garlic sauce, sesame oil, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, vinegar and sherry.
Slice the tofu into 1/2-inch thick slabs and lay the slices on top of paper towels. Use more paper towels to firmly pat the tofu in order to remove as much water as possible. This should take about 2 minutes and use about 3 paper towels. Finely mince dried tofu and set aside.
Heat the oil in a wok or extra-large skillet over medium heat. Add the ginger and scallion whites and cook until scallion whites are translucent and ginger is fragrant, about 2 to 3 minutes. Add ground beef and tofu and cook, stirring, until beef is opaque and just cooked through, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add reserved sauce. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook, stirring, an additional 3 to 4 minutes. Add water chestnuts and stir to incorporate.
Fill each lettuce leaf with the filling. Serve garnished with scallion greens, red peppers and peanuts.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons sherry or Chinese cooking wine
4 scallions, greens trimmed and reserved, thinly sliced (about 1/3 cup each greens and whites - 3/4-ounce each)
1/2 pound lean ground beef (90 percent or leaner)
1 large head Bibb lettuce, outer leaves discarded, leaves separated
step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together 0.17 tablespoons chili-garlic sauce, 0.25 teaspoons sesame oil, 0.5 tablespoons soy sauce, 0.06 cup hoisin sauce, 0.33 tablespoons rice vinegar, and 0.33 tablespoons sherry.

Slice 1 ounce of tofu into 0.5-inch thick slabs and lay the slices on top of paper towels. Use more paper towels to firmly pat the tofu to remove as much water as possible. This should take about 2 minutes.
Finely mince the dried tofu and set aside.
Heat 0.25 teaspoons canola oil in a wok or extra-large skillet over medium heat.
Add 0.33 tablespoons minced ginger and 0.5 tablespoons scallion whites. Cook until scallion whites are translucent and ginger is fragrant, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Add 2 ounces ground beef and the minced tofu to the pan. Cook, stirring, until beef is opaque and just cooked through, about 4 to 5 minutes.
Add the reserved sauce to the pan. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook, stirring, an additional 3 to 4 minutes.
Add 0.06 cup finely diced water chestnuts and stir to incorporate.
Fill 2 lettuce leaves with the filling.
Serve garnished with 0.06 ounce scallion greens, 0.06 cup diced red peppers, and 0.06 cup chopped peanuts.

recipe_title: Apple Spice Cake With Brown Sugar Glaze
original_instructions:
For cake: Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 325F. Spray 12-cup Bundt pan with nonstick spray. Sift flour and next 6 ingredients into medium bowl. Drain grated apples in strainer. Using hands or kitchen towel, squeeze out excess liquid from apples. Measure 2 cups grated apples. Using electric mixer, beat butter, both sugars, and lemon peel in large bowl until fluffy. Beat in eggs, 1 at a time. Mix in vanilla and lemon juice. Beat in flour mixture. Mix in grated apples. Transfer batter to prepared pan. Bake cake until tester inserted near center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool in pan on rack 20 minutes.
Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 325F. Spray 12-cup Bundt pan with nonstick spray. Sift flour and next 6 ingredients into medium bowl. Drain grated apples in strainer. Using hands or kitchen towel, squeeze out excess liquid from apples. Measure 2 cups grated apples.
Using electric mixer, beat butter, both sugars, and lemon peel in large bowl until fluffy. Beat in eggs, 1 at a time. Mix in vanilla and lemon juice. Beat in flour mixture. Mix in grated apples. Transfer batter to prepared pan. Bake cake until tester inserted near center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool in pan on rack 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare glaze: Stir all ingredients in small nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to boil.
