Reduce heat to medium; whisk until glaze is smooth, about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Invert cake onto rack set over baking sheet. Using small skewer, pierce holes all over top of warm cake. Pour glaze over top, allowing it to be absorbed before adding more. Cool cake 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Stir all ingredients in small nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to boil. Reduce heat to medium; whisk until glaze is smooth, about 1 minute. Remove from heat. Invert cake onto rack set over baking sheet. Using small skewer, pierce holes all over top of warm cake. Pour glaze over top, allowing it to be absorbed before adding more. Cool cake 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: 1 3/4 pounds Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, coarsely grated
1 1/2 cups (3 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 325F and spray a 12-cup Bundt pan with nonstick spray.

Sift together 0.5 cup of flour, 0.17 teaspoon of baking soda, 0.17 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 0.13 teaspoon of salt, 0.08 teaspoon of ground nutmeg, 0.04 teaspoon of ground cloves, and 0.04 teaspoon of ground allspice into a medium bowl.
Drain 0.3 pound of grated apples using a strainer, then squeeze out excess liquid using hands or a kitchen towel.
Using an electric mixer, beat 0.25 cup of butter, 0.25 cup of sugar, 0.08 cup of brown sugar, and 0.17 teaspoon of grated lemon peel in a large bowl until fluffy.
Beat in 0.5 egg at a time into the mixture.
Mix in 0.17 teaspoon of vanilla extract and 0.17 teaspoon of fresh lemon juice.
Beat in the flour mixture from step 2 into the wet mixture.
Mix in the grated apples from step 3.
Transfer the batter to the prepared Bundt pan and bake until a tester inserted near the center comes out clean, about 1 hour.
Cool the cake in the pan on a rack for 20 minutes.

Meanwhile, prepare the glaze by stirring 0.08 cup of brown sugar, 0.04 cup of butter, 0.04 cup of whipping cream, 0.08 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 0.08 teaspoon of fresh lemon juice, and 0.04 teaspoon of salt in a small nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until the sugar dissolves and the mixture comes to a boil.
Reduce the heat to medium and whisk until the glaze is smooth, about 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Invert the cake onto a rack set over a baking sheet.
Using a small skewer, pierce holes all over the top of the warm cake.
Pour the glaze over the top, allowing it to be absorbed before adding more.
Cool the cake for 30 minutes, then serve warm or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the broccoli florets and stems and cook until tender but still bright green, about 3 minutes. Remove to a bowl using a slotted spoon; set aside. Return the water to a boil, then add the pasta and cook as the label directs. Reserve 2 cups cooking water, then drain the pasta and set aside.
Heat the olive oil in the empty pot over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until slightly softened, about 1 minute. Add the broccoli stems, half of the florets and 1 cup of the reserved cooking water. Cover and cook until very soft, about 12 minutes.
Return the pasta to the pot along with another 1/2 cup of the reserved cooking water. Add the remaining broccoli florets, half of the ricotta salata, and the herbs and scallions; stir to combine, adding more cooking water to loosen, if needed. Top each serving with the capicola and the remaining ricotta salata.
Photograph by Charles Masters
ingredients: 1 large bunch broccoli, cut into florets, stems peeled and thinly sliced
1 cup crumbled ricotta salata cheese (about 4 ounces)
2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, mint, basil, parsley and/or chives
2 ounces deli-sliced capicola or coppa ham, cut into strips
step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add approximately 2.5 ounces of broccoli florets and stems to the pot and cook until tender but still bright green, about 3 minutes.
Remove the broccoli to a bowl using a slotted spoon and set aside.
Return the water to a boil, then add about 2.5 ounces of fusilli pasta and cook as the label directs.
Reserve 0.5 cup of cooking water, then drain the pasta and set aside.
Heat 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil in the empty pot over medium heat.
Add 1 clove of chopped garlic to the pot and cook until slightly softened, about 1 minute.
Add the broccoli stems, half of the broccoli florets, and 0.25 cup of the reserved cooking water to the pot.
Cover and cook until very soft, about 12 minutes.
Return the pasta to the pot along with another 0.125 cup of the reserved cooking water.
Add the remaining broccoli florets, 0.5 cup of ricotta salata, and about 0.5 tablespoon of chopped herbs and scallions; stir to combine.
Top each serving with about 0.5 ounce of capicola and the remaining ricotta salata.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes. Drain. Stir 2 cups of the cream and the lemon juice in a heavy large skillet to blend. Add the butter and cook over medium heat just until the butter melts, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the pasta and toss. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of cream, and Parmesan to the cream sauce in the skillet. Add the lemon zest, nutmeg, salt, and white pepper. Toss the pasta mixture over low heat until the sauce thickens slightly, about 1 minute.;
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground white pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Cook approximately 3 ounces of pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes. Drain.
Stir approximately 1/3 cup of the cream and a bit more than 1 tablespoon of lemon juice in a heavy large skillet to blend.
Add 2 tablespoons of butter and cook over medium heat just until the butter melts, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes.
Remove from the heat. Add the pasta and toss.
Add approximately 1 tablespoon of cream, and 1/3 cup of Parmesan to the cream sauce in the skillet.
Add a pinch of lemon zest, a small pinch of nutmeg, salt, and white pepper.
Toss the pasta mixture over low heat until the sauce thickens slightly, about 1 minute.

original_instructions:
Heat a grill or grill pan on medium-high heat.
Add the tomatoes, zucchini, red and yellow bell peppers and onions to a large rimmed baking sheet and drizzle liberally with the olive oil. Sprinkle evenly with salt and pepper, tossing to coat all the veggies in the oil. Place in a grill basket and grill until tender and lightly charred, about 5 minutes per side. If using an indoor grill pan, you will need to grill in two batches to avoid overcrowding the pan and steaming the veggies.
Remove the charred vegetables to a cutting board and rest until cool enough to handle. Chop into bite-size pieces. Add the chopped vegetables, arugula and basil to a large bowl. Drizzle with the balsamic and a small drizzle of olive oil, season with some salt and pepper and toss it all together.
ingredients: 2 small zucchini, sliced longwise into 1/2-inch pieces
1 red bell pepper, ribs removed, sliced into quarters
1 yellow bell pepper, ribs removed, sliced into quarters
1/4 cup olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh basil leaves
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a grill or grill pan on medium-high heat.

Add about 2.63 ounces of grape tomatoes, 1.33 ounces of sliced zucchini, 0.5 ounces of red bell pepper, 0.5 ounces of yellow bell pepper, and 0.25 ounces of sliced red onion to a large rimmed baking sheet.
Drizzle the vegetables liberally with approximately 0.63 tablespoons of olive oil.
Sprinkle evenly with salt and pepper to taste, and toss to coat all the veggies in the oil.
Place the vegetables in a grill basket and grill until tender and lightly charred, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove the charred vegetables to a cutting board and let them rest until cool enough to handle.
Chop the vegetables into bite-size pieces.
Add the chopped vegetables, about 0.75 handfuls of arugula, and 0.06 ounces of chopped fresh basil leaves to a large bowl.
Drizzle with approximately 0.25 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar and a small drizzle of olive oil.
Season with some salt and pepper to taste and toss it all together.

original_instructions: In a medium saucepan melt butter over moderate heat. Add thin spaghetti bits and rice and brown for 3 to 5 minutes. Add broth or water, salt and pepper, and bring liquid to a full boil. Cover pot and reduce heat to simmer and cook rice 18 minutes. Fluff with a fork and serve.
ingredients: 1/3 cup thin spaghetti, broken into 1 inch pieces, about 1/6 of a 1 pound box of dried pasta
step_by_step_instructions: Melt 0.67 tablespoons of butter in a medium saucepan over moderate heat.
Add 0.11 cups of thin spaghetti, broken into 1 inch pieces, and 0.25 cups of white enriched rice.
Brown the spaghetti bits and rice for 3 to 5 minutes.
Add 0.5 cups of chicken broth or water, along with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Bring the liquid to a full boil.
Cover the pot and reduce heat to simmer, cooking the rice for 18 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork and serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat oil over medium heat in a 6-quart stockpot. Add onions and garlic and saute until soft but not brown, about 6 to 7 minutes. Add the butternut squash, broth, curry powder and salt and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until squash is tender, about 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat stir in honey and puree with an immersion blender or in batches in a blender until smooth. Season with salt, to taste.
Ladle into serving bowls and add a dollop of yogurt.
ingredients: 1 (2 1/2-pound) butternut squash, peeled, seeded and cut into 1-inch cubes
6 cups low-sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth
1/2 teaspoon salt, plus more, to taste
4 teaspoons plain low-fat yogurt, for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.17 tablespoon of canola oil over medium heat in a 6-quart stockpot.
Add 0.33 cup of chopped onions and 0.33 cloves of minced garlic and saute until soft but not brown, about 6 to 7 minutes.
Add 0.42 pound of butternut squash cut into 1-inch cubes, 1 cup of low-sodium chicken broth, 0.5 teaspoon of curry powder, and a pinch of salt.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until squash is tender, about 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in 0.33 tablespoon of honey.
Puree with an immersion blender or in batches in a blender until smooth.
Season with salt, to taste.
Ladle into serving bowls and add 0.5 teaspoon of plain low-fat yogurt for garnish.

original_instructions:
To a small non reactive bowl or dish combine marinade ingredients. Marinate tofu overnight.
Place tofu slices on hot grill and cook 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Place grilled slices in a warm place while making the sauce.
In a separate saucepan whisk together olive oil, milk, flour and vegetable broth. Add shiitake mushrooms and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 7 to 10 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Pour the mixture over grilled tofu. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound firm tofu, sliced into 1-inch thick pieces
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.5 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp orange juice, a dash of pepper, and a dash of salt in a small non-reactive bowl to make the marinade.
Slice 0.25 lb firm tofu into 1-inch thick pieces and marinate overnight in the prepared marinade.
Preheat the grill.
Place the marinated tofu slices on the hot grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side.
Keep the grilled tofu slices warm.
In a separate saucepan, whisk together 0.08 tsp olive oil, 0.13 cup skim milk, 0.17 tsp all purpose flour, and 0.05 cup vegetable broth.
Add 0.25 cup sliced shiitake mushrooms to the saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 7 to 10 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender.
Pour the mushroom sauce over the grilled tofu.
Serve immediately, garnished with 1 chopped green onion.

recipe_title: Tony's Chicken Tenders with Honey Mustard Sauce
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat oil to 350 degrees F.
Cut the chicken breasts into long strips and set aside.
Beat the 3 eggs in a separate bowl and measure the flour into another separate dish.
Measure the panko into a pie plate or shallow bowl and season with garlic powder, lemon-pepper, cayenne, salt and pepper.
Dip the chicken strips into the flour, the beaten egg and then dredge them into the seasoned panko.
Fry in the hot peanut oil for 6 to 8 minutes, until golden brown, and remove to a paper towel lined sheet tray. Serve with Honey Mustard sauce.
Mix all the ingredients in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper. The sauce can be held in the refrigerator for 1 week.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oil to 350 degrees F.
Cut approximately 0.33 pounds of chicken breasts into long strips and set aside.
Beat 1 egg in a separate bowl.
Measure about 0.33 cup of all-purpose flour into another separate dish.

Measure about 0.67 cup of panko bread crumbs into a pie plate or shallow bowl and season with approximately 0.17 teaspoon garlic powder, 0.17 teaspoon lemon-pepper, 0.08 teaspoon cayenne, 0.08 teaspoon salt, and 0.08 teaspoon pepper.
Dip the chicken strips into the flour, then the beaten egg, and dredge them into the seasoned panko.
Fry the chicken strips in the hot peanut oil for 6 to 8 minutes, until golden brown, and remove to a paper towel lined sheet tray.
Mix 0.08 cup Dijon mustard, 0.08 cup honey, 0.33 tablespoon mayonnaise, and 0.17 tablespoon lemon juice in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Serve the chicken tenders with the Honey Mustard sauce.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Soak the bread in the milk for 15 minutes. Line the bottom of a 2 to 2 1/2 quart shallow casserole with a layer of bread soaked bread. Top with a layer of tomato sauce and mozzarella and some strips of ham. Continue layering, finishing last layer with bread topped with tomato sauce.
Beat the eggs with Parmesan and pour the mixture over the bread. With a fork, pierce through layers until egg mixture is absorbed by bread. Dot the top with butter and bake for 45 minutes or until top if browned and puffed.
While this is baking make a nice vegetable salad to accompany this dish.
ingredients: 8inch long French or Italian bread cut into 1/2-inch thick slices
2 cups tomato sauce, fresh or jarred
8 ounces to 1 pound grated or sliced Fontina or Mozzarella cheese
4 ounces smoked black forest ham, torn into strips
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Cut approximately 2 inches of French or Italian bread into 1/2-inch thick slices.
Soak the bread slices in 1/4 cup of milk for 15 minutes.
Line the bottom of a small shallow casserole with a layer of soaked bread.
Top with a layer of approximately 1/2 cup tomato sauce.
Add about 2 ounces of sliced Fontina or Mozzarella cheese.
Layer some strips of smoked black forest ham.
Continue layering with remaining ingredients, finishing with a layer of bread topped with tomato sauce.
Beat 1 egg with 1 tablespoon of grated Parmesan cheese.
Pour the egg mixture over the bread layers.
With a fork, pierce through layers until the egg mixture is absorbed by the bread.
Dot the top with about 1/2 tablespoon of butter.
Bake for 45 minutes or until the top is browned and puffed.

recipe_title: Collards, Golden Raisin, and Almond Saute
original_instructions: Heat an 8-quart saucepan over high heat. When very hot, add the oil, onions, and garlic, sauteing quickly for 1 minute. When the onions just start to turn golden, add the collard greens, raisins, and almonds. Season with salt and pepper, and add a little water if necessary, for a little steam. Saute for about 5 to 6 minutes more, and adjust seasoning, to taste.
ingredients: 2 bunches collard greens, washed, and cut in 1/2-inch strips
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a saucepan over high heat.
Add approximately 1 tablespoon of olive oil, a portion of diced onion, and some chopped garlic to the hot pan.
Saute quickly for about 1 minute until the onions just start to turn golden.
Add a portion of collard greens, golden raisins, and slivered almonds to the pan.
Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Add a small amount of water if necessary to create steam.
Saute for an additional 5 to 6 minutes.
Adjust seasoning to taste before serving.

original_instructions:
Prepare the dressing by placing the fennel seeds in a small saute pan over low heat. Toast, tossing occasionally, about 2 to 3 minutes, or until lightly browned. Crush the toasted seeds with the edge or a pan, in a mortar and pestle, or seal in a plastic bag and roll with a rolling pin.
In a saucepan, place the honey, cider vinegar, salt and pepper, and toasted fennel seeds. Bring to a boil, stirring well. Remove from heat. Whisk in olive oil and season, to taste.
Place the romaine, radicchio, cabbage, and watercress in a large serving bowl. Add warm dressing and toss well. Serve immediately.
ingredients: Gray salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 bunch watercress, trimmed of large stems
step_by_step_instructions: Place 0.33 teaspoon of fennel seeds in a small sauté pan over low heat.
Toast the seeds, tossing occasionally for about 2 to 3 minutes, until lightly browned.
Crush the toasted seeds using the edge of a pan, in a mortar and pestle, or in a sealed plastic bag with a rolling pin.
In a saucepan, combine 0.5 tablespoon honey, 0.5 tablespoon cider vinegar, a pinch of gray salt, a pinch of freshly ground black pepper, and the toasted fennel seeds.
Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring well.
Remove from heat and whisk in 0.08 cup of extra-virgin olive oil.
Adjust seasoning to taste.

In a large serving bowl, place 1 romaine lettuce heart torn into pieces, 0.5 head of radicchio torn into pieces, 0.16 large head of cabbage shredded, and a small handful of watercress with large stems trimmed.
Pour the warm dressing over the salad mixture and toss well.
Serve immediately.

recipe_title: Steak with Chile Key Lime Sauce
original_instructions:
Preheat broiler. Pat steak dry and season with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Broil on a broiler pan 4 to 6 inches from heat, turning once, about 6 minutes total for medium-rare. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes before slicing. While steak rests, stir together remaining ingredients until sugar has dissolved. Serve sliced steak with sauce.
Preheat broiler.
Pat steak dry and season with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Broil on a broiler pan 4 to 6 inches from heat, turning once, about 6 minutes total for medium-rare. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let rest 5 minutes before slicing.
While steak rests, stir together remaining ingredients until sugar has dissolved. Serve sliced steak with sauce.
ingredients: 1 pound skirt steak, cut into pieces
1 fresh serrano chile, chopped (about 2 teaspoons; including seeds)
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the broiler.
Pat dry approximately 4 ounces of steak and season with about 0.25 teaspoon of salt and 0.125 teaspoon of pepper.
Broil the steak on a broiler pan 4 to 6 inches from heat, turning once, for about 6 minutes in total for medium-rare.
Transfer the steak to a cutting board and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

While the steak rests, stir together 1 tablespoon of fresh Key lime juice, 0.75 tablespoon of Asian fish sauce, 0.75 tablespoon of water, 0.5 tablespoon of sugar, 0.25 ounce of thinly sliced shallot, and 0.5 teaspoon of chopped serrano chile until the sugar has dissolved.
Slice the steak and serve with the sauce.

recipe_title: Sesame-Glazed Snap Peas with Pearl Onions
original_instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add snap peas, soy sauce, pearl onions and 1 tablespoon of water and cook 3 to 5 minutes, until vegetables are tender and golden and water evaporates. Stir in sesame seeds and cook 1 minute, until seeds are golden. Remove from heat and stir in salt and black pepper.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.5 tablespoon of sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add 0.5 cup of snap peas, 0.25 tablespoon of soy sauce, 0.5 cup of pearl onions, and 0.25 tablespoon of water to the skillet.
Cook for 3 to 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender and golden and the water evaporates.
Stir in 0.5 teaspoon of sesame seeds and cook for 1 minute until the seeds are golden.
Remove from heat and stir in salt and black pepper to taste.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Shock the onions in an ice water bath for 10 minutes to temper the sharp flavor, and pat dry.
Place the bacon, broccoli, cauliflower and onions in a large salad bowl. In a small bowl, whisk the sugar, vinegar and Dijon mustard. Slowly drizzle in the oil, whisking to make an emulsion. Mix in the mayonnaise and seafood seasoning. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss.
ingredients: 2 slices bacon, cut in small pieces, cooked to crisp
1/2 bunch broccoli, cut into small florets (about 1 1/2 cups)
1/2 small head cauliflower, cut into small florets (about 1 1/2 cups)
1/2 teaspoon seafood seasoning, such as Old Bay
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Shock the onion slices in an ice water bath for 10 minutes to temper the sharp flavor, and then pat dry.
Place approximately 0.5 oz of cooked bacon pieces, 0.67 cup of broccoli florets, 0.67 cup of cauliflower florets, and the prepared onions in a large salad bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together 0.33 tablespoon of sugar, 0.17 tablespoon of red wine vinegar, and 0.17 teaspoon of Dijon mustard.
Slowly drizzle in 0.33 tablespoon of vegetable oil while whisking to create an emulsion.
Mix in 0.08 cup of mayonnaise and 0.08 teaspoon of seafood seasoning.
Season the dressing with salt and pepper to taste.
Pour the dressing over the vegetables in the salad bowl and toss to combine.

original_instructions:
In a bowl, combine shrimp, ham, salt, white pepper and mix well. Combine eggs and butter in another bowl. Combine dressing ingredients in a small bowl.
Pour shrimp mixture and egg mixture into a heatproof glass pie dish and cover with another heatproof glass pie dish. Prepare a wok for steaming (wok should have 2 inches of simmering water in it) and place the pie dish in the wok, cover and steam over a medium heat for 15 minutes.
Spoon dressing on top and serve.
ingredients: 1/4 pound medium raw shrimp, shelled, deveined and diced
step_by_step_instructions: In a bowl, combine 28.35 g of diced shrimp, 7.09 g of chopped ham, 0.06 tsp salt, and 0.03 tsp white pepper. Mix well.
In another bowl, combine 1 egg and 0.16 cup of water.
Combine 0.25 tbsp chopped green onion, 0.31 tsp soy sauce, 0.16 tsp sesame oil, and 0.08 tsp hot pepper sauce in a small bowl to make the dressing.
Pour the shrimp mixture and egg mixture into a heatproof glass pie dish.
Cover with another heatproof glass pie dish.
Prepare a wok with 2 inches of simmering water for steaming.
Place the pie dish in the wok, cover, and steam over medium heat for 15 minutes.
Spoon the dressing on top and serve.

original_instructions:
Gorgonzola - pairs well with Prosecco, served as an appetizer.
Gorgonzola - pairs well with Eliodoro Moscato Passito, served at the end of a meal.
Parmigiano-Reggiano - served with Bastianich Vespa, served as an appetizer.
Parmigiano-Reggiano - served with Lambrusco "Concerto" Medici, served at the end of a meal.
Robiola di Mondovi - served with Calluso Passito Feraudi, served at the end of a meal.
step_by_step_instructions: Serve Gorgonzola with a glass of Prosecco as an appetizer.
Serve Gorgonzola with a glass of Eliodoro Moscato Passito at the end of a meal.
Serve Parmigiano-Reggiano with a glass of Bastianich Vespa as an appetizer.
Serve Parmigiano-Reggiano with a glass of Lambrusco "Concerto" Medici at the end of a meal.
Serve Robiola di Mondovi with a glass of Calluso Passito Feraudi at the end of a meal.

original_instructions:
Bring broth and Creole seasoning to boil in heavy large saucepan. Stir in rice and kale and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Bring broth and Creole seasoning to boil in heavy large saucepan. Stir in rice and kale and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
ingredients: 2 1/4 cups canned low-salt chicken broth or vegetable broth
4 ounces kale (about 1/2 large bunch), stems and ribs removed, leaves coarsely chopped (2 cups packed)
step_by_step_instructions: Bring 0.56 cups of chicken broth to a boil in a heavy large saucepan.
Add 0.38 teaspoons of Creole seasoning to the boiling broth.
Stir in 0.25 cups of converted white rice and 0.5 cups of chopped kale.
Bring the mixture to a boil again.
Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and cook until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.

recipe_title: Chilled Butternut Squash and Coconut Soup
original_instructions: On a steady work surface, using a mallet or the back of a sturdy knife, bruise the root end of the lemongrass. In a large pot over high heat, add the lemongrass, vegetable stock, and ginger and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Strain the stock and return it to the pot. Add the butternut squash to the stock and simmer until the squash is fully cooked and begins to break down, about 1 hour. Remove from the heat and cool. Add the coconut milk, blending the mixture in batches until smooth. Season with lime juice and salt, and chill. To serve, garnish the soup with cilantro, cashews and coconut.
ingredients: 5 cups butternut squash, peeled, seeded and cubed
1 (14.5-ounce) can coconut milk, light or regular
step_by_step_instructions: On a steady work surface, use a mallet or the back of a sturdy knife to bruise the root end of approximately 0.33 stalks of lemongrass.
In a large pot over high heat, add 0.75 quarts of vegetable stock, 0.33 stalks of lemongrass, and approximately 0.67 ounces of ginger.
Bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.
Strain the stock and return it to the pot.
Add approximately 0.63 cups of butternut squash to the stock.
Simmer until the squash is fully cooked and begins to break down, about 1 hour.
Remove from the heat and cool the mixture.
Add approximately 1.81 ounces of coconut milk.
Blend the mixture in batches until smooth.
Season the soup with juice from 0.25 limes and salt to taste.
Chill the soup before serving.
To serve, garnish the soup with approximately 0.06 cups of cilantro leaves, 0.06 cups of toasted and crumbled cashews, and 0.06 cups of unsweetened, shredded coconut.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Melt the butter with the olive oil in a large roasting pan. Toss all of the ingredients in the butter/oil mixture to coat evenly.
Roast the potatoes for about 45 minutes until golden brown and tender. Serve the potatoes with the roasted garlic and shallots all together in the same serving dish.
ingredients: 2 pounds small red skinned potatoes, washed and halved (or quartered if they're larger)
4 medium shallots, peeled and halved with the root in tact
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Melt 0.25 tablespoons butter with 0.25 tablespoons olive oil in a roasting pan.
Toss 0.5 pounds of halved red skinned potatoes, 1 garlic clove, 1 shallot half, 1 rosemary sprig, and 1 thyme sprig in the butter/oil mixture to coat evenly.
Roast the potatoes in the oven for about 45 minutes until golden brown and tender.
Serve the roasted potatoes with garlic and shallots all together in the same serving dish.

recipe_title: Stir-Fried Wild Mushrooms with Snap Peas in Oyster Sauce
original_instructions:
With a sharp knife, cut the mushrooms on the diagonal into quarters, depending on the size. Prepare the seasonings and set by the stove.
Heat a wok or a heavy skillet until very hot, add 1 teaspoon of oil and heat until hot. Add the snap peas, minced garlic, rice wine or sake, and salt, and toss lightly over high heat for about 1 1/2 minutes until the peas are just tender (snow peas will take slightly less time.) Remove from the pan and arrange around the outside of the serving plate.
Reheat the pan and the remaining oil until very hot. Add the Seasonings and stir-fry about 10 seconds until fragrant. Add the mushrooms and toss lightly with a spatula or shovel over high heat for about 1 minute. Add the sauce and toss lightly to thicken, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Arrange the mushrooms inside the snow peas on the serving platter. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound snap peas, ends snapped and veiny strings removed, rinsed and drained
1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms, stems trimmed and lightly rinsed
1/2 pound oyster mushrooms, stems trimmed and lightly rinsed (If unavailable, substitute shiitake mushrooms.)
1/2 pound cremini mushrooms, stems trimmed and lightly rinsed
step_by_step_instructions: Cut approximately 0.11 lb of shiitake mushrooms, 0.11 lb of oyster mushrooms, and 0.11 lb of cremini mushrooms on the diagonal into quarters.
Prepare seasonings and set by the stove.
Heat a wok or a heavy skillet until very hot, add 0.33 teaspoon of oil and heat until hot.
Add approximately 0.22 lb of snap peas, 0.33 tablespoon of minced garlic, 0.67 tablespoon of rice wine or sake, and 0.11 teaspoon of salt.
Toss lightly over high heat for about 1.5 minutes until the peas are just tender.
Remove the snap peas from the pan and arrange around the outside of the serving plate.
Reheat the pan and the remaining 0.17 teaspoon of oil until very hot.
Add 0.33 tablespoon of minced garlic, 0.33 tablespoon of minced fresh ginger, and stir-fry about 10 seconds until fragrant.
Add the mushrooms and toss lightly with a spatula over high heat for about 1 minute.
Add 0.58 tablespoon of oyster sauce, 0.25 tablespoon of rice wine or sake, 0.21 teaspoon of sugar, 0.08 teaspoon of toasted sesame oil, and 0.08 cup of chicken broth or water.
Mix 0.17 teaspoon of cornstarch with a little water and add to the pan.
Toss lightly to thicken, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Arrange the mushrooms inside the snap peas on the serving platter.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Coat a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spread the challah and cornbread on separate baking sheets and bake until lightly toasted and dry; transfer to a large bowl.
Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic and celery and cook until the onions are translucent, 10 to 12 minutes. Add the sage, parsley and 2 cups chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add salt to taste and 1 teaspoon pepper.
Pour the broth mixture over the bread in the bowl and mix with a wooden spoon until combined. Whisk the remaining 1/4 cup chicken broth with the egg in a small bowl; add to the stuffing mixture and toss to combine. Spoon the stuffing into the prepared baking dish, pressing it down gently so it is evenly distributed. Bake until dry on top and golden brown, about 1 hour.
ingredients: Cooking spray, for the baking dish
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Coat a small baking dish (about 4.5-by-6.5-inch) with cooking spray.
Spread approximately 0.5 cup cubed challah and 0.5 cup cubed cornbread on separate baking sheets and bake until lightly toasted and dry.
Transfer the toasted bread to a small mixing bowl.
Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a small skillet over medium heat.
Add approximately 0.25 cup diced onion, 1 sliced garlic clove, and 0.5 stalk diced celery to the skillet. Cook until onions are translucent, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Add about 0.5 tablespoon chopped fresh sage and 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley to the skillet.
Pour in 0.25 cup chicken broth, bring to a boil, and season with a pinch of salt and 0.13 teaspoon pepper.
Pour the broth mixture over the toasted bread in the bowl and mix with a wooden spoon until combined.
Whisk 1 tablespoon chicken broth with a quarter of a large egg in a small bowl.
Add the egg mixture to the stuffing and toss to combine.
Spoon the stuffing into the prepared baking dish, pressing it down gently to distribute evenly.
Bake until dry on top and golden brown, about 1 hour.

original_instructions:
Combine the milk, water, salt, and cornmeal in a 2 or 3 quart heavy bottomed saucepan. Stir with a whisk to eliminate any lumps. Heat just to a boil (but without scorching). Reduce the heat to very low and simmer the polenta for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon. If, near the end of the cooking, the polenta is becoming too thick and heavy to stir, add one or more tablespoons of cold water to loosen the mixture enough to be able to stir it, and to maintain a creamy consistency.
Remove from the heat. Immediately add the butter, the Parmesan cheese, the herbs and stir quickly to incorporate. The polenta can now be served soft, similar to a porridge, to accompany meat or game.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs, such as thyme, parsley and chives
step_by_step_instructions: Combine 0.25 cup whole milk, 0.125 cup cold water, 0.125 teaspoon salt, and 0.25 cup cornmeal in a 2 or 3 quart heavy bottomed saucepan. Stir with a whisk to eliminate any lumps.
Heat just to a boil (but without scorching).
Reduce the heat to very low and simmer the polenta for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon.

If, near the end of the cooking, the polenta is becoming too thick and heavy to stir, add one or more tablespoons of cold water to loosen the mixture enough to be able to stir it, and to maintain a creamy consistency.
Remove from the heat.
Immediately add 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, 0.75 tablespoon freshly grated Parmesan cheese, and 0.75 tablespoon chopped fresh herbs, and stir quickly to incorporate.
Serve the polenta soft, similar to a porridge, to accompany meat or game.

recipe_title: Sunny's Easy Rosemary and Thyme Toasted Nuts
original_instructions:
In a large pan on medium heat, add the rosemary and thyme. Toast until fragrant but not browned. Remove to a small bowl and add the paprika.
In the same pan, add the pecans, almonds and walnuts separately in batches and toast, constantly tossing, until fragrant and a taste test proves each batch to be tender. This should take anywhere from 5 to 10 minutes and will vary for each type of nut.
Pour the nuts into a large bowl and season with salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Sprinkle with the rosemary mixture, drizzle with the olive oil and toss.
ingredients: 9 to 10 sprigs fresh thyme, leaves stripped and chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: In a large pan on medium heat, add approximately 0.33 tablespoons of gently chopped fresh rosemary and 1 to 1.11 sprigs of fresh thyme, leaves stripped and chopped. Toast until fragrant but not browned.
Remove the toasted herbs to a small bowl and add about 0.04 teaspoons of hot Hungarian paprika.
In the same pan, add approximately 0.33 cups of pecan halves, 0.17 cups of almonds, and 0.17 cups of walnut halves separately in batches.
Toast each type of nut, constantly tossing, until fragrant and tender, which should take about 5 to 10 minutes depending on the nut.
Pour the toasted nuts into a large bowl and season with a pinch of salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
Sprinkle with the rosemary mixture, drizzle with about 0.17 tablespoons of olive oil, and toss everything together.

original_instructions: Combine veggies and dress with vinegar and oil, salt and pepper.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped parsley leaves, a handful
step_by_step_instructions: Mix 0.50 cup of defrosted corn kernels in a bowl.
Add 4.25 ounces of drained butter beans to the bowl.
Chop 0.25 of a small red bell pepper and add to the bowl.
Chop 0.13 of a small red onion and add to the bowl.
Dress the mixture with 0.25 tablespoon of red wine vinegar.
Add 0.50 tablespoon of chopped parsley leaves.
Pour 0.50 tablespoon of peanut oil over the mixture.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss the salad to combine all ingredients evenly.

original_instructions: Remove the 2 outer leaves of the cabbage. Cut the cabbage in half. Core it and cut into thin julienne. Saute cabbage and onions in butter for 5 minutes, or until the cabbage starts to wilt. Add the apple, vinegar, cane syrup, red wine, spice sachet. Cover and simmer for 1 hour. Adjust seasoning by adding more salt, syrup and wine to taste.;
ingredients: 1/2 cup Lyles Golden cane syrup (3/4 ounce brown sugar can be substituted)
step_by_step_instructions: Remove the outer leaves of the cabbage and cut it in half.
Core the cabbage and cut it into thin julienne.
Dice the onion and peel and dice the apples.
In a pan, sauté 0.42 lb of cabbage and 0.17 of diced onion in 0.50 tbsp of butter for 5 minutes, or until the cabbage starts to wilt.
Add 0.50 of a diced apple to the pan.
Pour in 1.00 tbsp of red wine vinegar, 0.08 cup of Lyles Golden cane syrup, and 0.13 cup of red wine.
Add 1 clove, 1 allspice, and 1 bay leaf tied in a sachet.
Cover the pan and simmer for 1 hour.
Adjust seasoning by adding more salt, syrup, and wine to taste.

original_instructions:
Heat oven to 450 degrees F. Grease baking sheet with vegetable shortening. Set aside.
Place 5 cups of flour into a large mixing bowl, and make a well in the center. Pour buttermilk into the well. Using your fingers, cut the shortening into the buttermilk.
Gradually work the flour on the sides of the well into the buttermilk mixture, gently stirring in one direction until a ball of dough forms adding more flour as necessary. Clean dough from fingers.
Knead dough by gently turning it over in the bowl. With floured hands, pinch off about 1/3 cup dough to make a ball. Pat ball to slightly flatten. Transfer to a baking sheet, and pat top of biscuit lightly with water. Repeat with remaining dough. Bake until well browned, 14 to 16 minutes.
ingredients: 1/2 cup (1/2 stick) solid vegetable shortening, such as Crisco, plus more for greasing
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.
Grease a baking sheet with a small amount of vegetable shortening.
Place approximately 0.63 cups of self-rising flour into a large mixing bowl, and make a well in the center.
Pour approximately 0.13 cups of buttermilk into the well.
Using your fingers, cut approximately 0.06 cups of the vegetable shortening into the buttermilk.
Gradually work the flour on the sides of the well into the buttermilk mixture, gently stirring in one direction until a ball of dough forms.
Add more flour if necessary.
Clean dough from fingers.
Knead the dough by gently turning it over in the bowl.
With floured hands, pinch off about 0.04 cups of dough to make a ball.
Pat the ball to slightly flatten it.
Transfer to the baking sheet, and pat the top of the biscuit lightly with water.
Repeat the process with the remaining dough.
Bake in the oven until well browned, approximately 14 to 16 minutes.

original_instructions:
In a heavy kettle ( at least 5 quarts) cook bacon over moderate heat, stirring, until crisp. Add onions and cook, stirring, until softened. Peel potatoes and cut into 3/4-inch cubes. Add potatoes, celery, broth, and water and simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Add lima beans and corn and simmer, covered, 5 minutes.
In a small bowl dissolve cornstarch in half -and-half or milk and stir into simmering soup with Worcestershire sauce. Bring soup to a boil, stirring, and add fish. ( If using smoked trout, no further cooking is necessary; if using finnan haddie or fresh fish, simmer, covered, 5 minutes, or until it just flakes.) Stir in parsley or dill. Soup may be made 2 days ahead (cool uncovered before chilling covered). Reheat gently.
ingredients: 10 ounce package frozen baby lima beans
1 pound finnan haddie (smoked haddock), cut into 1-inch pieces, or 2 smoked trout, skinned, boned, and flaked into 1-inch pieces, or fresh fillets of cod, haddock, halibut or snapper
3 tablespoons minced fresh parsley leaves or fresh dill
step_by_step_instructions: In a heavy kettle, cook 1 slice of chopped bacon over moderate heat, stirring, until crisp.
Add approximately 0.5 medium chopped onion and cook, stirring, until softened.
Peel and cut about 0.19 pounds of russet potatoes into 3/4-inch cubes.
Add the potatoes, 0.33 chopped celery rib, 0.25 cups chicken broth, and 0.25 cups water to the kettle and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.
Add approximately 1.67 ounces of frozen baby lima beans and 1.67 ounces of frozen corn and simmer, covered, for another 5 minutes.
In a small bowl, dissolve 0.33 teaspoons of cornstarch in 0.25 cups of half-and-half or milk.
Stir the cornstarch mixture into the simmering soup along with 0.25 teaspoons of Worcestershire sauce.
Bring the soup to a boil, stirring, and add about 0.33 pounds of finnan haddie or your choice of fish.
If using finnan haddie or fresh fish, simmer, covered, for 5 minutes, or until the fish just flakes. If using smoked trout, no further cooking is necessary.
Stir in approximately 0.5 tablespoons of minced fresh parsley leaves or fresh dill.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Prick the potatoes all over with a fork and roast them in the oven until tender, about 1 hour.
Being careful of the hot potatoes, split them and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. Add the butter and season with salt and a few twists of black pepper. Mash until the butter is melted and the potatoes are smooth. Keep warm until ready to serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Prick the potato all over with a fork and roast it in the oven until tender, about 1 hour.
Being careful of the hot potato, split it and scoop out the flesh into a bowl.
Add about 0.5 tablespoon of butter and season with a pinch of salt and a few twists of black pepper.
Mash until the butter is melted and the potato is smooth.
Keep warm until ready to serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Heat a pan with a few inches water over medium heat. Bring to a boil, season with salt, to taste, and add the bitter greens. Cook for a few minutes, then drain and reserve.
Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium to medium-high heat and add the andouille. Brown the crumbles or the chopped cooked sausage, then add the onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the stock and add the bitter greens. Heat through for a few minutes, then douse with vinegar, and season with sugar, salt, pepper and nutmeg, to taste. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve.
ingredients: 1 pound spicy, bitter greens such as mustard or dandelion greens
3/4 to 1 pound andouille sausage, chopped or crumbled, parcooked or fresh
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Heat a pan with a few inches of water over medium heat.
Bring the water to a boil, season with a pinch of salt.
Add about 4 ounces of bitter greens to the boiling water.
Cook the greens for a few minutes, then drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat 0.5 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil over medium to medium-high heat.
Add approximately 4 ounces of andouille sausage, chopped or crumbled.
Brown the sausage, then add 0.25 of a medium onion, chopped.
Cook until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in 2 tablespoons of chicken stock.
Add the drained bitter greens to the skillet.
Heat through for a few minutes.
Add 0.5 tablespoon of cider or wine vinegar to the skillet.
Season with a sprinkle of sugar, a pinch of salt, pepper, and freshly grated nutmeg to taste.
Transfer the contents to a serving bowl and serve.

original_instructions:
Soak the red onion in a small bowl of ice water, 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the kale, 1 tablespoon vinegar and a pinch of salt in a large bowl. Toss and rub with your fingers until the kale is dark green and softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Whisk the mayonnaise, buttermilk, garlic, dill and the remaining 1 tablespoon vinegar in a small bowl until smooth; season with salt and pepper. Drain the red onion, pat dry and add to the bowl with the kale; add the turkey, apple and half of the sunflower seeds. Drizzle with about three-quarters of the dressing and toss to coat; season with salt and pepper. Top with the remaining dressing, sunflower seeds and the avocado.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos
ingredients: 1/2 large bunch kale, stems removed, leaves chopped
1 avocado, peeled, pitted and thinly sliced
step_by_step_instructions: Soak about 10g of thinly sliced red onion in a small bowl of ice water for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine around 50g of chopped kale, 0.5 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar and a pinch of salt in a large bowl.
Toss and rub with your fingers until the kale is dark green and softened, about 3 to 5 minutes.

Whisk 0.5 tablespoon of mayonnaise, 0.33 tablespoon of buttermilk, a small portion of grated garlic, 1 teaspoon of chopped fresh dill and 0.5 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar in a small bowl until smooth.
Season the dressing with salt and freshly ground pepper.
Drain the red onion, pat dry and add to the bowl with the kale.
Add about 85g of chopped smoked deli turkey, a small portion of chopped apple, and 1 tablespoon of unsalted roasted sunflower seeds to the bowl.
Drizzle with about three-quarters of the prepared dressing and toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top the salad with the remaining dressing, sunflower seeds, and thinly sliced avocado.

original_instructions:
Put the potatoes in a pot, cover with water, and liberally add kosher salt. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to simmer gently until the potatoes can be easily pierced with a fork. Drain thoroughly and let cool.
Split the potatoes with a fork. In a skillet, bring the duck fat to the smoking point and add the potatoes. Do not move the potatoes until a golden crust has formed. Gently turn the potatoes to crisp them on all sides. Transfer to a plate and season with the Maldon salt.
This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant. The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results.
step_by_step_instructions: Peel 1 medium Yukon gold potato.
Put the potato in a pot, cover with water, and liberally add kosher salt.
Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to simmer gently until the potato can be easily pierced with a fork.
Drain thoroughly and let cool.
Split the potato with a fork.
In a skillet, bring approximately 0.5 cups of duck fat to the smoking point and add the potato.
Do not move the potato until a golden crust has formed.
Gently turn the potato to crisp it on all sides.
Transfer to a plate and season with Maldon salt.

recipe_title: Fried Green Plantains (Tostones De Platano Verde)
original_instructions:
Preheat oil in a fryer or Dutch oven to 365 degrees F.
Peel the plantains and cut into 1-inch pieces. Place into preheated oil and fry for 5 minutes or until they begin to brown. Drain them on a paper-towel lines plate. Flatten them using a Tostonera or the bottom of a metal can and fry again at 385 degrees F for approximately 3 minutes. Drain again and sprinkle with salt and Garlic Mojo. For softer fried plantains, soak for a few minutes in salted water after the first fry, drain and fry again.
Chop up the garlic very thinly or crush using a mortar and pestle or food processor with the salt to form a thick paste. In a mixing bowl, combine the garlic paste and juice, and let the mixture sit at room temperature for 30 minutes or longer.
ingredients: 1/2 cup sour orange juice or 1/4 cup sweet orange juice
plus 1/8 cup fresh lime or lemon juice
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oil in a fryer or Dutch oven to 365 degrees F.
Peel one plantain and cut into 1-inch pieces.
Place plantain pieces into preheated oil and fry for 5 minutes or until they begin to brown.
Drain them on a paper-towel lined plate.
Flatten the plantain pieces using a Tostonera or the bottom of a metal can.
Fry the flattened plantains again at 385 degrees F for approximately 3 minutes.
Drain them again and sprinkle with salt.
Chop or crush 2 garlic cloves with a mortar and pestle or food processor with salt to form a thick paste.
In a mixing bowl, combine the garlic paste with 2 tablespoons of sour orange juice, and let the mixture sit at room temperature for 30 minutes or longer.
Sprinkle the fried plantains with the prepared Garlic Mojo.

original_instructions:
Cook orzo in a large pot of boiling salted water until barely al dente, 5 to 6 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold water to stop cooking. Transfer orzo to a 2-quart heavy saucepan and add stock, zest, and thyme. Simmer over moderate heat, stirring constantly, until stock is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Stir in cheese, butter, salt, and pepper and serve immediately.
Cook orzo in a large pot of boiling salted water until barely al dente, 5 to 6 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold water to stop cooking.
Transfer orzo to a 2-quart heavy saucepan and add stock, zest, and thyme. Simmer over moderate heat, stirring constantly, until stock is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
Stir in cheese, butter, salt, and pepper and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 cups chicken stock or low-sodium broth
1 packed teaspoon finely grated fresh orange zest
step_by_step_instructions: Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a large pot, add 0.08 teaspoon of salt.
Add 2.67 oz orzo to the boiling water and cook until barely al dente, about 5 to 6 minutes.
Drain the orzo in a colander and rinse under cold water to stop cooking.
Transfer the orzo to a 2-quart heavy saucepan.
Add 0.33 cup chicken stock, 0.08 teaspoon fresh orange zest, and 0.01 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme to the saucepan with orzo.
Simmer over moderate heat, stirring constantly, until the stock is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
Stir in 0.17 oz Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, 0.33 tablespoon unsalted butter, 0.08 teaspoon salt, and 0.08 teaspoon black pepper.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Whisk together the paprika, ancho powder, brown sugar, cumin, garlic, canola oil, salt and pepper in a small bowl.
Place the shrimp in a large bowl, add the spice rub and stir well to coat each shrimp.
Heat your grill to high.
Skewer 1/2 the shrimp and place on a grill pan to cook until just cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in half of the green onions and transfer to a large platter or turnout onto brown paper bags. Wipe out the pan with paper towels, and repeat with the remaining ingredients.
ingredients: 2 pounds (21 to 24 count) large shrimp, shell on
1/2 cup thinly sliced green onion, divided
Special equipment: wooden skewers, soaked in water for about 25 minutes
step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together 0.5 tablespoon smoked sweet paprika, 0.25 tablespoon ancho chili powder, 0.25 tablespoon light brown sugar, 0.25 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 clove coarsely chopped fresh garlic, 0.5 tablespoon canola oil, 0.25 teaspoon kosher salt, and 0.13 teaspoon ground black pepper in a small bowl.
Place 4.5 ounces large shrimp in a large bowl, add the spice rub and stir well to coat each shrimp.
Heat your grill to high.
Skewer the shrimp and place on a grill pan to cook until just cooked through, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Stir in 0.5 tablespoon thinly sliced green onion and transfer to a platter.

original_instructions: Steam potatoes until just tender. Cool. Cut into 2 inch pieces. Steam cauliflower until just tender. Cool. Combine potatoes, cauliflower, and onion in large bowl. Whisk vinegar, garlic and cumin in small bowl. Gradually whisk in oil. Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add parsley and toss gently. Sprinkle with blue cheese.
step_by_step_instructions: Steam 1.5 pounds of purple potatoes until just tender. Let them cool.
Cut the cooled potatoes into 2-inch pieces.
Steam 1.5 cups of small cauliflower florets until just tender. Let them cool.
Combine the cut potatoes, steamed cauliflower, and 1/3 of a red onion (thinly sliced) in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together 1 tablespoon of white wine vinegar, 1/3 of a minced garlic clove, and a pinch of ground cumin seeds.
Gradually whisk in 2.5 tablespoons of olive oil into the vinegar mixture.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add 1/4 cup of chopped fresh Italian parsley and toss gently.
Sprinkle 1.5 ounces of blue cheese over the salad.

original_instructions:
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and cook the onions for 3 minutes, or until soft. Dissolve the vegetable bouillon in the water and add to the pot. Add the remaining ingredients to the pot and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are fork tender. Using an immersion blender or standing blender, puree all of the ingredients until smooth.
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and cook the onions for 3 minutes, or until soft.
Dissolve the vegetable bouillon in the water and add to the pot.
Add the remaining ingredients to the pot and stir to combine.
Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are fork tender.
Using an immersion blender or standing blender, puree all of the ingredients until smooth.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable bouillon, i like to use organic better than bouillon instead of the cubes
3 cups peeled and chopped carrots (about 8 medium carrots)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.25 tablespoon of olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Cook 0.2 of a small onion, chopped, for 3 minutes, or until soft.
Dissolve 0.4 tablespoon of vegetable bouillon in 1.25 cups of warm water and add to the pot.

Add 1 cup of chopped cauliflower, 0.75 cup of peeled and chopped carrots, 0.38 teaspoon of curry powder, 0.25 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 0.25 teaspoon of garam masala, and 0.25 teaspoon of salt to the pot and stir to combine.
Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are fork tender.
Using an immersion blender or standing blender, puree all of the ingredients until smooth.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a large oven pot with cover, coat with olive oil and sautee ginger, onions and garlic over medium heat. Add the greens and pack them in the pot. They will shrink big time in the oven. Season well and add the chicken stock and vinegar. Cover and place in oven for 45 minutes. Check after 20 minutes, verify flavor and stir.
PLATING Slice thick pieces of prime rib and place on top of a pile of mashers. Place a small mound of greens and sauce the plate.
Wine Recommendation: Bacchus, Cabernet Sauvignon, California, 1996
ingredients: 1 pound kale, prepped into 1 inch pieces
1 pound Swiss chard, prepped into 1 inch pieces
1 pound mustard greens, prepped into 1 inch pieces
Salt and black pepper to taste
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
In a large oven pot with a cover, coat with olive oil and sauté about 0.33 tablespoons of ginger, 0.17 onions, and 0.17 tablespoons of garlic over medium heat.
Add approximately 0.33 pounds of kale, 0.33 pounds of Swiss chard, and 0.33 pounds of mustard greens. Pack them in the pot.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Add about 0.17 cups of chicken stock and 0.04 cups of balsamic vinegar.
Cover the pot and place it in the oven for 45 minutes.
Check after 20 minutes, verify flavor and stir.

original_instructions:
Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan, add the onion, and cook until the onion softens, about 4 minutes. Add the rice and toast the grains, stirring occasionally, until the rice begins to look opaque (bright white), about 4 minutes. Add the water, butter, lemon slice, and lemon zest, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, slice off the tough ends of the asparagus stalks and discard them. Cut the spears on a diagonal into 1-inch lengths. Fill a large non-reactive pot with a steamer rack with 1/2 inch water, place the pot over medium heat, and bring the water to a simmer. Add the asparagus, cover, and cook until just tender, 4 to 5 minutes.
Transfer the cooked rice to a serving bowl and toss in the asparagus. Season with salt and pepper and serve.
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan.
Add 0.13 cup diced yellow onion and cook until the onion softens, about 4 minutes.
Add 0.38 cup long-grained white rice and toast the grains, stirring occasionally, until the rice begins to look opaque, about 4 minutes.
Add 0.75 cup water, 0.5 tablespoon unsalted butter, 0.33 inch thick lemon slice, and 0.25 teaspoon minced lemon zest.
Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, slice off the tough ends of 0.25 pound fresh asparagus stalks and discard them.
Cut the asparagus spears on a diagonal into 1-inch lengths.
Fill a large non-reactive pot with a steamer rack with 0.13 inch water, place the pot over medium heat, and bring the water to a simmer.
Add the asparagus, cover, and cook until just tender, 4 to 5 minutes.
Transfer the cooked rice to a serving bowl and toss in the asparagus.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

original_instructions:
Prepare a grill or griddle for medium-high heat.
Add the beef, salt and pepper to a medium bowl and mix to combine. Divide the beef into 8 equal portions, then form each portion into a patty a little larger in diameter than the buns.
Cook the patties for 3 minutes or so (if using a griddle, do this in batches to avoid crowding). Flip with a spatula, add 2 slices of cheese to each and cook until the cheese melts and the burgers are cooked to medium, 3 to 5 minutes more.
Transfer the burgers to the buns and serve immediately with tomato slices, lettuce, red onions and pickles.
ingredients: 16 small slices Colby Jack cheese (about 2 inches square)
For serving: tomato slices, lettuce leaves, red onion slices and dill pickle rounds
step_by_step_instructions: Prepare a grill or griddle for medium-high heat.
Add approximately 0.13 lb of ground beef, 0.13 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 0.03 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper to a medium bowl and mix to combine.
Form the beef mixture into a patty slightly larger than a slider bun.
Cook the patty for about 3 minutes on the grill or griddle. If using a griddle, do this in batches to avoid crowding.
Flip the patty with a spatula, add 2 small slices of Colby Jack cheese, and cook for an additional 3 to 5 minutes or until the cheese melts and the burger is cooked to medium.
Transfer the burger to a pretzel slider bun.
Serve immediately with a slice of tomato, a leaf of lettuce, a slice of red onion, and a round of dill pickle.

original_instructions:
Heat olive oil in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and brown chicken. Remove chicken and set aside.
Add tomatoes to same skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, 6 minutes. Add wine and cook 1 minute. Stir in sauce. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, then return chicken to skillet. Simmer covered 5 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Stir in basil. To serve, arrange chicken on platter and spoon hot sauce over chicken. Serve, if desired, with hot cooked pasta or rice.
ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves (about 1-1/4 lbs.)
1/3 cup dry white wine or chicken broth
1 Tbsp. thinly sliced fresh basil leaves (optional)
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.25 tablespoon olive oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and brown 1 chicken breast half. Remove the chicken and set aside.
Add 1 chopped plum tomato to the same skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, for 6 minutes.
Add about 0.08 cup white wine or chicken broth and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in approximately 0.25 cup Alfredo sauce and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low, then return the chicken to the skillet.
Simmer covered for 5 minutes or until the chicken is thoroughly cooked.
Stir in about 0.25 tablespoon thinly sliced fresh basil leaves.
To serve, arrange the chicken on a platter and spoon the hot sauce over the chicken.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the ground chicken, 1 teaspoon salt, cumin, fennel seeds, oregano, and chili powder. Cook, stirring frequently, until the chicken is cooked through, about 8 minutes. Stir the flour into the chicken mixture. Add the beans, Swiss chard, corn, and chicken stock. Bring the mixture to a simmer, scraping up the brown bits that cling to the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Simmer for 55-60 minutes until the liquid has reduced by about half and the chili has thickened. Add the red pepper flakes and simmer for another 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Ladle the chili into serving bowls. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon salt, plus more for seasoning
2 (15-ounce cans) cannellini or other white beans, rinsed and drained
1 bunch (about 1 pound) Swiss chard, stems removed, leaves chopped into 1-inch pieces
Freshly ground black pepper for seasoning
step_by_step_instructions: In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan or Dutch oven, heat 0.5 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add 0.25 of a large onion, chopped, and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add 1 garlic clove, minced, and cook for 30 seconds.
Add 0.25 pound of ground chicken, 0.25 teaspoon salt, 0.5 tablespoon ground cumin, 0.25 tablespoon fennel seeds, 0.25 tablespoon dried oregano, and 0.5 teaspoon chili powder.
Cook, stirring frequently, until the chicken is cooked through, about 8 minutes.
Stir 0.75 tablespoon of flour into the chicken mixture.
Add 0.5 (15-ounce) can of cannellini beans, rinsed and drained, 0.25 pound of Swiss chard, stems removed, leaves chopped into 1-inch pieces, and 0.375 cup of frozen corn, thawed.
Add 1 cup of low-sodium chicken stock.
Bring the mixture to a simmer, scraping up the brown bits that cling to the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
Simmer for 55-60 minutes until the liquid has reduced by about half and the chili has thickened.
Add 0.06 teaspoon of crushed red pepper flakes and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.
Ladle the chili into a serving bowl.
Sprinkle with 0.125 cup of grated Parmesan cheese and 0.06 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley.

recipe_title: Smoked Salmon and Asian Cucumber Salad Rolls
original_instructions:
In a bowl toss cucumber julienne with remaining ingredients and season with salt and pepper. Chill at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.;
Trim the smoked salmon slices to form about 40 strips approximately 2x4-inches each. Lay a bundle of cucumber strips (shake off excess dressing) at one end and roll up securely. Place seam side down on a tray, cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Garnish with sesame seeds.;
ingredients: 1 cucumber (preferably English) peeled, seeded if necessary and cut into 2-inch julienne strips
2 teaspoons finely grated, peeled fresh ginger
2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted lightly and cooled
Salt and freshly ground white pepper, to taste
Toasted white and black sesame seeds for garnish
12 ounces smoked salmon, sliced paper thin
step_by_step_instructions: Peel and cut approximately one-sixth of a cucumber (preferably English) into 2-inch julienne strips.
In a bowl, toss about 30 grams of cucumber julienne with 1 tablespoon seasoned rice vinegar, 0.08 teaspoon Asian sesame oil, and 0.33 teaspoon finely grated, peeled fresh ginger.
Add 0.33 teaspoon sesame seeds and 1 teaspoon finely chopped scallions to the bowl.
Season the mixture with a pinch of sugar, salt, and freshly ground white pepper to taste.
Chill the cucumber mixture in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.
Trim about 3 ounces of smoked salmon into strips approximately 2x4-inches.
Lay a small bundle of cucumber strips at one end of each salmon strip and roll up securely.
Place the rolls seam side down on a tray, cover tightly with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Garnish with toasted white and black sesame seeds before serving.

original_instructions: Place beans and garlic in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a simmer and cook until the beans are tender, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours. When the beans are tender, stir in the coconut milk, green onions, Scotch bonnet, and thyme, and increase the heat to a boil. Stir in the rice, add some salt and pepper, cover the pot, and cook until the rice is tender and has absorbed most of the liquid. Transfer to a large serving bowl, taste for seasoning, adding more salt and pepper if needed, and garnish with sliced green onions.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dried red kidney beans, soaked overnight and drained
3 green onions, thinly sliced, plus more for garnish
step_by_step_instructions: Place 0.38 cups of dried red kidney beans and 0.5 cloves of smashed garlic in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water.
Bring to a simmer and cook until the beans are tender, about 1 to 1.5 hours.

When the beans are tender, stir in 0.13 cups of unsweetened coconut milk, 0.75 tablespoons of thinly sliced green onions, 0.25 tablespoons of chopped Scotch bonnet, and 0.75 sprigs of fresh thyme, and increase the heat to a boil.
Stir in 0.38 cups of long grain rice, add some salt and pepper, cover the pot, and cook until the rice is tender and has absorbed most of the liquid.
Transfer to a large serving bowl, taste for seasoning, adding more salt and pepper if needed, and garnish with sliced green onions.

original_instructions: Heat the olive oil in a saute pan over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add red pepper and saute until softened. Add broccoli rabe and hot pepper flakes, and coat with oil. Add broth, cover pan and cook until rabe is tender, about 4 more minutes.;
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips
1 1/2 pounds broccoli rabe, hollow stems trimmed, blanched, and drained
1/2 to 3/4 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes
step_by_step_instructions: Heat 0.33 tablespoons of olive oil in a saute pan over medium high heat.
Add 0.5 smashed garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute.
Add 1.8 ounces of red bell pepper strips and saute until softened.
Add 4 ounces of broccoli rabe and 0.1 teaspoons of dried hot red pepper flakes, and coat with oil.
Add 0.17 cups of chicken broth, cover pan and cook until rabe is tender, about 4 more minutes.

original_instructions: Separate the pods from the stalks. Place bean pods in a large bowl. Sprinkle generously with salt, rub vigorously, and let stand 15 minutes. Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil, add the beans and boil over high heat for 5 to 6 minutes. (For a firmer bean, decrease the cooking time.) Don't cover the pot or the beans will lose their bright green color. When ready, drain beans and serve hot or at room temperature. To eat as finger food, serve the beans in baskets or bowls. Squeeze the pods with your fingers to press the beans into your mouth and discard the pods.
ingredients: 1/2 pound young green soybeans (about 4 cups of pods), fresh or frozen
step_by_step_instructions: Separate approximately 1 cup of pods from the stalks.
Place the bean pods in a large bowl.
Sprinkle generously with about 0.5 tablespoon salt, rub vigorously, and let stand for 15 minutes.
Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil.
Add the beans and boil over high heat for 5 to 6 minutes for a softer bean or less for a firmer bean.
Do not cover the pot to maintain the beans' bright green color.
Drain the beans when ready.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
Slice the plantains 3/4 inch thick on the diagonal. Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons each butter and vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, cook the plantains until golden, about 5 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels, reserving the skillet.
Put the flour in a shallow dish. Whisk the milk, egg, allspice and cayenne in another dish. Lightly crush the fried onions into a third dish. Dredge the plantains in the flour, dip in the milk mixture, then press into the fried onions, turning to coat.
Heat the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons each butter and vegetable oil in the reserved skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, fry the plantains until golden and crisp, about 1 minute per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve with the hot sauce.
Photograph by Andrew Mccaul
step_by_step_instructions: Slice 0.5 large plantain 3/4 inch thick on the diagonal.
Heat 0.75 tablespoon unsalted butter and 0.75 tablespoon vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the plantain slices until golden, about 5 minutes per side.
Drain the cooked plantains on paper towels and reserve the skillet.
Put 0.09 cup all-purpose flour in a shallow dish.
Whisk 0.09 cup milk, 0.25 large egg, 0.03 teaspoon ground allspice, and 0.02 teaspoon cayenne pepper in another dish.
Lightly crush 0.44 cup fried onions into a third dish.
Dredge the plantains in the flour, dip in the milk mixture, then press into the fried onions, turning to coat.
Heat remaining 0.75 tablespoon unsalted butter and 0.75 tablespoon vegetable oil in the reserved skillet over medium heat.
Fry the plantain slices until golden and crisp, about 1 minute per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve with hot sauce.

original_instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Melt butter in glass baking dish. Lightly flatten chicken breasts between plastic wrap with mallet. Lay 1 slice of ham and 1 piece of cheese on flattened breast, fold in half and seal close with toothpicks. Repeat process for remaining chicken breasts. Coat each piece with flour, then eggs and then bread crumbs. Place chicken pieces in glass baking dish. Turn to coat with butter. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with parselyed rice and steamed broccoli.
ingredients: 6 ounces Lorraine swiss cheese, cut into four chunks
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a glass baking dish.
Lightly flatten 1 chicken breast between plastic wrap with a mallet.
Lay 1 slice (0.5 ounce) of ham and 1.5 ounces of Lorraine swiss cheese on the flattened breast, fold the breast in half and seal it closed with toothpicks.
Coat the folded chicken breast with 0.25 cup of flour, then dip it in 0.5 beaten egg, and finally coat it with 0.5 cup of bread crumbs.
Place the chicken piece in the glass baking dish and turn it to coat with the melted butter.
Bake for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve with parsleyed rice and steamed broccoli.
processed_ingredients: 1.00 boneless, skinless breast of chicken (approximately 6 ounces)

recipe_title: Red Wine Roast Chicken (Poulet Roti Au Vin Rouge)
original_instructions:
Mix together the wine, tomato paste, thyme, marjoram, and vinegar. Season the chicken with plenty of salt and pepper, then place in a resealable bag with the wine mixture. Shake the bag to make sure each piece is well coated. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight.
Place the potatoes in a saucepan of cold water, cover, and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 to 2 minutes, then drain in a colander.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Arrange the onions, carrots, and cooked potatoes in a large baking dish or tray and pour in the water.
Arrange the chicken pieces, skin-side up, in a layer on top of the vegetables in the dish. Pour the marinade over the chicken. Cover with a sheet of parchment or foil and roast for 30 minutes. Remove the parchment and baste the chicken with the cooking liquid. Roast, uncovered, for another 15 minutes, or until the skin is crisp. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 sprigs marjoram, leaves picked, or 1/2 teaspoon dried
1 whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces (about 3 1/2 pounds)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
step_by_step_instructions: Mix together 2 tablespoons red wine, 1.5 tablespoons tomato paste, a few thyme leaves, a few marjoram leaves, and 1.5 tablespoons red wine vinegar.

Season a single chicken piece with salt and pepper, then place it in a resealable bag with the wine mixture. Shake the bag to coat the chicken piece well. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight.
Place about 2.25 ounces of baby potatoes in a saucepan of cold water, cover, and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 to 2 minutes, then drain in a colander.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Arrange about a quarter of an onion, a quarter of a carrot, and the cooked potatoes in a small baking dish or tray and pour in 1 tablespoon of water.
Place the chicken piece, skin-side up, on top of the vegetables in the dish.
Pour the marinade over the chicken.
Cover with a sheet of parchment or foil and roast for 30 minutes.
Remove the parchment and baste the chicken with the cooking liquid.
Roast, uncovered, for another 15 minutes, or until the skin is crisp.
Serve immediately.

recipe_title: Shrimp with Tomatoes, Basil, and Garlic
original_instructions:
In a medium bowl, combine the tomatoes and basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside while you saute the shrimp.
Put the shrimp in a pie pan and pat them completely dry with a paper towel. Arrange the shrimp so they lay flat and are evenly spaced in the pan.
Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Season one side of the shrimp with salt and pepper; add the oil to the pan and turn the heat to high. Invert the pie pan over the skillet so the shrimp fall into the pan all at once.
Saute the shrimp, undisturbed, until they turn golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic to the pan. Turn the shrimp over with tongs. Turn the heat off and cook the shrimp for 1 minute in the residual heat of the pan. Shake the pan to combine the shrimp with the garlic and then transfer them to the bowl with the tomato mixture. Toss to combine. Serve hot or at room temperature.
ingredients: 1/2 cup quartered vine-ripened grape or cherry tomatoes
2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh basil leaves
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
6 ounces medium-large shrimp, shelled and deveined
step_by_step_instructions: In a medium bowl, combine 0.25 cup of quartered tomatoes and 1 teaspoon of finely chopped basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside while you saute the shrimp.
Put 3 ounces of shrimp in a pie pan and pat them completely dry with a paper towel. Arrange the shrimp so they lay flat and are evenly spaced in the pan.
Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Season one side of the shrimp with salt and pepper; add 1 teaspoon of oil to the pan and turn the heat to high.
Invert the pie pan over the skillet so the shrimp fall into the pan all at once.
Saute the shrimp, undisturbed, until they turn golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes.
Add 0.25 small clove of minced garlic to the pan.
Turn the shrimp over with tongs.
Turn the heat off and cook the shrimp for 1 minute in the residual heat of the pan.
Shake the pan to combine the shrimp with the garlic and then transfer them to the bowl with the tomato mixture.
Toss to combine. Serve hot or at room temperature.

original_instructions:
In a heavy kettle ( at least 5 quarts) cook bacon over moderate heat, stirring, until crisp. Add onions and cook, stirring, until softened. Peel potatoes and cut into 3/4-inch cubes. Add potatoes, celery, broth, and water and simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Add lima beans and corn and simmer, covered, 5 minutes.
In a small bowl dissolve cornstarch in half -and-half or milk and stir into simmering soup with Worcestershire sauce. Bring soup to a boil, stirring, and add fish. ( If using smoked trout, no further cooking is necessary; if using finnan haddie or fresh fish, simmer, covered, 5 minutes, or until it just flakes.) Stir in parsley or dill. Soup may be made 2 days ahead (cool uncovered before chilling covered). Reheat gently.
ingredients: 10 ounce package frozen baby lima beans
1 pound finnan haddie (smoked haddock), cut into 1-inch pieces, or 2 smoked trout, skinned, boned, and flaked into 1-inch pieces, or fresh fillets of cod, haddock, halibut or snapper
3 tablespoons minced fresh parsley leaves or fresh dill
step_by_step_instructions: Cook 0.5 sliced bacon (approximately 0.2 oz) in a heavy kettle over moderate heat, stirring, until crisp.
Add 0.25 medium chopped onion (approximately 1 oz) and cook, stirring, until softened.
Peel 0.4 pounds of russet potato and cut into 3/4-inch cubes.
Add 0.4 pounds of potato, 0.2 chopped celery rib (approximately 0.5 oz), 0.38 cups chicken broth, and 0.38 cups water to the kettle and simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.
Add 2 oz frozen baby lima beans and 2 oz frozen corn to the kettle and simmer, covered, for another 5 minutes.
In a small bowl, dissolve 0.25 teaspoon cornstarch in 0.38 cups half-and-half or milk.
Stir the cornstarch mixture into the simmering soup with 0.25 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce.
Bring soup to a boil, stirring continuously.
Add 0.25 pounds smoked haddock cut into 1-inch pieces and simmer, covered, for 5 minutes, or until the fish just flakes.
Stir in 0.5 tablespoons minced fresh parsley leaves.
Serve immediately or cool and store for up to 2 days. Reheat gently before serving.

original_instructions:
Stir together soy sauce, water, lime juice, ginger, sugar, and scallion. Coarsely crush peppercorns and coriander with a mortar and pestle or heavy skillet. Sprinkle tuna with 3/4 tsp salt, then press spice mixture evenly all over fish. Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then sear tuna, turning once, about 6 minutes for medium-rare. Serve with dipping sauce.
Stir together soy sauce, water, lime juice, ginger, sugar, and scallion.
Coarsely crush peppercorns and coriander with a mortar and pestle or heavy skillet. Sprinkle tuna with 3/4 tsp salt, then press spice mixture evenly all over fish.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then sear tuna, turning once, about 6 minutes for medium-rare.
Serve with dipping sauce.
step_by_step_instructions: Stir together 0.75 tablespoons soy sauce, 0.5 tablespoons water, 0.25 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 0.125 teaspoons grated peeled ginger, 0.125 teaspoons sugar, and 0.25 tablespoons scallion.
Coarsely crush 0.42 teaspoons black peppercorns, 0.08 teaspoons white peppercorns, and 0.17 teaspoons coriander seeds with a mortar and pestle or a heavy skillet.
Sprinkle 0.13 teaspoons salt evenly over 0.5 pounds tuna steak, then press the spice mixture evenly all over the fish.
Heat 0.33 tablespoons vegetable oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers.
Sear the tuna, turning once, about 3 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Serve the tuna steak with the prepared dipping sauce.

original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Salt the water and add the pasta. Cook to al dente and drain.
Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the anchovy paste and let it melt into the oil. Add the onions and bay leaf and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
